summary.en: CO is a common abbreviation that can mean Colorado, company, carbon monoxide, or commanding officer, depending on context.
summary.zh: CO 是常见缩写，可能表示科罗拉多州、公司、一氧化碳或指挥官，需结合语境判断。

definition.en: (abbrev.) Colorado, a state in the western United States (postal abbreviation: CO).
definition.zh: （缩写）美国科罗拉多州（邮政缩写：CO）。

examples.en: She moved to Denver, CO for a new job.
examples.zh: 她为了新工作搬到了科罗拉多州丹佛市（Denver, CO）。

examples.en: The conference will be held in Boulder, CO.
examples.zh: 会议将在科罗拉多州博尔德市（Boulder, CO）举行。

definition.en: (abbrev., business) company; used in names and addresses (e.g., Co., or co.).
definition.zh: （缩写，商业）公司；常用于公司名称或地址中（如 Co. 或 co.）。

examples.en: He works at Smith & Co.
examples.zh: 他在史密斯公司（Smith & Co.）工作。

examples.en: Please send the package to ABC Co., 10 Main Street.
examples.zh: 请把包裹寄到 ABC 公司，主街10号。

definition.en: (abbrev., chemistry) carbon monoxide, a poisonous gas (chemical formula: CO).
definition.zh: （缩写，化学）一氧化碳，有毒气体（化学式：CO）。

examples.en: A faulty heater can produce CO in an enclosed room.
examples.zh: 故障取暖器在封闭房间里可能产生一氧化碳（CO）。

examples.en: Install a CO detector to reduce the risk of poisoning.
examples.zh: 安装一氧化碳（CO）报警器以降低中毒风险。

definition.en: (abbrev., work/military) commanding officer; the person in charge of a unit or ship.
definition.zh: （缩写，工作/军队）指挥官；负责某个单位或舰船的人。

examples.en: The CO approved the training schedule.
examples.zh: 指挥官（CO）批准了训练计划。

examples.en: Report to the CO after the briefing.
examples.zh: 简报结束后向指挥官（CO）汇报。

extraExplanation: “CO”是高度多义的缩写，最常见的理解取决于语境：地址/州名里多指科罗拉多州；公司名称里常写作“Co.”；安全与化学话题里多指一氧化碳；军事/警务语境里常指“commanding officer”。
写作提示：表示“公司”时更常见的是“Co.”（带点）；表示化学式“一氧化碳”通常写“CO”（大写且不加点）。

summary.en: “Co” is commonly used as the prefix co- (“together”), as Co. meaning “company,” or as CO meaning “carbon monoxide.”
summary.zh: “Co”常见用法包括：作前缀 co- 表示“共同”；作 Co. 表示“公司”；作 CO 表示“一氧化碳”。

definition.en: a prefix meaning “together,” “with,” or “jointly,” used to form words like co-worker or co-author
definition.zh: 前缀，表示“共同、一起、联合”，用于构成如 co-worker（同事）、co-author（合著者）等词

examples.en: She is my co-worker at the hospital.
examples.zh: 她是我在医院的同事。

examples.en: He co-wrote the book with his sister.
examples.zh: 他和妹妹一起合写了这本书。

definition.en: short for “company” in business names (often written as Co.)
definition.zh: （常写作 Co.）company 的缩写，表示“公司”，多用于公司名称中

examples.en: I work for Smith & Co.
examples.zh: 我在 Smith & Co.（史密斯公司）工作。

examples.en: The invoice is from Taylor Co.
examples.zh: 这张发票来自 Taylor 公司。

definition.en: short for “carbon monoxide” (chemical formula CO)
definition.zh: 一氧化碳的缩写（化学式 CO）

examples.en: A CO detector can help prevent poisoning.
examples.zh: 一氧化碳报警器可以帮助预防中毒。

extraExplanation: co- 这个前缀来自拉丁语 com- / con-，表示“在一起”。在英语里常见于合作或共享关系：cooperate（合作）、coordinate（协调）、coexist（共存）。
书写上，co- 有时带连字符（co-worker），有时不带（cooperate）。是否加连字符常取决于词典或出版风格。

summary.en: “co” is most commonly the prefix “co-” meaning “together/jointly,” and it can also be an abbreviation for company (Co.), Colorado (CO), or carbon monoxide (CO).
summary.zh: “co”最常见是前缀“co-”，表示“共同/一起”；也可作缩写，表示公司（Co.）、科罗拉多州（CO）或一氧化碳（CO）。

definition.en: (prefix) Together; jointly; shared with another person or group.
definition.zh: （前缀）一起；共同；与他人共享/合作的。

examples.en: They are co-founders of the startup.
examples.zh: 他们是这家初创公司的共同创办人。

examples.en: We co-author a paper every year.
examples.zh: 我们每年都会共同撰写一篇论文。

examples.en: Co-workers should communicate clearly.
examples.zh: 同事之间应该清晰沟通。

definition.en: (abbrev.) company (used in business names and addresses).
definition.zh: （缩写）公司（常用于公司名称或地址中）。

examples.en: I work for a small co. in Seattle.
examples.zh: 我在西雅图的一家小公司工作。

examples.en: Please send the invoice to ABC Co.
examples.zh: 请把发票寄给 ABC 公司。

definition.en: (abbrev.) Colorado (a U.S. state; postal abbreviation: CO).
definition.zh: （缩写）美国科罗拉多州（邮政缩写：CO）。

examples.en: She moved to CO for a new job.
examples.zh: 她为了新工作搬去了科罗拉多州。

definition.en: (abbrev.) carbon monoxide, a poisonous gas (chemical formula: CO).
definition.zh: （缩写）一氧化碳（化学式：CO），一种有毒气体。

examples.en: A CO alarm can help keep your home safe.
examples.zh: 一氧化碳报警器可以帮助保障家庭安全。

examples.en: CO poisoning can happen if ventilation is poor.
examples.zh: 通风不良时可能发生一氧化碳中毒。

extraExplanation: “co-”作前缀时，常用连字符：co-worker / co-founder；但有些词已固定不加连字符：cooperate / coordinate。写作时以词典或公司/媒体风格指南为准。
“Co.”表示company时通常要大写并带句点；美国州名缩写“CO”通常全大写且不加句点。化学式“CO”也通常全大写。

summary.en: A co-acceptor is an additional acceptor that works alongside another acceptor to help receive electrons/charge, often in chemistry, photovoltaics, or semiconductor doping.
summary.zh: co-acceptor 指与另一受体共同作用的“额外受体”，用来帮助接受电子/电荷，常见于化学、光伏或半导体掺杂等语境。

definition.en: A substance or molecule that works together with an acceptor to receive electrons (or charge) in a reaction or system, especially in chemistry and materials science.
definition.zh: （尤用于化学与材料科学）与“受体”一起作用、共同接受电子（或电荷）的物质或分子。

examples.en: In this dye-sensitized system, a co-acceptor helps pull electrons away, reducing energy loss.
examples.zh: 在这种染料敏化体系中，共受体有助于把电子拉走，从而减少能量损失。

examples.en: Adding a co-acceptor can improve charge separation and increase efficiency.
examples.zh: 加入共受体可以改善电荷分离并提高效率。

definition.en: In semiconductor doping, an additional acceptor-type dopant added alongside the main acceptor to adjust carrier concentration or electrical properties.
definition.zh: （半导体掺杂）与主要受体掺杂剂一起加入的“辅助受体”掺杂剂，用于调节载流子浓度或电学性质。

examples.en: A co-acceptor was introduced to fine-tune the p-type conductivity.
examples.zh: 研究人员引入共受体来微调 p 型导电性。

examples.en: The co-acceptor compensates defects and stabilizes the material’s electrical behavior.
examples.zh: 共受体可以补偿缺陷并稳定材料的电学表现。

extraExplanation:
这个词通常出现在较专业的语境里：
- 在有机光伏/染料敏化太阳能电池等领域，“acceptor（受体）/donor（给体）”描述电子在材料之间的转移；“co-acceptor”强调“共同参与接受电子或促进电荷转移的第二个受体”。
- 在半导体里，“acceptor”指让材料更偏“p 型”的掺杂；“co-acceptor”常表示额外加入、用来调控电性或补偿缺陷的受体型掺杂剂。
写作中常见搭配：introduce/add a co-acceptor（引入/加入共受体）, co-acceptor doping（共受体掺杂）, donor–acceptor–co-acceptor system（给体-受体-共受体体系）。

summary.en: Co-accession means joining at the same time as someone/something else, or (in biology/genetics) two traits/markers appearing together.
summary.zh: co-accession 指“与他人/他方同时加入（或就任）”，在生物/遗传语境中也可指两个性状或标记“共同出现/共同遗传”。

definition.en: the act of joining or being admitted at the same time as another person, group, or entity; simultaneous accession
definition.zh: 与他人/他方同时加入、就任或被接纳；同时加入（或同时继位）

examples.en: The two countries agreed on co-accession to the trade pact so their tariffs would change on the same date.
examples.zh: 两国同意同时加入该贸易协定，以便关税在同一天调整。

examples.en: The report discusses co-accession of multiple institutions to a shared research network.
examples.zh: 报告讨论了多家机构同时加入一个共享科研网络的情况。

definition.en: (biology/genetics) the joint presence, inheritance, or observation of two traits, markers, or genetic variants together in the same sample or lineage
definition.zh: （生物/遗传）两个性状、标记或遗传变异在同一样本或谱系中共同出现、共同遗传或被同时观察到

examples.en: Researchers tested whether co-accession of the two markers predicts disease risk more accurately.
examples.zh: 研究人员测试这两个标记的共同出现是否能更准确地预测患病风险。

examples.en: Co-accession was rare, suggesting the variants may be inherited independently.
examples.zh: 共同出现很少，提示这些变异可能是独立遗传的。

extraExplanation: “co-”表示“共同/同时”。“accession”在政治语境常指“加入（条约/组织）”或“继位”；在科研语境里也常见于“accession number（登录号）”。因此“co-accession”会根据领域不同而偏向“同时加入/共同出现”的含义。
该词相对少见，正式写作中也常用更常见的表达替代，如 simultaneous accession（同时加入）、joint accession（共同加入）、co-occurrence（共同出现，偏科研）。

summary.en: A co-actor is an actor you perform with in the same production.
summary.zh: co-actor 指在同一作品中与你一起表演的演员。

definition.en: A fellow actor who performs with another actor in the same film, TV show, play, or scene.
definition.zh: （电影/电视剧/舞台剧中）与某位演员一起表演的“同剧演员、合作演员”。

examples.en: She thanked her co-actors in her acceptance speech.
examples.zh: 她在获奖感言中感谢了同剧演员们。

examples.en: He has great chemistry with his co-actor in the new drama.
examples.zh: 他和新剧里的合作演员很有默契。

extraExplanation: “Co-”这个前缀表示“共同、一起”（如 co-worker 同事，co-founder 共同创办人）。因此 co-actor 强调“同一作品中一起演出的演员”。
常见拼写有 co-actor（带连字符）和 coactor（不带连字符）；日常写作中带连字符更清晰。

summary.en: Co-actors are actors who perform together in the same production; it can also mean people who jointly take part in shaping a situation.
summary.zh: Co-actors 指在同一作品中一起演出的演员；也可引申为共同参与并影响某种局面的人。

definition.en: an actor who performs together with another actor in the same movie, play, or TV show
definition.zh: （与另一位演员）在同一部电影、戏剧或电视剧中一起演出的演员；同台演员

examples.en: She became close friends with her co-actors during filming.
examples.zh: 她在拍摄期间和同剧的演员们成了好朋友。

examples.en: The director asked the co-actors to rehearse the scene again.
examples.zh: 导演让同台演员们把那场戏再排练一遍。

examples.en: He thanked his co-actors in his award speech.
examples.zh: 他在获奖感言中感谢了同剧的演员们。

definition.en: (figurative) people who take part in the same event or situation and influence what happens
definition.zh: （比喻）共同参与某件事或某种局面、并影响结果的人

examples.en: In this project, the managers and engineers are co-actors shaping the final product.
examples.zh: 在这个项目里，经理和工程师都是共同推动最终产品的参与者。

examples.en: History is made by many co-actors, not just one hero.
examples.zh: 历史是由许多共同参与者创造的，而不只是一个英雄。

extraExplanation: “co-”表示“共同、一起”（例如 co-worker 同事）。因此 co-actor 强调“和你一起演的人”。在娱乐新闻里更常见的近义词是 “co-star”（搭档主演/同剧演员）。
拼写上常见 co-actor（带连字符）或 coactor（不带连字符）；复数是 co-actors。

summary.en: Co-adaptation is mutual adjustment—especially in biology—where two interacting organisms or parts evolve or change in response to each other.
summary.zh: co-adaptation 指“共同适应/共同调适”，尤其用于生物学，强调相互作用的双方在彼此影响下进行调整或进化。

definition.en: A process in which two or more species (or interacting parts of an organism) evolve or adjust in response to each other, so they work better together.
definition.zh: （生物学）共同适应：两个或多个物种（或生物体内相互作用的部分）在相互影响下进化或调整，从而更好地协同运作。

examples.en: Bees and flowers show co-adaptation: bees get nectar, and flowers get pollinated.
examples.zh: 蜜蜂和花体现了共同适应：蜜蜂获得花蜜，花则完成授粉。

examples.en: The tight fit between a parasite and its host can be the result of long-term co-adaptation.
examples.zh: 寄生虫与宿主之间高度“匹配”的关系，可能是长期共同适应的结果。

definition.en: A mutual adjustment between people, groups, or parts of a system so they can function well together (less common outside scientific/technical writing).
definition.zh: （引申/较少见）共同调适：人、群体或系统各部分之间相互调整，以便更顺畅地一起运作。

examples.en: Successful teamwork often requires co-adaptation to each other’s working styles.
examples.zh: 成功的团队合作往往需要对彼此的工作方式进行共同调适。

examples.en: In a new school, students and teachers go through a period of co-adaptation.
examples.zh: 在新学校里，学生和老师都会经历一段共同调适的时期。

extraExplanation: 词形提示：co- 表示“共同、一起”，adaptation 表示“适应”。合在一起强调“相互影响、相互调整”，而不只是单方面的适应。
相关概念区分：co-adaptation 常与 coevolution（协同进化）一起出现。coevolution 更强调基因层面、跨世代的进化变化；co-adaptation 更强调“彼此配合的适应”，可以用于描述结果或过程。

summary.en: Co-adapted means “mutually adapted to fit/work well together.”
summary.zh: co-adapted 指“相互适应、彼此配合良好（共同匹配）”。

definition.en: (Of two or more things) adapted to work well together; shaped by use or evolution so they fit each other.
definition.zh: （指两个或多个事物）共同适应的；彼此配合良好、相互匹配的（常因长期使用或演化而形成）。

examples.en: The app and the website are co-adapted, so your data syncs smoothly between them.
examples.zh: 这个应用和网站是共同适应的，所以你的数据能在它们之间顺畅同步。

examples.en: In biology class, we learned how some flowers and insects are co-adapted.
examples.zh: 在生物课上，我们学到一些花和昆虫是共同适应的。

extraExplanation: “co-”表示“共同、一起”；“adapted”表示“适应的、调整过的”。合起来的“co-adapted”常见于生物学（共演化、相互适应）或系统/设计领域（组件协同匹配）。
在学术写作里也常见同义表达：*mutually adapted*（相互适应的）、*well-matched*（很匹配的）、*co-evolved*（共同演化的，偏生物学）。

summary.en: Co-administer means to give or use two treatments at the same time, or to manage something jointly with others.
summary.zh: co-administer 指两种治疗/药物同时使用（合用），也可指与他人共同管理或执行某事。

definition.en: To give (a medicine or treatment) at the same time as another medicine or treatment.
definition.zh: （与另一种药物/治疗）同时给予、合用（药物或治疗）。

examples.en: Do not co-administer this drug with alcohol.
examples.zh: 不要将这种药物与酒精同时服用。

examples.en: The vaccine may be co-administered with the flu shot.
examples.zh: 该疫苗可与流感疫苗同时接种。

definition.en: To administer or manage something together with another person or group; to co-manage.
definition.zh: 与他人共同管理、共同执行（某事）。

examples.en: The program is co-administered by the university and the city government.
examples.zh: 该项目由大学与市政府共同管理。

examples.en: Two departments co-administer the scholarship fund.
examples.zh: 两个部门共同管理该奖学金基金。

extraExplanation: 在医学语境中，co-administer 常出现在说明书、临床试验或处方信息里，强调“与其他药物同时使用”可能带来药物相互作用（drug interactions），因此常见搭配有：co-administer with + 药物/物质。
拼写上常见 coadminister / co-administer / co-administered（英美用法都能见到）；在正式写作里带连字符（co-administer）更常见、更清晰。

summary.en: A person who shares administrative responsibility with someone else.
summary.zh: 与他人共同承担管理职责的人。

definition.en: A person who shares the duties and authority of an administrator with one or more others (for example, managing an organization, project, program, or an estate together).
definition.zh: 与他人共同分担管理职责与权限的管理者（例如共同管理组织、项目、计划或遗产等）。

examples.en: She served as co-administrator of the grant program, handling budgets while her colleague managed reporting.
examples.zh: 她担任该资助项目的共同管理员，负责预算；同事负责报告工作。

examples.en: The court appointed two co-administrators to manage the estate fairly.
examples.zh: 法院指定两名共同遗产管理人，以公平管理遗产。

extraExplanation: “co-”前缀表示“共同、联合”。写法常见有 co-administrator（带连字符）与 coadministrator（不带连字符）；在正式写作中带连字符更常见、更清晰。
在法律语境中（遗产/继承），co-administrator 常指共同的“遗产管理人”；在公司或机构语境中则更接近“共同管理者/联合管理员”。

summary.en: A female joint administrator of a deceased person’s estate.
summary.zh: 女性的“共同遗产管理人”（与他人一起管理亡者遗产）。

definition.en: A woman appointed by a court (or named in a will) to manage and distribute a deceased person’s estate, serving together with another administrator.
definition.zh: （与他人共同）被法院指定或遗嘱指定来管理并分配亡者遗产的女性“共同遗产管理人/共同遗产管理代表”。

examples.en: After their mother died, the sisters were named co-administratrixes of the estate.
examples.zh: 母亲去世后，姐妹俩被指定为该遗产的共同女遗产管理人。

examples.en: The co-administratrix filed the inventory of assets with the probate court.
examples.zh: 这位共同女遗产管理人向遗嘱认证法院提交了资产清单。

extraExplanation: 这是法律/遗产继承语境中的用词：administrator/administratrix（遗产管理人/女遗产管理人）通常出现在“没有遗嘱”或遗嘱未指定执行人的情况；若遗嘱指定，常用 executor/executrix（遗嘱执行人/女遗嘱执行人）。现代英文里越来越常用性别中性的 administrator 或 personal representative，避免用 administratrix 这类带性别标记的词。
拼写上可见 co-（共同）+ administratrix（女遗产管理人）。复数常见 co-administratrixes，也有人写 co-administratrices（较正式/拉丁化复数）。

summary.en: A co-adsorbate is a substance that adsorbs on a surface together with another substance, often influencing its binding or reaction.
summary.zh: 共吸附物是与另一物质同时在表面发生吸附的物质，常会影响对方的吸附或反应。

definition.en: a substance (molecule or ion) that is adsorbed on a surface at the same time as another substance, often affecting how the other substance binds or reacts
definition.zh: 与另一种物质同时被吸附在表面上的物质（分子或离子），常会影响另一物质的吸附方式或反应过程

examples.en: In the experiment, water acted as a co-adsorbate and changed how CO bound to the metal surface.
examples.zh: 在实验中，水作为共吸附物，改变了 CO 在金属表面上的结合方式。

examples.en: A co-adsorbate can increase or decrease the catalyst’s activity by blocking or opening surface sites.
examples.zh: 共吸附物可能通过阻塞或释放表面位点来提高或降低催化剂活性。

extraExplanation: “adsorb”指“吸附”（在表面上附着），不同于“absorb/吸收”（进入内部）。因此 co-adsorbate 常见于表面科学、催化与电化学文献，强调“同一表面、同时吸附、相互影响”。
常见共吸附物包括 H2O、O2、CO、H、OH− 等；它们可能通过竞争表面位点、改变表面电荷/极性、或形成氢键网络来影响主吸附物（adsorbate）的覆盖度与反应路径。

summary.en: A co-adventurer is someone who shares an adventure with you—a fellow traveler or quest partner.
summary.zh: co-adventurer 指与你共同冒险的人，即一起旅行、探索或闯关的同伴。

definition.en: A person who goes on an adventure with someone else; a companion in a journey, quest, or risky activity.
definition.zh: 与他人一起冒险的人；同伴（一起旅行、探索或从事有风险活动的人）。

examples.en: I wouldn’t have made it through the hike without my co-adventurer.
examples.zh: 没有我的冒险同伴，我不可能完成这次徒步。

examples.en: In the novel, she treats her co-adventurer like family, not just a teammate.
examples.zh: 在小说里，她把冒险伙伴当作家人，而不只是队友。

examples.en: Bring a co-adventurer if you’re new to climbing—experience matters.
examples.zh: 如果你是攀岩新手，最好带上一位冒险同伴——经验很重要。

extraExplanation: “co-”是英语里常见的前缀，意思是“共同、一起”。因此 co-adventurer 字面就是“共同冒险的人”。
这个词不算特别固定的常用词，更常见的说法包括 companion, partner, fellow adventurer；不过在游戏、奇幻文学、旅行分享等语境中，co-adventurer 会显得更有“并肩闯关”的氛围。
拼写上常见带连字符（co-adventurer），也可能写作 coadventurer。带连字符更清晰、也更符合许多写作风格指南的习惯。

summary.en: Co-aging means aging together with others, especially with mutual support; it can also describe plans or lifestyles designed for that.
summary.zh: Co-aging 指与他人一起变老、互相支持；也可形容为此设计的方案或生活方式。

definition.en: the idea or practice of aging alongside someone else (often a partner, friend, or group), sharing the experience and supporting each other as you grow older
definition.zh: 与他人（常指伴侣、朋友或群体）一起变老的理念或做法；在变老过程中互相陪伴与支持

examples.en: They talked about co-aging as a way to stay connected and healthy in later life.
examples.zh: 他们把“共同变老（co-aging）”当作晚年保持联系与健康的一种方式来讨论。

examples.en: Co-aging can include living nearby, sharing meals, and helping with daily tasks.
examples.zh: 共同变老可能包括住得很近、一起吃饭、并在日常事务上互相帮忙。

definition.en: describing products, plans, or lifestyles designed for people who want to age together (for example, couples or close friends)
definition.zh: 形容为“希望一起变老的人”（如伴侣或密友）设计的产品、规划或生活方式

examples.en: They chose a co-aging housing plan that offers shared spaces and community care.
examples.zh: 他们选择了一种共同变老型（co-aging）的住房方案，提供共享空间和社区照护。

examples.en: The company markets a co-aging wellness program for couples.
examples.zh: 这家公司推广一项面向伴侣的共同变老健康计划。

extraExplanation: “Co-aging”是近年在社交媒体、生活方式与养老/住房讨论中更常见的词，强调“关系中的老去”：不是一个人独自面对衰老，而是通过陪伴、互助与规划来提高生活质量与安全感。
写法上常见连字符 co-aging，也有人写作 coaging。它与“co-living（合住）”“aging in place（原居安老）”等概念常被一起讨论，但重点更偏向“与谁一起老去”的关系与支持系统。

summary.en: “Co-alternative” means a parallel option that exists alongside another option, often not strictly either-or.
summary.zh: co-alternative 指与另一选项并存的并行替代方案，通常不强调“非此即彼”。

definition.en: existing as another option alongside something else (often used in formal or technical writing).
definition.zh: 作为与另一事物并存的另一个选项（常见于较正式或技术性语境）。

examples.en: The policy offers remote work as a co-alternative to flexible hours.
examples.zh: 该政策把远程办公作为弹性工时的并行替代方案。

examples.en: In practice, training is a co-alternative to hiring: companies often do both.
examples.zh: 在实践中，培训是招聘的并行替代方案：公司往往两者并行。

definition.en: a parallel option that can be chosen or used together with another option (rare).
definition.zh: 可与另一选项并行选择或并行使用的替代选项（较少见）。

examples.en: We kept a co-alternative in case the first plan stalled.
examples.zh: 我们保留了一个并行备选方案，以防第一方案卡住。

extraExplanation: “co-”表示“共同、并行”（如 co-worker 同事）。因此 co-alternative 强调“并存/并行的替代方案”，而不是传统 alternative 常见的“二选一、互斥”的感觉。
该词不算常用，多见于商业、政策、学术写作中；很多场合也可以用 plainer English：parallel option / additional option / another option。
拼写上常见带连字符 co-alternative；也可能见到 coalternative（较少）。

summary.en: A co-anchor is a person who shares anchoring duties with another host, especially on news programs.
summary.zh: co-anchor 指在新闻或节目中与另一位主播共同主持的人（联合主播）。

definition.en: A person who shares the role of presenting a news or TV/radio program with another anchor.
definition.zh: （新闻/电视或广播节目中）与另一位主播共同主持的人；联合主播。

examples.en: The co-anchor introduced the next segment while the main anchor reviewed breaking news.
examples.zh: 联合主播介绍了下一个环节，而主主播在整理突发新闻。

examples.en: She became a co-anchor on the evening news last year.
examples.zh: 她去年成为晚间新闻的联合主播。

definition.en: To present a program together with another anchor.
definition.zh: 与另一位主播共同主持（节目）。

examples.en: He will co-anchor the debate coverage tonight.
examples.zh: 他今晚将与人联合主持辩论节目直播。

examples.en: They co-anchored the special report from the studio.
examples.zh: 他们在演播室联合主持了这期特别报道。

extraExplanation: “co-”是常见前缀，表示“共同、一起”（如 co-worker 同事、co-founder 联合创办人）。因此 co-anchor 字面意思就是“共同担任 anchor 的人”。
在美式媒体语境中，anchor 指“新闻主播/节目主持核心人物”，co-anchor 常用于两人搭档（例如早间新闻常见一男一女）共同主持、互相接话与分担内容。写作中也常见连字符 co-anchor；也可写作 coanchor，但较少见。

summary.en: Co-anchors are presenters who share anchoring duties on a news or talk program.
summary.zh: co-anchors 指在新闻或访谈节目中共同承担主播/主持工作的搭档。

definition.en: Two or more people who share the role of anchoring (presenting) a TV or radio news program together.
definition.zh: （电视/广播新闻的）共同主播；搭档主播。

examples.en: The co-anchors introduced the top stories at 6 p.m.
examples.zh: 共同主播在晚上六点介绍了头条新闻。

examples.en: She works as one of the co-anchors on the morning show.
examples.zh: 她是早间节目的共同主播之一。

extraExplanation: “co-”是常见前缀，表示“共同、一起”（如 co-worker 同事，co-founder 共同创办人）。因此 co-anchor 指两位或多位主播“共同担任”主持/播报角色。
在新闻行业里，anchor 不只是“读稿的人”，还常带有“节目核心人物、带领节目节奏与权威性”的含义；co-anchors 往往会分工对话、互相承接，让节目更像“交流”而不只是单向播报。
拼写上也常见 co-anchor（带连字符）与 coanchor（较少见）；复数 co-anchors。

summary.en: To announce something jointly with someone else.
summary.zh: 与他人共同宣布某事。

definition.en: to announce something together with another person or organization; to make a joint announcement
definition.zh: 与他人或其他机构一起宣布；共同发布消息

examples.en: The two companies co-announced a new partnership on Monday.
examples.zh: 这两家公司在周一共同宣布了一项新的合作关系。

examples.en: They will co-announce the award winners at the ceremony.
examples.zh: 他们将在颁奖典礼上共同宣布获奖者。

extraExplanation: “co-”这个前缀表示“共同、一起”（如 co-founder 共同创办人，co-host 共同主持人）。因此 co-announce 常见于新闻稿、官方声明、活动发布等较正式的语境。
拼写上既可写作 co-announce（更常见、清晰），也偶尔见到 coannounce；在正式写作中通常保留连字符以避免误读。

summary.en: Co-appear means “to appear together.”
summary.zh: co-appear 指“共同出现、同时出现”。

definition.en: to appear together (at the same time, in the same place, or in the same context)
definition.zh: 共同出现；同时出现（在同一时间、地点或语境中）

examples.en: The two characters often co-appear in the same scenes.
examples.zh: 这两个角色经常在同一场景中共同出现。

examples.en: In the data, fever and cough frequently co-appear.
examples.zh: 在数据中，发烧和咳嗽经常同时出现。

extraExplanation: “co-”表示“共同、一起”。“co-appear”在日常英语中不算常见，更常用的表达有“appear together / occur together / co-occur”。在学术写作（如语言学、统计、医学）里也常见“co-occur”表示“共现”。
书写上有时会写作“coappear”（不常见）或用连字符“co-appear”来强调前缀结构，尤其在需要避免误读或在技术/学术语境中。

summary.en: A co-appellee is one of multiple appellees (responding parties) in the same appeal.
summary.zh: co-appellee 指同一上诉案件中的“共同被上诉人”（被上诉方之一）。

definition.en: a person or party who is an appellee together with one or more other appellees in the same appeal (a case reviewed by a higher court)
definition.zh: 共同被上诉人；在同一上诉案件中，与其他被上诉人一起作为被上诉方的一方（或当事人）

examples.en: The co-appellee argued that the lower court’s decision should be affirmed.
examples.zh: 共同被上诉人主张应维持下级法院的判决。

examples.en: Both the insurer and the driver were listed as co-appellees in the appeal.
examples.zh: 保险公司和司机在该上诉中都被列为共同被上诉人。

extraExplanation: “co-”表示“共同、一起”。“appellee”指在上诉中“应诉的一方/被上诉方”，通常是原审胜诉方，面对上诉人（appellant）的上诉。
这是法律用语，常见于判例、上诉文件和法院意见书的当事人列表中。写作时有时会加连字符（co-appellee），也可不加（coappellee），以具体文件或法院的写法为准。
相关词：appellant（上诉人/提起上诉的一方）、co-appellant（共同上诉人）、respondent（英联邦法系中常用，对应appellee）。

summary.en: A co-applicant is someone who applies together with another person for the same thing.
summary.zh: co-applicant 指与他人一起提出同一申请的共同申请人。

definition.en: A person who applies for something together with another person, sharing the application (for example, for a loan, lease, or visa).
definition.zh: 与他人一起申请某项事物的人（共同申请人；如贷款、租约或签证等）。

examples.en: You may add a co-applicant to strengthen your loan application.
examples.zh: 你可以添加一位共同申请人来增强你的贷款申请。

examples.en: The landlord asked both the applicant and the co-applicant to provide proof of income.
examples.zh: 房东要求申请人和共同申请人都提供收入证明。

synonyms: co-signer (sometimes, but not always the same)
extraExplanation: “co-”表示“共同、一起”（如 co-worker 同事，co-founder 联合创始人）。“co-applicant”常见于银行贷款、信用卡、租房、保险、移民/签证等正式文件语境。
在一些场景中，co-applicant 通常需要承担与主申请人相近的法律/财务责任（例如共同还款），但具体以合同或机构规定为准。

summary.en: A co-appraiser is someone who helps another appraiser assess value, often for real estate.
summary.zh: co-appraiser 指协助另一位估价师进行价值评估的人，常见于房地产估价。

definition.en: A person who works with another appraiser to evaluate the value of something (especially property or assets).
definition.zh: 与另一位估价师一起进行价值评估的人（尤其用于不动产或资产估价）。

examples.en: The lender required a co-appraiser to confirm the home’s market value.
examples.zh: 贷款方要求一位共同估价师来确认这套房子的市场价值。

examples.en: As a trainee, she acted as a co-appraiser on several real estate reports.
examples.zh: 作为实习人员，她在多份房地产估价报告中担任共同估价师。

extraExplanation: 在房地产估价语境中，co-appraiser 常指与主估价师一起参与现场勘查、数据收集或撰写报告的人，目的是提高评估的可靠性或满足机构/法规要求。具体职责与是否需要签字（sign the report）会因地区规定与项目要求而不同。
构词提示：co- 表示“共同、一起”；appraiser 是“估价师/评估师”。因此 co-appraiser 字面意思就是“共同估价师/协同估价人”。

summary.en: A co-approver is someone who approves something together with another approver.
summary.zh: co-approver 指与他人一起进行批准的共同审批人。

definition.en: a person who approves something together with another approver (for example, in a company workflow, purchase request, or document review)
definition.zh: 与他人一起对某事进行批准的人（常见于公司流程、采购申请或文件审核等场景）

examples.en: Your request won’t be processed until the co-approver signs off.
examples.zh: 你的申请在共同审批人签字同意之前不会被处理。

examples.en: Please add a co-approver for expenses over $5,000.
examples.zh: 请为超过 5,000 美元的费用添加一位共同审批人。

extraExplanation: “co-”表示“共同、一起”。“co-approver”多用于企业内部系统（如报销、采购、权限管理）里，强调“与另一位审批人共同负责/共同把关”。
与“co-signer（共同签署人）”不同：co-signer 更常见于合同或贷款等法律/金融文件，侧重“共同承担责任”；co-approver 侧重“共同批准流程”。
拼写上常见写法有“co-approver”（最常见）、“co approver”（较少见）或“coapprover”（更少见）。正式写作中通常用连字符更清晰。

summary.en: A co-arbitrator is one of the arbitrators on a tribunal, often appointed by a party, who decides the dispute with the other arbitrators.
summary.zh: co-arbitrator 指仲裁庭中的共同仲裁员，常由当事方指定，与其他仲裁员共同作出裁决。

definition.en: A person who serves as one of (usually) three arbitrators in a dispute, deciding the case together with the other arbitrators; often used for an arbitrator appointed by one party (as opposed to the chair/presiding arbitrator).
definition.zh: 共同仲裁员：在争议仲裁中与其他仲裁员一起组成仲裁庭并共同裁决的人；常指由某一方当事人指定的仲裁员（相对于首席/主审仲裁员）。

examples.en: Each party appointed a co-arbitrator, and the two co-arbitrators selected the presiding arbitrator.
examples.zh: 双方各自指定一名共同仲裁员，两名共同仲裁员再共同选出首席仲裁员。

examples.en: The co-arbitrator asked both sides to submit their evidence by Friday.
examples.zh: 共同仲裁员要求双方在周五前提交证据。

extraExplanation: “co-”表示“共同、一起”。在很多国际仲裁中常见“三人仲裁庭”：一方指定一名共同仲裁员，另一方指定一名共同仲裁员，再由两名共同仲裁员（或机构）选出首席/主审仲裁员（presiding arbitrator / chair）。
与其相近的说法有：party-appointed arbitrator（当事方指定的仲裁员）、wing arbitrator（较口语/行业说法，可能带点“左右手”的意味，正式文件中不如前者常见）。

summary.en: A co-assignee is a joint assignee—someone who shares assigned rights or obligations with another assignee.
summary.zh: co-assignee 指“共同受让人”：与他人共同享有被转让的权利或共同承担相关义务的一方。

definition.en: A person or organization that shares the rights or responsibilities of an assignment (for example, in a contract, lease, loan, or patent) with another assignee.
definition.zh: 与另一位受让人共同分享某项“转让”(assignment) 权利或义务的个人或组织（常见于合同、租约、贷款或专利等语境）。

examples.en: Under the agreement, the patent was transferred to two co-assignees.
examples.zh: 根据该协议，该专利被转让给两名共同受让人。

examples.en: The landlord required both co-assignees to sign the lease assignment.
examples.zh: 房东要求两位共同受让人都在租约转让文件上签字。

examples.en: Each co-assignee is responsible for meeting the payment terms.
examples.zh: 每位共同受让人都需要履行付款条款。

extraExplanation: “co-”表示“共同、一起”。“assignee”是“受让人/受托人”，指被转让权益（或义务）的一方；因此“co-assignee”常用于正式或法律文件，强调有不止一位受让方共同持有同一项权益或共同承担相关义务。
在不同文件里，co-assignees 之间的责任可能是“分别承担”(severally) 或“连带承担”(jointly and severally)；具体要以合同条款为准。

summary.en: Co-assuming means making an assumption jointly with others or assuming linked ideas at the same time.
summary.zh: co-assuming 指与他人共同作出假设，或在讨论/推理中把相关观点一起同时假设。

definition.en: (Present participle of co-assume) assuming something together with someone else, or assuming one idea along with another at the same time.
definition.zh: （co-assume 的现在分词）与他人一起作出某个假设；或在推理/讨论中同时连带地假设另一个观点。

examples.en: In the experiment, we are co-assuming that the sensors are calibrated and that the room temperature stays stable.
examples.zh: 在这个实验中，我们同时假设传感器已经校准，并且室温保持稳定。

examples.en: By co-assuming these two conditions, the model becomes much simpler to test.
examples.zh: 通过同时假设这两个条件，这个模型就更容易测试了。

examples.en: They kept co-assuming good faith, even when the emails sounded harsh.
examples.zh: 即使邮件语气很强硬，他们仍一直共同假设对方是善意的。

definition.en: (Adjectival use) based on a joint or linked assumption; taken for granted together.
definition.zh: （作形容词用）基于共同/连带假设的；被一起视为理所当然的。

examples.en: The report depends on co-assuming premises that may not be true in real life.
examples.zh: 这份报告依赖一些可能不符合现实的连带前提假设。

examples.en: A co-assuming approach can hide disagreements about what counts as evidence.
examples.zh: 一种“共同假设”的做法可能会掩盖关于何为证据的分歧。

extraExplanation: “co-”表示“共同、一起”（如 cooperate, coauthor）。co-assume 不是特别常见，更常见于学术写作、逻辑推理或研究方法讨论中，用来强调“这些前提是一起被假定的”。
拼写上常见两种：co-assuming（更正式、更清晰）与 coassuming（较少见）。在普通对话里，人们往往改说 assume together / make the same assumption。

summary.en: Co-attach means to attach or fasten things together or jointly, mainly in technical/formal contexts.
summary.zh: co-attach 指“共同连接/共同附加”，多用于技术或正式语境。

definition.en: to attach or fasten something together with something else; to attach jointly (often used in technical or formal writing).
definition.zh: 与其他东西一起连接/固定；共同附加（常见于技术或正式语境）。

examples.en: Please co-attach the label and the instruction sheet to each package.
examples.zh: 请把标签和说明书一起附在每个包装上。

examples.en: The two components are co-attached to the frame with screws.
examples.zh: 这两个部件用螺丝共同固定在框架上。

extraExplanation: “co-”表示“共同、一起”。“co-attach”不是日常高频词，更常见的说法是“attach … together / attach both … / be attached to the same …”。在工程、制造、文件处理等语境中，才可能看到“co-attached / co-attach”的写法。
在邮件语境里，如果想表达“把两个文件一起附上”，更自然的表达是“attach both files”或“attach the files together”（通常不写“co-attach”）。

summary.en: “Co-attaching” means attaching something together with something else at the same time, especially in emails or submissions.
summary.zh: “Co-attaching”指把某物与另一项内容一起同时附上，常见于邮件或材料提交场景。

definition.en: attaching something together with something else; including an additional item as an attachment at the same time.
definition.zh: 与另一项内容一起附上；同时附加（附件/文件等）。

examples.en: I’m co-attaching the signed contract and the invoice for your reference.
examples.zh: 我同时附上已签署的合同和发票供你参考。

examples.en: She co-attached a photo ID when she submitted the application online.
examples.zh: 她在线提交申请时也一并附上了带照片的身份证明。

definition.en: (less common) attaching two things to each other so they function as one unit.
definition.zh: （较少见）把两样东西互相固定/连接在一起，使其成为一个整体。

examples.en: In the lab, the technician is co-attaching two sensors to a single mounting plate.
examples.zh: 在实验室里，技术员正把两个传感器一起固定在同一块安装板上。

extraExplanation: “co-”这个前缀表示“共同、一起、同时”（如 cooperate, coauthor）。因此 co-attaching 常见于邮件或表单语境，意思是“同时附上（多个文件/材料）”。
在正式商务写作中，也常用更自然的说法：I’ve attached A and B. / Please find attached A and B.；co-attach/co-attaching 属于相对少见但可理解的用法。

summary.en: Co-attending means attending together; in healthcare it often means two attending doctors jointly responsible for a patient.
summary.zh: co-attending 指“共同出席/一起参加”；在医疗语境中常指两位主治医生共同负责同一位病人。

definition.en: attending something together with another person or group; jointly present as an attendee (often used as an adjective).
definition.zh: 与他人一起参加；共同出席（常作形容词用）。

examples.en: They are co-attending the workshop to learn the same skills.
examples.zh: 他们一起参加这个工作坊来学习同样的技能。

examples.en: Co-attending parents are encouraged to sit near their child during the first class.
examples.zh: 建议共同出席的家长在第一节课时坐在孩子旁边。

definition.en: In hospitals and clinics, describing two attending physicians who share responsibility for a patient’s care (often: “co-attending physician”).
definition.zh: （医疗语境）指两位主治医生共同负责同一位病人的治疗与管理（常见搭配：co-attending physician）。

examples.en: A cardiologist served as a co-attending physician during the patient’s recovery.
examples.zh: 在病人康复期间，一位心脏科医生担任共同主治医生。

examples.en: The note was signed by the primary attending and the co-attending.
examples.zh: 这份病程记录由主要主治医生和共同主治医生共同签署。

extraExplanation: “co-”表示“共同、一起”（如 co-worker 同事，co-author 合著者）。“co-attending”多用作形容词，常放在名词前：co-attending physician / co-attending parents。
拼写上常见连字符 co-attending，也有人写作 coattending；在正式写作或医疗文件中，用连字符更清楚。
注意区分 attending（参加/出席；或“主治医生”）的两种常见含义；因此“co-attending”在一般活动语境与医疗语境里意思不同。

summary.en: “Co-attends” means “attends something together with someone else.”
summary.zh: “co-attends”表示“与他人一起参加/共同出席”。

definition.en: to attend an event, class, or meeting together with someone else (to be present at the same time)
definition.zh: 与他人一起参加（同一活动/课程/会议），共同出席

examples.en: She co-attends the weekly seminar with her colleague.
examples.zh: 她和同事一起参加每周的研讨会。

examples.en: Parents are encouraged to co-attend the orientation session with their children.
examples.zh: 鼓励家长与孩子一同参加新生说明会。

examples.en: They co-attend church services every Sunday.
examples.zh: 他们每个星期天都会一起参加教会礼拜。

extraExplanation: “co-”是常见前缀，表示“共同、一起”（如 co-worker 同事，cooperate 合作）。因此 co-attend 强调“与别人一起出席/参加”。在正式通知或学校/机构语境中较常见；日常口语里也常用 attend ... together / go with ... 来表达类似意思。

summary.en: “Co-attested” means two or more forms/words/names are documented together in the same source.
summary.zh: “co-attested”指两个或多个形式/词/名称在同一来源中一起被记录或证实。

definition.en: Recorded or documented together with something else in the same source (text, inscription, corpus, dataset), especially in academic writing.
definition.zh: （尤用于学术写作）与另一事物在同一来源（文本、铭文、语料库、数据集等）中一起被记录/证实的。

examples.en: In the corpus, the two spellings are co-attested in 12th-century manuscripts.
examples.zh: 在该语料库中，这两种拼写在12世纪手稿里被共同证实。

examples.en: The deity names are co-attested on the same inscription, suggesting a shared cult site.
examples.zh: 这些神祇名称在同一段铭文中共同见证，暗示可能共享同一崇拜地点。

extraExplanation: “attested”常见于语言学、历史学、文献学，意思是“有文献/材料证明存在”。在此基础上，“co-”表示“共同、一起”，所以co-attested强调“两者在同一证据来源中同时出现/被证明”。
常见替换表达（语气略有不同）：co-occurring（共同出现，更偏向“同现”）、jointly attested（共同见证/共同证实，更正式）、attested together（一起被证明，更口语一些）。

summary.en: A co-auditor is someone who audits together with another auditor or auditing team.
summary.zh: co-auditor 指與另一位審計員或審計團隊共同執行審計工作的人。

definition.en: a person who works together with another auditor (or auditing team) to examine accounts, records, or compliance.
definition.zh: 共同審計員；與另一位審計員（或審計團隊）一起進行查帳、審核或合規檢查的人。

examples.en: The company appointed a co-auditor to share the workload during the annual audit.
examples.zh: 公司指派一位共同審計員，在年度審計期間分擔工作量。

examples.en: As a co-auditor, she reviewed internal controls while her colleague tested the financial statements.
examples.zh: 作為共同審計員，她負責檢視內部控制，而同事負責測試財務報表。

examples.en: We will meet with the co-auditor next week to align our audit plan and timelines.
examples.zh: 我們下週將與共同審計員會面，以對齊審計計畫與時程。

extraExplanation: 「co-」表示「共同、一起」。因此 co-auditor 強調「與他人一起執行審計工作」的角色，常見於大型或跨地區的審計案，或需要分工（例如一方負責子公司、一方負責特定流程/科目）。在正式文件中也可能寫作 coauditor 或 co auditor。

summary.en: A co-author is someone who writes a work together with others; to co-author means to write it together.
summary.zh: co-author 指与他人共同写作并署名的作者；作动词时表示合写、共同撰写。

definition.en: a person who writes a book, article, report, etc. together with one or more other people
definition.zh: （与他人一起写作的）合著者，共同作者

examples.en: She is the co-author of a bestselling cookbook.
examples.zh: 她是一本畅销食谱的合著者。

examples.en: He and his advisor are co-authors on the paper.
examples.zh: 他和导师是这篇论文的共同作者。

definition.en: to write something together with one or more other people
definition.zh: 与他人合写；共同撰写

examples.en: They co-authored a report on climate policy.
examples.zh: 他们合写了一份关于气候政策的报告。

examples.en: Would you like to co-author this article with me?
examples.zh: 你愿意和我一起合写这篇文章吗？

extraExplanation: “co-”是常见前缀，表示“共同、一起”。因此 co-author 指“共同作者/合著”。
学术语境里常见说法：be a co-author on a paper（是某篇论文的共同作者）。动词形式是 co-author（过去式/过去分词 co-authored）。
和“collaborate”相比，co-author 更强调“共同署名写作”，而 collaborate 更泛指“合作”，不一定写作或署名。

summary.en: Co-authors are people who write something together.
summary.zh: co-authors 指共同写作同一作品的人（合著者）。

definition.en: A person who writes a book, article, report, or other text together with one or more other writers.
definition.zh: 与他人共同写作书籍、文章、报告等文本的人；合著者。

examples.en: Dr. Lee is a co-author of the paper on climate change.
examples.zh: 李博士是那篇关于气候变化论文的合著者。

examples.en: The book has three co-authors, so each chapter lists their names.
examples.zh: 这本书有三位合著者，所以每一章都列出了他们的名字。

extraExplanation: “co-”表示“共同、一起”。“co-author”既可作名词（合著者），也可作动词（与人合著）。你输入的“co-authors”是复数形式，常用于学术论文署名与致谢语境。
常见搭配：co-author of a paper/book（……的合著者）；with my co-authors（和我的合著者一起）；list the co-authors（列出合著者）。
学术写作里，“author”通常指对研究与写作有实质贡献的人；不同领域对“谁算作者、作者顺序如何排”有规范与文化差异（例如第一作者/通讯作者）。

summary.en: Co-authorship means writing a work together and sharing author credit.
summary.zh: Co-authorship 指共同写作并共享作者署名与成果认可。

definition.en: The act or situation of writing and publishing a work together with one or more other people.
definition.zh: （与他人）共同写作并共同署名发表作品的行为或情况。

examples.en: The paper lists three researchers in co-authorship.
examples.zh: 这篇论文以共同署名的方式列出了三位研究人员。

examples.en: Their co-authorship began during graduate school.
examples.zh: 他们的共同署名合作始于研究生时期。

definition.en: A relationship or partnership between people who share credit as authors of the same work.
definition.zh: 在同一作品上共享作者署名与贡献认可的合作关系。

examples.en: Co-authorship can strengthen a project by combining different skills.
examples.zh: 共同署名合作可以通过结合不同技能来增强项目质量。

examples.en: They discussed co-authorship before starting the book.
examples.zh: 他们在开始写书之前就讨论了共同署名。

extraExplanation: 学术语境里，“co-authorship”常涉及署名规则与贡献认定（如作者顺序、通讯作者、是否达到作者资格）。不同学科与期刊的惯例不一样，合作前先明确分工与署名方式很重要。
近义表达常见有：coauthoring（共同写作的过程）、joint authorship（共同作者身份/共同著作权，偏法律语境）。

summary.en: Co-awareness means shared awareness between people, or (in mindfulness/therapy) being aware together—of yourself and the other person at the same time.
summary.zh: Co-awareness 指人与人之间的共同觉察；在正念/咨询语境中，也指“共同保持觉察”，同时关注自己与对方。

definition.en: shared awareness between two or more people; the sense that everyone is noticing, understanding, or paying attention to the same thing at the same time.
definition.zh: （两人或多人之间的）共同觉察/共识性注意；指大家同时注意到、理解到或意识到同一件事。

examples.en: In a good team meeting, co-awareness helps people catch problems early.
examples.zh: 在高效的团队会议中，共同觉察能帮助大家更早发现问题。

examples.en: The teacher built co-awareness by asking students to look at the same chart and describe what they noticed.
examples.zh: 老师让学生一起看同一张图表并描述观察到的内容，从而建立共同觉察。

definition.en: (in mindfulness/therapy contexts) awareness held together with another person—being aware of your own experience while also staying aware of the other person’s feelings and signals.
definition.zh: （正念/心理咨询语境）共同保持的觉察：既觉察自己的体验，也同时关注对方的情绪与信号。

examples.en: During counseling, the goal is co-awareness: noticing your emotions while listening closely to the other person.
examples.zh: 在咨询中，目标是共同觉察：留意自己的情绪，同时认真倾听对方。

examples.en: Partners practiced co-awareness by speaking slowly and checking each other’s reactions.
examples.zh: 伴侣通过放慢表达并确认彼此反应来练习共同觉察。

extraExplanation: “co-”表示“共同、一起”。“co-awareness”并不是最常见的固定词条，更常见的表达包括 shared awareness、mutual awareness、joint attention。
书写上常见 co-awareness（带连字符）或 coawareness（少见）。在学术/心理与正念相关文本中，用连字符能更清楚地显示构词结构。
在沟通训练里，它常强调“同时觉察自己与他人”，这与单纯的 awareness（对某事的意识）相比，更突出互动与同步。

summary.en: Co-backed means jointly supported or financed by more than one person or organization.
summary.zh: co-backed 指由不止一个人或机构共同支持、出资或担保。

definition.en: supported, financed, or guaranteed together by two or more parties (often used in business or finance).
definition.zh: 由两个或以上的主体共同支持、出资或担保的（常用于商业或金融语境）。

examples.en: The startup raised a co-backed seed round led by two venture capital firms.
examples.zh: 这家初创公司完成了一轮由两家风投机构共同支持的种子轮融资。

examples.en: They offered a co-backed loan, so the bank felt more comfortable lending the money.
examples.zh: 他们提供了共同担保的贷款，因此银行更放心放款。

examples.en: The project is co-backed by the university and a local nonprofit.
examples.zh: 这个项目由该大学和一家本地非营利组织共同支持。

extraExplanation: “co-”表示“共同、联合”。“co-backed”常写作连字符形式（co-backed），多见于新闻稿、投融资报道和合同文本，强调“共同背书/共同担保/共同出资”。
在投融资语境里，它常接“by + 机构/个人”，如“co-backed by Sequoia and Accel（由红杉与Accel共同支持）”。在贷款语境里，接近“jointly guaranteed（共同担保）”。
与“backed”相比，“co-backed”更强调“有不止一个支持方”，暗示风险与资源由多方分担。

summary.en: Co-backers are people or groups who support something together, often by providing funding or resources.
summary.zh: co-backers 指共同支持某事的人或机构，常见于共同出资或提供资源的语境。

definition.en: People or organizations who support a project, company, or person by providing money, resources, or public support, together with other supporters (plural of “co-backer”).
definition.zh: 共同出资者；共同支持者（co-backer 的复数）：与他人一起为某个项目、公司或个人提供资金、资源或公开支持的人或机构。

examples.en: The startup’s co-backers included two angel investors and a local business group.
examples.zh: 这家初创公司的共同出资者包括两位天使投资人和一个本地商会组织。

examples.en: She thanked her co-backers for believing in the campaign from the beginning.
examples.zh: 她感谢共同支持者从一开始就相信这场竞选。

extraExplanation: “co-”表示“共同、一起”，常见于 co-founder（共同创办人）、co-worker（同事）。
“backer”在商业语境里常指“出资/资助者”；在政治语境里也可指“支持者（常含资金或资源支持）”。
写法上可见 co-backer / co backer / cobacker；带连字符（co-backer）在新闻与商业写作中更常见，便于阅读。

summary.en: A co-beneficiary is someone who shares beneficiary rights or payments with another beneficiary.
summary.zh: co-beneficiary 指与他人共同享有受益权或共同领取款项的“共同受益人”。

definition.en: A person (or organization) that shares the benefits, rights, or payments with another beneficiary, especially in insurance, banking, wills, or trusts.
definition.zh: 共同受益人；与他人共同享有权益或共同领取给付的人（或机构），常见于保险、银行、遗嘱或信托等情境。

examples.en: She named her two children as co-beneficiaries of the life insurance policy.
examples.zh: 她把两个孩子指定为人寿保险的共同受益人。

examples.en: If one co-beneficiary dies, the remaining co-beneficiary may receive the full amount, depending on the contract.
examples.zh: 如果其中一位共同受益人去世，另一位是否可领取全部金额要看合同条款。

examples.en: The trust lists the museum and the library as co-beneficiaries.
examples.zh: 该信托把博物馆和图书馆列为共同受益人。

extraExplanation: 在法律/金融文件里，co-beneficiary 常常和“primary beneficiary（第一受益人）/ contingent beneficiary（备用受益人）”一起出现。co-beneficiaries 通常表示“并列的受益人”，可能按比例分配（例如各 50%），也可能按文件约定由存活者继承（常见于“right of survivorship/生存者继承”条款）。
拼写上也常见 co beneficiary 或 co-beneficiary；在比较正式的文本中，加连字符 co-beneficiary 很常见。

summary.en: People who apply for and share legal responsibility for repaying a loan together.
summary.zh: 共同申请贷款并共同承担还款法律责任的人（复数）。

definition.en: A person who applies for and shares responsibility for a loan with one or more other people; all co-borrowers are usually equally legally responsible for repayment.
definition.zh: 共同借款人：与他人一起申请贷款并共同承担还款法律责任的人；通常每位共同借款人都对还款负同等责任。

examples.en: The bank requires all co-borrowers to sign the loan agreement.
examples.zh: 银行要求所有共同借款人在贷款协议上签字。

examples.en: If one co-borrower loses their job, the other co-borrower still must make the payments.
examples.zh: 如果一位共同借款人失业，另一位共同借款人仍必须继续还款。

examples.en: As co-borrowers, they qualified for a larger mortgage because their incomes were combined.
examples.zh: 作为共同借款人，他们把收入合并后，符合申请更高额度房贷的条件。

extraExplanation: “Co-”表示“共同、一起”。“Co-borrower”常见于房贷、车贷、学生贷款等正式金融语境。
易混淆点：co-borrower（共同借款人）通常对贷款“拥有权益并共同负债”；co-signer/guarantor（共同签署人/担保人）可能不实际使用贷款资金或不享有资产权益，但仍可能需要承担还款责任，具体取决于合同与地区法规。
书面用法里常写作“co-borrower”（更常见）或“co-borrowers”（复数）。有时也会见到带连字符的“co-borrower(s)”。

summary.en: Co-brand means two brands work together so a product, service, or campaign carries both names.
summary.zh: co-brand 指两个品牌合作推出或营销，让产品/服务/活动同时带有双方品牌名称。

definition.en: to partner with another brand to create, market, or sell a product, service, or campaign together (often sharing both names/logos)
definition.zh: （两家/多家品牌）进行联合品牌合作，共同推出、推广或销售产品/服务/活动（常同时使用双方品牌名或标识）

examples.en: The coffee shop co-branded with a local bakery to sell signature pastries.
examples.zh: 这家咖啡店与本地面包店进行联合品牌合作，销售招牌点心。

examples.en: They plan to co-brand a limited-edition sneaker next month.
examples.zh: 他们计划下个月联合推出一款限量版运动鞋。

definition.en: created or marketed by two brands together; carrying two brand names
definition.zh: 联合品牌的；由两个品牌共同打造或共同营销的；带有两个品牌名称的

examples.en: The co-branded credit card offers rewards from both companies.
examples.zh: 这张联名信用卡提供两家公司的积分/回馈。

examples.en: We used co-branded packaging for the holiday promotion.
examples.zh: 我们在节日促销中使用了联名包装。

definition.en: a co-branding partnership or product that features two brands
definition.zh: 联名合作；联名产品（同时体现两个品牌）

examples.en: Their latest co-brand was a hit on social media.
examples.zh: 他们最新的联名在社交媒体上很火。

extraExplanation: 在商业语境里，co-brand 常与 co-branding（联合品牌/品牌联名）一起出现。常见形式包括：联名款产品、联名活动、联名信用卡等。
注意区分：co-brand（联名）强调“两个品牌并列出现、共同背书”；而 private label（自有品牌/贴牌）通常是零售商用自己的品牌卖由他方生产的产品。

summary.en: Co-branding is when two brands partner and present together on a product or campaign.
summary.zh: Co-branding 指两个品牌合作，并在同一产品或宣传中共同露出。

definition.en: a marketing partnership where two brands appear together on a product, service, or campaign to share audiences and add value
definition.zh: （市场营销中的）联合品牌：两个品牌在同一产品、服务或宣传活动中共同出现，以共享受众并提升价值

examples.en: The airline and the credit card company launched a co-branding campaign.
examples.zh: 这家航空公司和信用卡公司发起了一项联合品牌宣传活动。

examples.en: Co-branding can help a small brand gain trust by working with a well-known brand.
examples.zh: 联合品牌可以让小品牌通过与知名品牌合作来获得信任。

examples.en: They used co-branding on limited-edition packaging to attract new customers.
examples.zh: 他们在限量版包装上采用联合品牌来吸引新顾客。

definition.en: to create or market something jointly under two brand names
definition.zh: 进行联合品牌合作；以两个品牌名共同打造或推广（产品/服务）

examples.en: The two companies decided to co-brand a new smartwatch.
examples.zh: 两家公司决定为一款新智能手表做联合品牌。

examples.en: It’s hard to co-brand successfully if the two brand images don’t match.
examples.zh: 如果两个品牌形象不匹配，联合品牌就很难成功。

extraExplanation: “co-”表示“共同、一起”，co-branding 常写作带连字符的 co-branding，也可写作 co-branding / cobranding。
联合品牌与“联名（collaboration）”很接近，但 co-branding 更强调“品牌同时露出与共同背书”，常见于联名款产品、联名信用卡、餐饮/电影/IP合作等。
常见搭配：co-branded product（联合品牌产品）、co-branded credit card（联名信用卡）、co-branding partnership（联合品牌合作）、strategic co-branding（战略联合品牌）。

summary.en: Co-breathe means to breathe together with someone, usually in a deliberate, calming or coordinated way.
summary.zh: co-breathe 指与他人一起（有意识地）同步呼吸，常用于放松、冥想或协调配合的场景。

definition.en: to breathe together with someone else, often intentionally (for example, in meditation, yoga, singing, or calming exercises).
definition.zh: （与他人）一起呼吸、同步呼吸；常指有意识地在冥想、瑜伽、合唱或放松练习中同步呼吸。

examples.en: Let’s co-breathe for one minute to calm down before we talk.
examples.zh: 在我们谈之前，我们一起同步呼吸一分钟，让自己冷静下来。

examples.en: In the workshop, partners co-breathed and matched their inhale and exhale.
examples.zh: 在工作坊里，搭档们一起同步呼吸，让吸气和呼气保持一致。

examples.en: The choir learned to co-breathe so the first note would be steady.
examples.zh: 合唱团学会了同步呼吸，这样第一个音会更稳定。

extraExplanation: “co-”表示“共同、一起”（如 cooperate 合作、coexist 共存）。“co-breathe”不是非常常见的标准词汇，更像是近年在身心练习（正念、瑜伽、治疗、团体练习）中出现的创造性用法。日常英语里也可用更常见的表达：breathe together / synchronize our breathing / breathe in sync。

summary.en: A man who is married to your spouse’s sibling; often described in everyday English as a type of brother-in-law.
summary.zh: 指与你的配偶的兄弟姐妹结婚的男性（连襟）；日常英语常用 brother-in-law 来表达并再补充说明。

definition.en: A man who is married to your spouse’s sibling (for example, the husband of your wife’s sister). In everyday English, people more often say “brother-in-law,” but in some cultures “co-brother” is used to be more specific.
definition.zh: 连襟/襟兄弟：与你的配偶有“姻亲并列关系”的男性亲属，例如你妻子的姐妹的丈夫（你和他同为某位人的女婿）。日常英语更常说“brother-in-law（姐夫/妹夫/内兄弟等）”，但在一些文化语境中会用“co-brother”更具体。

examples.en: At the wedding, I finally met my co-brother—my wife’s sister’s husband.
examples.zh: 在婚礼上，我终于见到了我的连襟——我妻子姐姐（或妹妹）的丈夫。

examples.en: My co-brother and I helped each other move into our new apartments.
examples.zh: 我和连襟互相帮忙搬进了新公寓。

extraExplanation: “co-brother”在标准美式英语里不算常用词，更多见于一些地区或文化背景的英语（例如南亚英语），用来精确区分不同类型的“in-law（姻亲）”。在美国日常交流中，为避免误解，通常直接说“my brother-in-law (my wife’s sister’s husband)”或“my wife’s sister’s husband”。

summary.en: A (rare) term for a male in-law connected to you through your spouse’s sibling—often the husband of your spouse’s sister/brother; also used for two men married to sisters.
summary.zh: 一个较少见的称呼，指与你同辈分的姻亲男性，常指配偶兄弟/姐妹的丈夫；也可指“娶了两姐妹的两位丈夫”彼此的关系（连襟）。

definition.en: A man who is connected to you through marriage in the same “in-law” generation—especially the husband of your spouse’s sibling, or (commonly in some cultures) the man who is married to your spouse’s sister, making the two men each other’s brothers-in-law.
definition.zh: 与你处在同一辈分的“姻亲男性”，尤其指你配偶的兄弟/姐妹的丈夫；在一些文化语境中也常指“两个姐妹各自的丈夫”，两位丈夫彼此互为（共）连襟。

examples.en: My wife’s sister’s husband is my co-brother-in-law, so we often celebrate holidays together.
examples.zh: 我老婆姐姐的丈夫算是我的（共）连襟，所以我们经常一起过节。

examples.en: Two men married to two sisters are co-brothers-in-law.
examples.zh: 两个男人分别娶了两姐妹，他们彼此就是（共）连襟。

extraExplanation: 这个词在日常英语里很少见，更常见的说法是直接用 brother-in-law，并根据需要补充说明关系：my wife’s sister’s husband / the husband of my spouse’s sister。
在中文里常对应“连襟/襟兄弟”（较书面或地域性用法）。英语使用时如果担心对方不熟悉 co-brother-in-law，建议改用更清楚的描述。
拼写上常见 co-brother-in-law（带连字符），也有人写作 co-brother in law 或 cobrother-in-law，但不如前者规范。

summary.en: A fellow or joint burgess—someone who shares burgess (borough freeman/citizen) status, mainly in historical British usage.
summary.zh: 同为自治镇自由民/市民的人；强调共同享有 burgess 身份与权利，多用于英国历史语境。

definition.en: a person who shares the status/rights of a burgess (a citizen or freeman of a town/borough), especially in historical British/Scottish contexts; a fellow burgess
definition.zh: （尤指英国/苏格兰历史语境中）与他人共同拥有“市民/自治镇自由民（burgess）”身份与权利的人；同为市民/同为自治镇自由民者

examples.en: Only co-burgesses could vote in the old borough elections.
examples.zh: 在旧时的自治镇选举中，只有同为“自由民”的人（co-burgesses）才有投票权。

examples.en: The deed lists him and his brother as co-burgesses of the town.
examples.zh: 契约文件中把他和他的兄弟列为该镇的共同自由民（co-burgesses）。

extraExplanation: “burgess”源自中古英语，指自治镇（borough）里的“自由民/市民”，过去常与财产、经商资格、行会身份以及地方选举权相关。前缀“co-”表示“共同、同为”，所以 co-burgess 强调“同享同一身份与权利”的关系。
该词多见于历史文献、法律/地契记录或地方史写作，现代日常英语中很少使用；在当代语境里更常见的表达是“fellow citizen”“fellow townsman”，但这些不一定包含“法定特权/自由民身份”的含义。

summary.en: A co-buyer is someone who purchases something together with another person and shares responsibility for the purchase.
summary.zh: co-buyer 指与他人一起购买并共同承担购买责任的人。

definition.en: A person who buys something together with another person and shares responsibility for the purchase (often for a home, car, or loan).
definition.zh: 共同购买者；与他人一起购买并共同承担购买责任的人（常用于房屋、汽车或贷款）。

examples.en: Maria is listed as a co-buyer on the car loan.
examples.zh: 玛丽亚被列为这笔汽车贷款的共同购买者。

examples.en: If you have a co-buyer, the lender may consider both incomes.
examples.zh: 如果你有共同购买者，贷款机构可能会同时考虑两个人的收入。

extraExplanation: “co-”是常见前缀，表示“共同、一起”，如 co-owner（共同所有人）、co-worker（同事）。在法律或金融语境中，co-buyer 往往意味着共同签署合同、共同承担付款义务；具体责任以合同条款为准。
与 co-signer（共同签署人/担保人）容易混淆：co-buyer 通常也拥有所购资产的一部分权益；co-signer 主要是为贷款提供信用支持，未必拥有资产。

summary.en: A co-candidate is someone who is also running for the same office, often alongside another candidate in the same election.
summary.zh: co-candidate 指在同一场选举中与另一位候选人一起参选（同一职位/同一竞选）的共同候选人。

definition.en: A person who is running for the same position at the same time as another candidate (often on the same ticket or in the same election).
definition.zh: （同一场选举或同一职位的）共同候选人；与另一位候选人同时参选的人（有时指同一组合/同一阵营的候选人）。

examples.en: She and her co-candidate toured the state together to promote their platform.
examples.zh: 她和她的共同候选人一起在全州巡回宣传他们的政纲。

examples.en: The debate invited each candidate and one co-candidate from the same party.
examples.zh: 辩论邀请了每位候选人以及同一政党的一位共同候选人。

synonyms: running mate (if on the same ticket)
extraExplanation: “co-”表示“共同、一起”。“co-candidate”不是最常见的固定词，更常见的相关说法有：同一张选票上的“running mate”（如总统-副总统搭档），或同一选举中的“fellow candidate / rival candidate”。具体用哪个取决于你想强调“同阵营搭档”还是“同场竞争者”。
拼写上常见带连字符（co-candidate），也可见不带连字符（cocandidate），但正式写作中带连字符更清晰。

summary.en: A co-carrier is a partner carrier that shares transportation of the same shipment or passengers with another carrier.
summary.zh: co-carrier 指与另一承运人合作、共同完成同一批货物或乘客运输的“共同承运人/合作承运方”。

definition.en: A person, company, or transportation provider that carries goods or passengers together with another carrier, often sharing part of the route or responsibility.
definition.zh: 与另一家承运人共同运输货物或乘客的个人/公司/运输方，通常会分担路线或责任的一部分。

examples.en: The airline used a co-carrier to handle flights between smaller cities.
examples.zh: 这家航空公司使用共同承运人来负责小城市之间的航班。

examples.en: If your package is late, it may be with a co-carrier for the final delivery.
examples.zh: 如果你的包裹延误，可能是由共同承运人负责最后一段派送。

extraExplanation:
“Co-”表示“共同、一起”。“Co-carrier”常见于物流与运输行业（shipping, trucking, airline），强调“多个承运方合作完成同一票货/同一段运输”。
常见相关说法：
- last-mile carrier（最后一公里承运方）
- partner carrier（合作承运方）
- subcontracted carrier（分包承运方）
在航空业也可能与“codeshare（代码共享）”场景相关：乘客买同一张行程票，但实际某一段由合作航空公司执飞。

summary.en: “Co-caused” means something was caused jointly by two or more factors.
summary.zh: “Co-caused”表示某事由两个或多个因素共同造成。

definition.en: Caused jointly by two or more people, events, or factors (often used in academic or technical writing).
definition.zh: 由两个或多个个人、事件或因素共同造成的（常见于学术或技术写作）。

examples.en: The outage was co-caused by a software bug and a misconfigured firewall.
examples.zh: 这次系统中断是由软件漏洞和防火墙配置错误共同造成的。

examples.en: Researchers argue that the trend was co-caused by economic pressure and policy changes.
examples.zh: 研究人员认为，这一趋势是由经济压力和政策变化共同导致的。

definition.en: Past form of the verb “co-cause”: to cause something together with another factor or agent.
definition.zh: 动词“co-cause”的过去式：与其他因素或主体一起导致某事发生。

examples.en: Two separate failures co-caused the accident.
examples.zh: 两次独立的故障共同导致了这起事故。

examples.en: The changes were co-caused by market demand and new regulations.
examples.zh: 这些变化是由市场需求和新法规共同促成的。

extraExplanation: “co-”表示“共同、协同”（如 co-author 共同作者、cooperate 合作）。写作中常见“co-caused by A and B / co-caused with …”。
拼写上常见带连字符（co-caused），也可见不带连字符（cocaused），但带连字符更清晰、也更常见。

summary.en: “Co-celebrate” means to celebrate something together with others, especially as a shared event between groups.
summary.zh: “co-celebrate”指与他人一起庆祝，尤其强调不同群体共同参与的庆祝活动。

definition.en: to celebrate something together with other people (often used for events shared by different groups or communities)
definition.zh: 与他人一起庆祝（常用于不同群体或社区共同参与的活动）

examples.en: Families from both sides will co-celebrate the wedding this weekend.
examples.zh: 双方家庭将于本周末共同庆祝婚礼。

examples.en: Our school and the local community co-celebrate Lunar New Year every year.
examples.zh: 我们学校和当地社区每年都会共同庆祝农历新年。

extraExplanation: “co-”是英语里常见前缀，表示“共同、一起”。因此 co-celebrate 强调“共同参与庆祝”，比单纯 celebrate 更突出“共享/协作”的意味。
这个词在正式写作、新闻稿、活动宣传中更常见；日常口语里也可以说 celebrate together（一起庆祝）。

summary.en: “Co-celebrates” means “celebrates together with others” (he/she/it form).
summary.zh: “co-celebrates”表示“与他人共同庆祝”（他/她/它的动词形式）。

definition.en: (Third-person singular present) to celebrate something together with another person or group; to join in a celebration as partners or co-hosts.
definition.zh: （第三人称单数现在时）与他人或其他团体一起庆祝；作为共同主办者/参与者一同庆祝。

examples.en: She co-celebrates Lunar New Year with her neighbors every year.
examples.zh: 她每年都和邻居一起庆祝农历新年。

examples.en: The two teams co-celebrates the charity milestone with a small ceremony.
examples.zh: 两支队伍用一个小仪式共同庆祝慈善项目的里程碑。

examples.en: Our school co-celebrates the festival with the local community center.
examples.zh: 我们学校和当地社区中心共同庆祝这个节日。

extraExplanation: “co-”表示“共同、一起”。写作上有时会连字符（co-celebrate），也常见不加连字符（cocelebrate），含义相同。
“co-celebrates”是动词第三人称单数形式（he/she/it co-celebrates）。若主语是复数，用“co-celebrate”。

summary.en: Co-centric means ‘having the same center’ (literally) or ‘organized around the same core focus’ (figuratively).
summary.zh: co-centric意为“同心的”（字面）或“围绕同一核心/中心组织的”（比喻）。

definition.en: (Geometry/description) Having the same center point; sharing a common center.
definition.zh: （几何/描述）同心的；具有相同中心点的。

examples.en: The diagram shows two co-centric circles with different radii.
examples.zh: 图中显示了两个半径不同的同心圆。

examples.en: The co-centric rings expand outward from a single point.
examples.zh: 这些同心环从一个点向外扩展。

definition.en: (Figurative) Focused on the same core idea, goal, or hub; organized around one shared center.
definition.zh: （比喻）围绕同一个核心理念/目标/中心组织的；共用一个“中心”的。

examples.en: Their efforts were co-centric around improving public health.
examples.zh: 他们的努力同心协力地围绕改善公共健康这一核心。

examples.en: The project uses co-centric teams that report to one main coordinator.
examples.zh: 这个项目使用同心式团队架构，大家都向一个主要协调人汇报。

extraExplanation: “co-centric”在实际英语中相对少见，更常见的标准拼写是“concentric”（同心的）。在学术或设计语境里偶尔会看到带连字符的写法，用来强调“共同（co-）+中心（centric）”的构词含义。
“centric”来自“center（中心）”的词根含义，常见搭配还有：user-centric（以用户为中心）、data-centric（以数据为中心）。理解这一点有助于掌握“co-centric”的比喻用法。

summary.en: A co-CEO is one of two people who share the CEO role in a company.
summary.zh: co-CEO 指公司里由两人共同担任CEO时，其中一位联席首席执行官。

definition.en: one of two people who share the top job of chief executive officer in the same company
definition.zh: （公司中）共同担任首席执行官的两人之一；联席CEO之一

examples.en: After the merger, the new company appointed two co-CEOs to lead the transition.
examples.zh: 合并之后，新公司任命两位联席CEO来领导过渡期。

examples.en: She became co-CEO alongside her longtime business partner.
examples.zh: 她与多年的商业伙伴一起出任联席CEO。

examples.en: The co-CEOs split responsibilities: one focused on products, the other on operations.
examples.zh: 两位联席CEO分工：一位负责产品，另一位负责运营。

extraExplanation: “co-”这个前缀表示“共同、联合”（like co-founder, co-worker）。因此 co-CEO 强调“最高负责人由两人共同担任”。
书写上常见 co-CEO（带连字符）或 coCEO（较少）。复数通常写作 co-CEOs。
在公司治理语境中，设立 co-CEOs 往往用于合并后平衡权力、结合互补能力，或培养接班人；但也可能因决策分歧而增加协调成本。

summary.en: A co-chair is someone who shares the chairperson role, or the act of sharing that leadership.
summary.zh: co-chair 指共同主席（与他人共同担任主席），也可作动词表示共同主持。

definition.en: A person who shares the role of chair (leader) of a meeting, committee, or organization with one or more others.
definition.zh: 与他人共同担任会议、委员会或组织的主席（负责人）的人；共同主席。

examples.en: Dr. Lee is the co-chair of the conference planning committee.
examples.zh: 李博士是会议筹备委员会的共同主席。

examples.en: The two co-chairs will lead the discussion and approve the final agenda.
examples.zh: 两位共同主席将主持讨论并批准最终议程。

definition.en: To share the responsibility of chairing (leading) a meeting, committee, or organization.
definition.zh: 与他人共同主持（领导）会议、委员会或组织。

examples.en: She will co-chair the task force on workplace safety.
examples.zh: 她将共同主持职场安全工作组。

examples.en: They co-chaired the meeting to ensure both departments were represented.
examples.zh: 他们共同主持会议，以确保两个部门都有代表参与。

extraExplanation: “co-”表示“共同、一起”。“co-chair”在美式英语里既可写作带连字符（co-chair），也常见不带连字符（cochair）或写成两个词（co chair），以机构/写作风格指南为准。
在正式场合（公司、学校、学术会议、非营利组织）里很常用，强调“权责共享”，通常对应两位或以上共同主席。

summary.en: Co-chairing means sharing responsibility for leading a meeting or group as a chair with someone else.
summary.zh: co-chairing 指与他人共同担任主席/主持人，一起负责领导会议或组织。

definition.en: sharing the role of chair (leader) of a meeting, committee, or event with one or more other people
definition.zh: 与他人共同担任会议、委员会或活动的主席/主持人（共同领导）

examples.en: She is co-chairing the conference with a professor from Harvard.
examples.zh: 她正与一位哈佛教授共同主持这次会议。

examples.en: They are co-chairing the committee to make sure different groups are represented.
examples.zh: 他们共同担任委员会主席，以确保不同群体都有代表。

extraExplanation: “co-”表示“共同、一起”，如 co-worker（同事）、co-author（合著者）。因此 co-chairing 强调“共同担任主席/主持人”，常见于正式场合（公司、学术会议、非营利组织）。
在美式英语中，chair 可作动词表示“主持（会议）”。co-chairing 通常指正在进行的动作；对应名词是 co-chair（共同主席），如 “She is a co-chair of the event.”（她是该活动的共同主席）。

summary.en: Co-chairmanship means jointly serving as chair (shared leadership by two people).
summary.zh: co-chairmanship 指两人共同担任主席、共同领导的安排或任期。

definition.en: The shared position or role of being a co-chair; the arrangement where two people jointly lead a committee, meeting, or organization.
definition.zh: 共同主席的职位或角色；由两人共同领导一个委员会、会议或组织的安排。

examples.en: Under her co-chairmanship, the committee reached an agreement quickly.
examples.zh: 在她的共同主席任期内，委员会很快达成了协议。

examples.en: The event will be organized under the co-chairmanship of two professors.
examples.zh: 本次活动将由两位教授共同担任主席来组织。

extraExplanation: “co-”表示“共同、一起”。“chairmanship”指“主席（主持人）的职位/任期”。合在一起，co-chairmanship 强调“共同担任主席的制度或任期”，常用于正式场合（如委员会、会议、董事会、论坛）。
和 co-chair（共同主席）相比：co-chair 是“人”（头衔/职位），而 co-chairmanship 更像“职位/任期/领导安排”这个“状态或制度”。

summary.en: Co-chairs are two people who share the chair role; to co-chair means to lead something together.
summary.zh: co-chairs 指两位共同担任主席的人；to co-chair 指与他人共同主持/领导。

definition.en: Two people who share the role of chair (leader) of a committee, meeting, or organization.
definition.zh: （委员会/会议/组织的）联合主席；共同主席（两人共同担任主席职责）

examples.en: The co-chairs opened the meeting with a short welcome.
examples.zh: 联合主席用简短的致辞开场。

examples.en: Please send your questions to the co-chairs before Friday.
examples.zh: 请在周五前把问题发给联合主席。

definition.en: To lead or oversee a committee, meeting, or project together with another person.
definition.zh: 与他人共同主持；共同领导（委员会/会议/项目）

examples.en: She will co-chair the planning committee this year.
examples.zh: 今年她将共同主持策划委员会。

examples.en: They co-chaired the session on climate policy.
examples.zh: 他们共同主持了关于气候政策的分会场。

extraExplanation: “co-”表示“共同、联合”。写法常见为 co-chair（单数）、co-chairs（复数）；也有人写作 cochair / cochairs，但在正式写作中连字符更常见。
有时 “co-chair” 特指两位主席共同承担职责（平级）；如果是“副主席”则通常用 vice-chair / vice chair。

summary.en: Someone who shares a championship title with another winner.
summary.zh: 与他人并列、共同获得冠军头衔的人或队伍。

definition.en: a person or team that shares the championship title with another person or team (because they tied or were both declared winners)
definition.zh: 与他人或其他队伍共同获得冠军头衔的人或队伍（通常因并列或被共同宣布为冠军）

examples.en: The two schools were named co-champions after the final ended in a tie.
examples.zh: 决赛打成平局后，两所学校被宣布为共同冠军。

examples.en: She became co-champion of the tournament, sharing first place with her teammate.
examples.zh: 她成为该赛事的共同冠军，与队友并列第一。

extraExplanation: “co-”表示“共同、一起”，因此 co-champion 强调“共享冠军”，而不是“亚军”。在新闻和体育报道里很常见，尤其是出现并列第一、或因规则/赛程原因不进行加赛时。
拼写上常见两种形式：co-champion（更常见，带连字符）和 cochampion（较少见）。复数通常写作 co-champions。

summary.en: Co-champions are people or teams that share the championship title.
summary.zh: Co-champions 指共同（并列）获得冠军头衔的个人或队伍。

definition.en: two or more people or teams who share the championship title (because they tied, or because winners are named in different divisions or by agreement)
definition.zh: （因并列、分组或约定等原因）共同获得冠军头衔的两人或多支队伍

examples.en: The two schools finished with the same record, so they were named co-champions.
examples.zh: 两所学校战绩相同，所以被评为共同冠军。

examples.en: They were co-champions of the conference after the final ended in a draw.
examples.zh: 决赛打平后，他们成为该联盟的共同冠军。

examples.en: The league recognized both clubs as co-champions, and each received a trophy.
examples.zh: 联盟承认两家俱乐部为共同冠军，每家都获得了一座奖杯。

extraExplanation: “co-”这个前缀表示“共同、一起”（如 co-worker 同事、co-founder 共同创办人）。因此 co-champions 强调“共享冠军头衔”，并不表示“亚军”或“第二名”。
在体育新闻里，co-champions 常见于：赛季积分并列、没有进行加赛（tie-breaker）、或规则允许多队并列第一。有些赛事也会在不同组别（division）各出一个冠军时，用 co-champions 来概括。

summary.en: Co-chromatography is running an unknown sample together with a known standard in the same chromatography setup to help identify a compound by comparing their chromatographic behavior.
summary.zh: 共色谱是在同一色谱条件下将未知样品与已知标准品一起运行，通过比较色谱行为来辅助鉴定化合物。

definition.en: A chromatography method in which two (or more) samples—often an unknown and a known standard—are run together under the same conditions to compare their behavior (such as retention time or spot position) and help identify compounds.
definition.zh: 一种色谱方法：在相同条件下同时运行两份（或多份）样品（常见为未知样品与已知标准品），通过比较它们的行为（如保留时间或斑点位置）来辅助鉴定化合物。

examples.en: We used co-chromatography with a reference standard to confirm the identity of the drug impurity.
examples.zh: 我们用未知样品与对照品进行共色谱，以确认药物杂质的身份。

examples.en: In TLC, co-chromatography can show whether two substances have the same Rf value on the same plate.
examples.zh: 在薄层色谱（TLC）中，共色谱可以显示两种物质在同一块板上是否具有相同的Rf值。

examples.en: If the peaks overlap perfectly during co-chromatography, the unknown may match the standard—though additional tests are often needed.
examples.zh: 若共色谱时两个峰完全重合，未知物可能与标准品一致——但通常仍需要其他测试来进一步确认。

extraExplanation: 共色谱常用于分析化学与药物分析：把“未知样品”和“标准品”混合或并行进样，在同一套色谱条件下比较信号（如HPLC/GC的保留时间、TLC的Rf）。这样做能减少条件差异带来的误判。
需要注意：峰重合或Rf相同并不一定代表完全相同的化合物（可能存在共洗脱/共迁移）。因此实验上常配合质谱（LC‑MS/GC‑MS）、改变流动相或梯度、或使用不同色谱柱来进一步确认。

summary.en: Co-citizenship means sharing citizenship with others—being fellow citizens with shared rights and duties.
summary.zh: co-citizenship 指与他人共享公民身份、成为同一政治共同体中的同胞公民，并承担共同权利与义务。

definition.en: the state of sharing citizenship with someone else; a relationship of being fellow citizens in the same country or political community
definition.zh: 与他人共享同一国籍/公民身份的状态；同属一个国家或政治共同体的“同胞公民”关系

examples.en: The program was designed to strengthen co-citizenship among residents from different regions.
examples.zh: 该项目旨在加强来自不同地区居民之间的共同公民意识（同属公民关系）。

examples.en: In a democracy, co-citizenship implies shared rights and shared responsibilities.
examples.zh: 在民主制度中，共同公民身份意味着共同的权利与共同的责任。

extraExplanation: “co-”表示“共同、一起”（如 co-worker 同事）。因此 co-citizenship 常见于政治学、法学或公民教育语境，强调“同属公民”的连结与公共责任，而不是日常口语。
在欧盟或联邦制讨论中，有时会用类似概念来谈“跨地区/跨层级的共同公民身份”（例如地方与国家层面的公民身份如何并存），但具体用法取决于作者的理论框架。

summary.en: Co-claim means to make the same claim jointly with another person or group, especially in legal or official contexts.
summary.zh: Co-claim 指与他人共同提出同一项主张/权利要求，常用于法律或正式语境。

definition.en: to claim (something) jointly with another person or group; to make the same claim together
definition.zh: 与他人共同主张（权利/利益）；共同提出同一项请求

examples.en: Two neighboring countries co-claim the islands.
examples.zh: 两个邻国共同声称这些岛屿属于自己。

examples.en: In the lawsuit, the tenants co-claimed damages for unsafe living conditions.
examples.zh: 在这起诉讼中，房客共同主张因不安全居住条件而获得赔偿。

definition.en: (law/official writing) to state that you have the same right, title, or interest as another party
definition.zh: （法律/正式文书）与他方一起声明自己对某项权利、所有权或利益享有同等主张

examples.en: The heirs co-claimed ownership of the property in the filing.
examples.zh: 在提交的文件中，继承人共同主张该财产的所有权。

examples.en: Several communities co-claim historical ties to the site.
examples.zh: 多个社区共同主张与该地点有历史渊源。

extraExplanation: “co-”表示“共同、一起”。“co-claim”多见于法律、外交或保险等正式语境，强调“两个或以上主体同时提出同一项主张/权利要求”。日常口语更常说“claim together / jointly claim”。
注意与“counterclaim（反诉）”“reclaim（收回/重新主张）”区分：co-claim 不是“反对”，而是“共同”。

summary.en: A co-claimant is someone who makes a claim together with another person in the same case.
summary.zh: co-claimant 指在同一案件/申请中与他人一起提出主张或索赔的共同申诉人（共同申请人）。

definition.en: A person who makes a claim together with another person in the same legal case or application.
definition.zh: 在同一案件或同一申请中，与他人一起提出主张/索赔的人；共同申诉人（或共同申请人）。

examples.en: Both siblings were listed as co-claimants in the inheritance dispute.
examples.zh: 在这起遗产纠纷中，两位兄弟姐妹都被列为共同申诉人。

examples.en: The form requires each co-claimant to sign on the last page.
examples.zh: 表格要求每位共同申请人都在最后一页签字。

examples.en: As a co-claimant, she shared responsibility for providing evidence.
examples.zh: 作为共同申诉人，她也需要共同承担提供证据的责任。

extraExplanation: “Co-”表示“共同、一起”。“Co-claimant”常见于法律、保险理赔、移民/福利申请等正式语境，指两个或以上的人在同一事项中一起主张权利或提出请求。
与“claimant（申诉人/索赔人）”不同，“co-claimant”强调“同一方阵营里还有其他申诉人”；常与“respondent/defendant（被申请人/被告）”等相对出现。

summary.en: Co-clumping means clumping together with another group, especially in scientific contexts (cells, bacteria, particles).
summary.zh: Co-clumping 指与另一群体一起结团、共同聚集，常用于科学语境（细胞、细菌、颗粒等）。

definition.en: the process of forming clumps together with another substance or group (often used in biology/chemistry for cells, bacteria, or particles sticking together)
definition.zh: 与另一种物质或群体一起形成团块、共同聚集（常用于生物/化学语境，指细胞、细菌或颗粒彼此黏连成团）

examples.en: The researchers measured co-clumping between two bacterial strains.
examples.zh: 研究人员测量了两种细菌菌株之间的共同聚集（co-clumping）程度。

examples.en: Co-clumping can make the solution look cloudy or grainy.
examples.zh: 共同聚集会让溶液看起来浑浊或有颗粒感。

definition.en: (of particles, cells, etc.) to clump together with another group
definition.zh: （颗粒、细胞等）与另一群体一起结团、共同聚集

examples.en: These cells tend to co-clump when the temperature drops.
examples.zh: 温度下降时，这些细胞容易共同聚集成团。

examples.en: Different particles may co-clump after you add salt to the mixture.
examples.zh: 在混合物中加入盐后，不同颗粒可能会共同结团。

extraExplanation: 这个词多见于科研写作，尤其是微生物学里描述不同菌种“共同聚集”（也常写作 coaggregation）。日常英语中更常说 clump together / stick together。
拼写上常带连字符（co-clumping），也可能写作 coclustering / co-clustering（视领域而定）。

summary.en: “Co-clustered” means grouped together into the same cluster, often by an algorithm or analysis method.
summary.zh: “Co-clustered”指（通常由算法/分析方法）被一起归入同一簇、同一组。

definition.en: Grouped together into the same cluster (a set of similar items), especially in data analysis or scientific contexts.
definition.zh: 被归到同一簇（同一组相似事物）里；（尤指在数据分析或科研语境中）共同聚类的。

examples.en: In the heatmap, these genes are co-clustered, suggesting they may work in the same pathway.
examples.zh: 在热图中，这些基因被共同聚类，提示它们可能在同一条通路中发挥作用。

examples.en: Customers with similar buying patterns were co-clustered by the algorithm.
examples.zh: 购买模式相似的顾客被算法共同聚类到了一组。

definition.en: Past form of “co-cluster”: to cluster two or more types of items together (for example, users and products) using the same method.
definition.zh: “co-cluster”的过去式/过去分词：将两类或多类对象（如用户与商品）用同一方法一起聚类。

examples.en: The researchers co-clustered users and movies to find hidden preference groups.
examples.zh: 研究人员对用户和电影进行了共同聚类，以发现隐藏的偏好群体。

examples.en: We co-clustered the documents with the keywords to improve search suggestions.
examples.zh: 我们将文档与关键词共同聚类，以改进搜索建议。

extraExplanation: “co-”表示“共同、一起”。在机器学习/数据挖掘里，co-clustering（共同聚类、双聚类/协同聚类）常指同时对“行与列”（例如用户×商品矩阵）进行分组；在生物信息学里也常用来表示基因或样本在聚类结果中“落在同一簇”。写作中常见作形容词：co-clustered genes/samples/features。

summary.en: Co-coagulation means different substances clump together into larger particles, often to help removal or separation.
summary.zh: Co-coagulation 指不同物质共同凝聚成更大颗粒/絮体，常用于促进分离或去除。

definition.en: a process in which two or more substances (often particles, colloids, or contaminants) are made to clump together and form larger aggregates, usually to help separation (e.g., in water or wastewater treatment).
definition.zh: （常见于水/污水处理等领域的）协同凝聚/共凝作用：使两种或多种物质（如颗粒、胶体或污染物）一起聚集成更大的絮体，以便更容易分离或去除。

examples.en: In wastewater treatment, co-coagulation helps remove dyes by aggregating them with suspended solids.
examples.zh: 在污水处理中，共凝作用可以让染料与悬浮固体一起聚集，从而更容易被去除。

examples.en: The researchers studied co-coagulation of microplastics with natural organic matter.
examples.zh: 研究人员研究了微塑料与天然有机物的共凝作用。

extraExplanation: “co-”表示“共同、一起”。因此 co-coagulation 强调“共同凝聚/共同絮凝”，常用于环境工程、材料科学和化学语境。
在水处理里，它常与 coagulation（凝聚/混凝）和 flocculation（絮凝）一起出现：前者更偏“电荷中和、破稳”，后者更偏“形成更大絮体并沉降”。不同文献可能对两者界限描述略有差异。

summary.en: A co-combatant is someone who fights or struggles alongside you on the same side.
summary.zh: co-combatant 指与你在同一阵营并肩作战或共同斗争的人。

definition.en: A person who fights alongside another person or group; a fellow fighter (often on the same side in a conflict).
definition.zh: 与他人或某个团体并肩作战的人；共同战斗者（通常指同一阵营）。

examples.en: During the civil war, villagers sometimes became co-combatants with the local militia.
examples.zh: 在内战期间，村民有时会与当地民兵成为共同战斗者。

examples.en: He protected his co-combatants and refused to leave anyone behind.
examples.zh: 他保护战友，拒绝把任何人落下。

definition.en: A companion in a shared struggle or cause, not necessarily involving literal fighting (more formal).
definition.zh: 在共同斗争或共同事业中的伙伴（不一定是真正的战斗语境，较正式）。

examples.en: In the fight against corruption, they saw journalists as co-combatants.
examples.zh: 在反腐斗争中，他们把记者视为同一战线的伙伴。

examples.en: She spoke of her co-combatants in the movement with deep respect.
examples.zh: 她怀着深深的敬意谈起运动中的同道者。

extraExplanation: 该词由前缀 co-（“共同、一起”）+ combatant（“战斗人员”）构成，常见于较正式或带政治色彩的语境。
与“comrade（同志/战友）”相比，co-combatant更强调“在同一战线作战/斗争”的关系，语气更书面。

summary.en: A co-complainer is someone who complains with you about the same issue, often echoing or sharing your frustration.
summary.zh: co-complainer 指与你一起抱怨同一件事、互相附和或分享不满的人。

definition.en: a person who complains together with you, often supporting or echoing your complaints (especially about the same problem).
definition.zh: 与你一起抱怨的人；同病相怜、一起吐槽同一件事的人（常指附和你的抱怨）。

examples.en: When the Wi‑Fi went down, I finally found a co-complainer in the break room.
examples.zh: Wi‑Fi 断了的时候，我终于在休息室找到了一个一起吐槽的人。

examples.en: She isn’t just a listener—she’s a co-complainer who always has her own story.
examples.zh: 她不只是听众——她还是个一起抱怨的人，总有自己的经历要说。

examples.en: It helps to have a co-complainer, but we should also look for solutions.
examples.zh: 有个一起抱怨的人会好受些，但我们也该找解决办法。

extraExplanation: “co-”是前缀，意思是“共同、一起”（如 co-worker 同事、co-founder 联合创始人）。因此 co-complainer 字面就是“共同抱怨的人”。
这个词偏口语、非正式，有时带一点幽默或自嘲；在职场或朋友圈里常用来指“能共鸣、一起吐槽的人”。

summary.en: A co-conqueror is someone who conquers together with another person.
summary.zh: co-conqueror 指“与他人一起征服的人”，强调共同完成征服。

definition.en: a person who conquers a place or people together with someone else; a joint conqueror.
definition.zh: 与他人一起征服某地或某民族的人；共同征服者。

examples.en: The king ruled the new territory with his co-conqueror after the war.
examples.zh: 战后，国王与他的共同征服者一起统治这片新领土。

examples.en: In the epic story, two brothers are portrayed as co-conquerors of a distant land.
examples.zh: 在这部史诗故事中，两兄弟被描绘为征服远方土地的共同征服者。

extraExplanation: “co-”是常见前缀，表示“共同、一起”，如 co-founder（共同创办人）、co-author（合著者）。因此 co-conqueror 强调“并非独自征服”，而是与他人协同完成。
该词较少见，更多出现在历史叙述、文学作品或带有修辞色彩的写作中；日常英语里更常用 “joint conqueror” 或直接说 “they conquered it together”。
拼写上常见带连字符（co-conqueror），也可能写作 coconqueror，但带连字符更清晰、也更常见。

summary.en: A co-consecrator is a bishop who assists the main consecrator in the consecration of a new bishop.
summary.zh: co-consecrator 指在祝圣新主教时协助首席祝圣者共同完成祝圣的主教。

definition.en: a bishop who helps the main consecrating bishop ordain (consecrate) a new bishop in a formal church ceremony
definition.zh: （天主教/圣公会等）在祝圣新主教的正式仪式中，协助主要祝圣者共同祝圣的主教；共同祝圣者

examples.en: At the ceremony, the principal consecrator was joined by two co-consecrators.
examples.zh: 在仪式上，首席祝圣者由两位共同祝圣者陪同完成祝圣。

examples.en: The record lists the new bishop, the principal consecrator, and the co-consecrators.
examples.zh: 记录中列出了新主教、首席祝圣者以及共同祝圣者。

extraExplanation: “co-”表示“共同、一起”。“consecrator”来自 consecrate（祝圣、奉献；使神圣）。因此 co-consecrator 字面意思是“共同进行祝圣的人”。
该词多见于教会历史、主教谱系（apostolic succession 使徒传承）或礼仪记录中，强调有不止一位主教参与按立/祝圣，以体现仪式的合规性与传承。

summary.en: A co-conspirator is someone who secretly plans and commits a crime or harmful act with another person.
summary.zh: co-conspirator 指与他人一起秘密策划并实施犯罪或有害行为的“同谋者/共谋者”。

definition.en: A person who works together with someone else to secretly plan and commit an illegal or harmful act.
definition.zh: 共谋者；同谋者：与他人一起秘密策划并实施违法或有害行为的人。

examples.en: The prosecutor said the defendant and a co-conspirator planned the robbery together.
examples.zh: 检察官说，被告与一名同谋共同策划了这起抢劫。

examples.en: Police arrested two suspects and their co-conspirator.
examples.zh: 警方逮捕了两名嫌疑人及其同谋。

examples.en: She refused to name her co-conspirators in court.
examples.zh: 她拒绝在法庭上指认她的同谋。

extraExplanation: “co-”表示“共同、一起”（如 co-worker 同事、co-author 合著者）。因此 co-conspirator 字面意思是“共同密谋的人”。
这是偏法律/新闻语境的词：在美国法律里常见于“conspiracy（共谋罪）”相关案件报道或法庭文件中。
日常表达里，如果只是“和朋友一起搞小计划（不违法）”，通常不会用 co-conspirator；可以说 “partner in crime”（多为玩笑用法）或 “accomplice”（更常见，也可指犯罪同伙）。

summary.en: Co-conspirators are people who secretly plan and act together in a conspiracy.
summary.zh: Co-conspirators 指在同一阴谋或共谋中秘密策划并共同行动的人。

definition.en: People who secretly plan and work together with others to do something illegal or harmful; partners in a conspiracy.
definition.zh: 与他人秘密合谋实施非法或有害行为的人；共谋者。

examples.en: The police arrested three co-conspirators in the fraud case.
examples.zh: 警方在这起诈骗案中逮捕了三名共谋者。

examples.en: Emails showed that the co-conspirators discussed how to hide the money.
examples.zh: 电子邮件显示这些共谋者讨论了如何藏匿资金。

examples.en: He refused to name his co-conspirators in court.
examples.zh: 他在法庭上拒绝指认他的共谋者。

extraExplanation: “co-”表示“共同、一起”（如 co-worker 同事）。因此 co-conspirator 字面意思是“共同参与阴谋的人”。
在新闻与法律语境中很常见：co-conspirators 常指同案的其他涉案者，不一定每个人都被起诉，但都被认为参与了同一“conspiracy（共谋/阴谋）”。
与“accomplice（同谋/帮凶）”相比，co-conspirator 更强调“共同策划（plan）”这一点；accomplice 更强调“帮助犯罪（help commit a crime）”，不一定参与策划。

summary.en: A co-constituent is a linguistic unit that occurs alongside another unit within the same larger phrase or clause.
summary.zh: co-constituent 指语言学中的“共成分”：在同一更大结构（短语/从句）中与另一成分并列出现的成分。

definition.en: (Linguistics) A part (constituent) that appears together with another part inside the same larger phrase or clause; a “sister” element in a sentence structure.
definition.zh: （语言学）在同一个更大短语或从句中与另一个成分一起出现的成分；在句法结构中与之并列的“姐妹成分”。

examples.en: In the noun phrase “the red car,” “red” is a co-constituent of “car.”
examples.zh: 在名词短语“the red car（那辆红色的车）”中，“red”是“car”的共成分。

examples.en: The subject and the predicate are co-constituents of a basic clause in many analyses.
examples.zh: 在许多分析中，主语和谓语是基本从句的共成分。

examples.en: To find a word’s co-constituents, linguists often look at which words group together in a syntax tree.
examples.zh: 要找出一个词的共成分，语言学家常看句法树里哪些词会被分在同一组。

extraExplanation: “co-”表示“共同、一起”。因此 co-constituent 强调“在同一层级、同一结构里并列出现的成分”。
它常见于句法学（syntax）讨论，比如用括号或“树状图（syntax tree）”表示结构时，同一母节点（parent node）下的两个子节点（children）通常互为 co-constituents（也可理解为 sibling constituents）。
这个词多用于学术写作与课堂讨论，日常英语中不常用。

summary.en: Co-constitution means being formed together or mutually shaping each other; it can also mean a jointly created set of rules or a constitution.
summary.zh: co-constitution 指“共同构成/相互塑造”，也可指“共同制定的章程/宪章”。

definition.en: the process or idea that two or more things are formed, defined, or shaped together (each helps make the other what it is)
definition.zh: （两个或多个事物）共同构成、共同形成的过程或观点（彼此塑造彼此的性质与意义）

examples.en: In many relationships, trust and communication develop through co-constitution—each strengthens the other over time.
examples.zh: 在许多关系中，信任与沟通会通过“共同构成”而发展——它们会随着时间彼此强化。

examples.en: The study argues that culture and identity are in co-constitution, not separate forces.
examples.zh: 这项研究认为，文化与身份是“共同构成”的，而不是彼此分离的力量。

definition.en: a shared or jointly created constitution, rules, or framework (often used in legal or organizational contexts)
definition.zh: 共同制定的“宪章/章程/规则体系”（常用于法律或组织语境）

examples.en: The partners drafted a co-constitution to define decision-making and responsibilities.
examples.zh: 合伙人起草了一份共同章程，用来界定决策方式与责任分工。

examples.en: The new council proposed a co-constitution with community representatives.
examples.zh: 新委员会提议与社区代表共同制定章程。

extraExplanation: “co-constitution”在学术写作里更常见，尤其在人文社科（如社会学、文化研究、性别研究、现象学）中，强调“主体与世界/社会结构是相互生成的”，而不是单向决定。可理解为“互相塑造、互相成就”。
词形提示：co-（共同）+ constitution（构成/宪章）。写作中也常见拼写变体 coconstitution 或 co constitution；是否加连字符取决于期刊/出版社风格。

summary.en: Co-constructed describes something created or developed together through collaboration, especially shared understanding or knowledge built through interaction.
summary.zh: Co-constructed 指通过合作共同建构出来的事物，尤其常指在互动中共同形成的理解或知识。

definition.en: Made, created, or developed together by two or more people through collaboration.
definition.zh: 由两人或多人共同合作而建构、创造或发展出来的。

examples.en: The final report was co-constructed by the research team and community leaders.
examples.zh: 最终报告由研究团队和社区领袖共同建构完成。

examples.en: They used a shared document to produce a co-constructed plan.
examples.zh: 他们用共享文档共同制定了一个共建计划。

definition.en: (Education) Jointly developed by teachers and learners (or among learners), especially referring to meaning, knowledge, rules, or classroom norms built through interaction.
definition.zh: （教育）由教师与学习者（或学习者之间）通过互动共同建构的，尤指共同建构的意义、知识、规则或课堂规范。

examples.en: In a discussion-based class, understanding is often co-constructed through questions and examples.
examples.zh: 在讨论式课堂中，理解常常通过提问和举例被共同建构出来。

examples.en: The teacher and students set co-constructed classroom expectations.
examples.zh: 老师和学生共同制定了课堂期望与规范。

extraExplanation: “co-constructed”常见于教育学与社会科学（如“co-constructed knowledge/meaning/identity”），强调结果不是单方灌输，而是在对话、协商、反馈中逐步形成。
拼写上常见带连字符 co-constructed，也可见不带连字符 coconstructed（较少）。它通常作形容词，描述名词：co-constructed solution/understanding.
相关动词是 co-construct（共同建构/共同构建）；写作中可用被动：was co-constructed（被共同建构）。

summary.en: Co-conveners are people who share responsibility for organizing and leading a group or meeting.
summary.zh: co-conveners 指共同承担组织与召集职责的“联合召集人/共同召集人”。

definition.en: People who jointly organize and lead a meeting, committee, event, or working group (sharing the role of convener).
definition.zh: 共同召集人；联合召集人（共同负责召集并组织会议、委员会、活动或工作组的人）。

examples.en: The co-conveners set the agenda and invited speakers for the workshop.
examples.zh: 联合召集人制定了议程，并邀请讲者参加这次工作坊。

examples.en: Please contact the co-conveners if you have questions about the working group.
examples.zh: 如果你对该工作组有疑问，请联系共同召集人。
