examples.en: Two co-conveners will coordinate the monthly meetings to share the workload.
examples.zh: 两位联合召集人将协调每月会议，以分担工作量。

extraExplanation: “Co-”表示“共同、联合”。“convener”在英式/国际组织语境（如学术会议、协会、委员会）里很常见，指“召集并推动某个小组或议题的人”。加上“co-”后强调两人或多人共同承担该职责。
拼写上常见写法有“co-convener / co-convenor”（两者都可见）以及复数“co-conveners”。在正式文件中通常保留连字符以提高可读性。

summary.en: A co-covenantor is someone who makes the same covenant (formal agreement/promise) together with another person.
summary.zh: co-covenantor 指与他人一起订立同一份盟约（正式协议/承诺）的人。

definition.en: a person who enters into the same covenant (formal agreement or solemn promise) with another person; a joint covenant partner
definition.zh: 与他人一同订立盟约（正式协议或庄严承诺）的人；共同立约者

examples.en: In the contract, each co-covenantor promised to follow the same confidentiality rules.
examples.zh: 在合同中，每位共同立约者都承诺遵守同样的保密规定。

examples.en: In some religious writing, believers are described as co-covenantors with one another.
examples.zh: 在一些宗教著作中，信徒被描述为彼此的共同立约者。

extraExplanation: 这个词比较少见，更多出现在法律/宗教语境里，用来强调“共同承担盟约义务或共同享有盟约权利”的关系。
形式上由 co-（共同）+ covenant（盟约/契约）+ -or（做某事的人）构成。日常英语里更常用的近义表达包括 joint party to the covenant、covenant partner、co-promisor（在承诺关系中）等。

summary.en: Co-create means to create something together with others through shared ideas and collaboration.
summary.zh: Co-create 指与他人通过共享想法与协作来共同创造某事。

definition.en: to create something together with other people, by sharing ideas, decisions, and work (often used in business, design, education, and community projects)
definition.zh: 与他人共同创造（一起分享想法、共同决策并协作完成；常用于商业、设计、教育和社区项目）

examples.en: We co-created a new lesson plan with the teachers and the students.
examples.zh: 我们和老师、学生一起共创了一份新的课程计划。

examples.en: The company invited customers to co-create the next product features.
examples.zh: 公司邀请顾客一起共创下一代产品功能。

examples.en: They co-created a mural that tells the neighborhood’s story.
examples.zh: 他们共同创作了一幅讲述社区故事的壁画。

extraExplanation: “co-”表示“共同、一起”，所以 co-create 强调“共同参与创作过程”，不仅是“合作完成任务”。
写法上常见 co-create（带连字符），也有人写作 cocreate；在正式写作中保持同一种写法即可。
在职场与创新语境里，co-create 常暗示“让使用者/客户/利益相关者参与设计”，类似于“共同设计、共创价值”。

summary.en: Co-created means made together with others (collaboratively).
summary.zh: co-created 指“由多人共同创作/共同开发”的（协作完成的）。

definition.en: made or developed together by two or more people or groups; created collaboratively
definition.zh: 由两人或多个个人/团队共同制作或开发的；协作创作的

examples.en: The museum and local artists co-created an exhibition about community history.
examples.zh: 博物馆与当地艺术家共同策划了一场关于社区历史的展览。

examples.en: This app was co-created by engineers and teachers to support students.
examples.zh: 这款应用由工程师和教师共同开发，用来帮助学生。

definition.en: past form of co-create: to make or develop something together with others
definition.zh: co-create 的过去式：与他人一起创造或开发某物

examples.en: They co-created a short film for the school festival.
examples.zh: 他们为学校节日共同制作了一部短片。

examples.en: We co-created the plan with our partners to avoid misunderstandings.
examples.zh: 我们与合作伙伴共同制定了计划，以避免误解。

extraExplanation: “co-”表示“共同、一起”。因此 co-created 强调不是一个人单独完成，而是多人协作完成。
拼写上常见两种：co-created（带连字符）与 cocreated（不带连字符）。在商业/产品/内容语境中，带连字符更常见、也更清晰。
在职场或品牌语境里，co-created 常用于强调“与用户/客户/合作伙伴共同参与设计”，带有“共创（co-creation）”的意味。

summary.en: Co-creating means collaborating to create something together; it’s often used in business, design, and education.
summary.zh: co-creating 指与他人协作共同创造，常用于商业、设计与教育语境。

definition.en: working together with others to create or design something (a product, plan, event, story, etc.)
definition.zh: 与他人共同创作/共同设计（产品、计划、活动、故事等）

examples.en: Our team is co-creating a new app with users so it fits their real needs.
examples.zh: 我们团队正在与用户共同开发一款新应用，这样才能真正满足他们的需求。

examples.en: The teacher asked the class to co-create the rules for group work.
examples.zh: 老师让全班一起共同制定小组合作的规则。

examples.en: They’re co-creating a marketing campaign with a local artist.
examples.zh: 他们正在和一位本地艺术家共同打造一场营销活动。

definition.en: (less common) shaping an outcome together—often used in self-help or spiritual contexts to mean ‘creating your reality with the universe or with other people’
definition.zh: （较少见）共同促成某个结果——常用于自助/身心灵语境，指“与宇宙或与他人一起创造你的现实/结果”

examples.en: She believes we are co-creating our future through our choices.
examples.zh: 她相信我们正在通过自己的选择共同创造未来。

examples.en: They talked about co-creating a peaceful home by changing daily habits.
examples.zh: 他们谈到通过改变日常习惯来共同营造一个平和的家。

extraExplanation: “co-creating”是动词“co-create”的现在分词/动名词形式，常见于商业、产品设计、教育与社区项目中，强调“与利益相关者一起做”，而不只是单方面提供。
拼写上可写作“co-create / co-creating”（带连字符）或“cocreate / cocreating”（不带连字符）；在正式写作里带连字符更常见，也更易读。
相关常见搭配：co-creating value（共同创造价值）、co-creating with customers/users（与客户/用户共创）、co-creation workshop（共创工作坊）。

summary.en: Co-creation means making something together, often with users or customers as active partners.
summary.zh: Co-creation 指“共创/协同创造”，常指与用户或客户作为伙伴一起参与创造。

definition.en: the process of creating something together with others, especially with customers, users, or community members
definition.zh: 共创；协同创造（指与他人一起创造事物，尤其与客户、用户或社群共同参与）

examples.en: The company uses co-creation with customers to design new features.
examples.zh: 这家公司通过与客户共创来设计新功能。

examples.en: In the workshop, students and teachers practiced co-creation on a community project.
examples.zh: 在工作坊里，学生和老师在一个社区项目上进行共创。

definition.en: (in business/marketing) a strategy where a brand and its users jointly develop products, services, or experiences
definition.zh: （商业/营销）共创策略：品牌与用户共同开发产品、服务或体验

examples.en: Co-creation can improve product fit because users share real needs early.
examples.zh: 共创能提高产品契合度，因为用户会更早分享真实需求。

examples.en: They invited fans into a co-creation campaign to shape the next release.
examples.zh: 他们邀请粉丝参与共创活动来塑造下一次发布内容。

extraExplanation: “co-”表示“共同、一起”。“co-creation”常见于设计思维（design thinking）、用户体验（UX）与创新管理语境，强调从一开始就让相关者参与，而不只是最后收集反馈。
近义但不完全相同：collaboration（协作，范围更广）、crowdsourcing（众包，强调向大众征集）、user-centered design（以用户为中心的设计，未必共同“创造”）。

summary.en: A co-creator is someone who creates something together with others, often used as an official credit in media or projects.
summary.zh: co-creator 指「共同創作者／共同主創」，強調與他人一起創作或被正式署名。

definition.en: A person who helps create something together with one or more other people (such as a project, product, story, or organization).
definition.zh: 共同創作者；與他人一起創作或建立某事的人。

examples.en: She is the co-creator of the app, working with two classmates.
examples.zh: 她是這款應用程式的共同創作者，和兩位同學一起完成。

examples.en: He and his sister are co-creators of the nonprofit.
examples.zh: 他和妹妹是這個非營利組織的共同創辦人／共同創作者。

definition.en: In film/TV/media, a person officially credited with creating a show, series, or other creative work together with another creator.
definition.zh: （影視／媒體）共同主創；與他人一起被正式署名為作品（如影集）創作者的人。

examples.en: The co-creator of the series said the idea came from real life.
examples.zh: 該影集的共同主創表示，靈感來自真實生活。

examples.en: She is listed as co-creator and executive producer.
examples.zh: 她被列為共同主創與執行製作人。

extraExplanation: 「co-」表示「共同、一起」。因此 co-creator 強調「共同創作」的身份，常用於正式介紹、新聞報導、片頭／片尾字幕與專案署名。
拼寫上可見 co-creator（有連字號）或 cocreator（較少）。寫作時依照你所在機構的風格指南（如公司、期刊）選用即可。

summary.en: “Co-creators” means people who make or invent something together.
summary.zh: “co-creators”指一起创作或创造某事的人（共同创作者）。

definition.en: people who create something together; joint creators (plural of “co-creator”)
definition.zh: 共同创作者；合作者（“co-creator”的复数）

examples.en: The show’s co-creators said the story was inspired by real events.
examples.zh: 这部剧的共同创作者表示，故事灵感来自真实事件。

examples.en: As co-creators of the project, we share both the credit and the responsibility.
examples.zh: 作为这个项目的共同创作者，我们既共享荣誉也共同承担责任。

examples.en: She and her brother are co-creators of the app.
examples.zh: 她和她哥哥是这款应用的共同创作者。

extraExplanation: “co-”是常见前缀，表示“共同、一起”（如 co-founder 共同创办人、co-author 合著者）。
写法上既可写作 co-creator（常见、清晰），也可写作 cocreator（较少见）。复数通常加 -s：co-creators。
语境上常用于作品、项目、公司或活动的“共同发起/共同创作”，强调双方（或多方）都有实质性贡献。

summary.en: A co-creditor is one of two or more creditors who share a claim against the same debtor.
summary.zh: co-creditor 指“共同债权人”，即与他人共同对同一债务人享有债权的人或机构。

definition.en: A person or organization that is a creditor together with another creditor(s), sharing the right to be repaid by the same debtor (often under the same debt or obligation).
definition.zh: 与其他债权人共同享有同一债务人偿还请求权的人或机构（通常针对同一笔债务或同一项义务）。

examples.en: If there are co-creditors, the debtor may have to pay them according to the agreement or the law.
examples.zh: 如果存在共同债权人，债务人可能需要按照约定或法律向他们付款。

examples.en: The bank and the supplier became co-creditors after they both lent money to the company under one financing plan.
examples.zh: 在同一融资方案下，银行和供应商都向该公司出借资金后，成为共同债权人。

extraExplanation: “co-”表示“共同、一起”，所以 co-creditor 字面意思是“共同的债权人”。在法律与商务语境中更常见。
不同法域对共同债权人的规则可能不同：例如债务人能否向其中一位全额清偿、共同债权人之间如何分配、是否需要共同同意等，往往取决于合同条款与当地法律。
相关常见搭配：co-debtor（共同债务人）、joint creditor（共同债权人，含义接近）、creditor（债权人）、debtor（债务人）。

summary.en: Co-curricular means “supporting or connected to classroom learning,” especially activities like clubs, sports, and service.
summary.zh: co-curricular 指“与课堂学习相配合、起补充作用的”，常指社团、体育、服务等活动。

definition.en: (In schools/education) connected with activities that support or complement what students learn in class, such as clubs, sports, music, debate, or service.
definition.zh: （学校/教育语境）与课堂学习相配合、起补充作用的活动相关的，如社团、体育、音乐、辩论或志愿服务。

examples.en: Our school offers many co-curricular activities, including robotics club and basketball.
examples.zh: 我们学校提供很多课外配套活动，包括机器人社团和篮球。

examples.en: Co-curricular programs help students build teamwork and leadership skills.
examples.zh: 课外配套项目能帮助学生培养团队合作和领导力。

extraExplanation: “co-”表示“共同、一起”。因此 co-curricular 的意思是“与课程（curriculum）一起配套进行的”。
它常和 extracurricular（课外的）一起比较：extracurricular 更强调“在课程之外”；co-curricular 更强调“与学习目标相关、能支持课堂学习”，例如把社区服务与课堂主题结合的项目。
常见搭配：co-curricular activities/programs/learning; co-curricular record（课外配套活动记录，用于申请/评估）。

summary.en: A co-custodian is someone who shares custodial responsibility—either for property/records or, in legal use, for a child or dependent.
summary.zh: co-custodian 指与他人共同承担保管/管理责任的人；在法律语境中也可指共同监护人。

definition.en: A person who shares responsibility for taking care of something (such as a building, records, or property) together with another custodian.
definition.zh: 与他人共同负责保管、照管某物（如大楼、档案或财产）的人；共同管理人。

examples.en: The museum appointed two co-custodians to oversee the artifacts during renovation.
examples.zh: 博物馆任命了两位共同管理人，在翻修期间负责监管文物。

examples.en: As co-custodian of the files, she controls who can access the records.
examples.zh: 作为档案的共同管理人，她负责控制谁可以查阅记录。

definition.en: In legal contexts, a person who shares custody or guardianship responsibilities, often referring to a child or dependent.
definition.zh: （法律语境）共同承担监护或照护责任的人；共同监护人（常用于孩子或被照护者）。

examples.en: After the divorce, both parents served as co-custodians of their child.
examples.zh: 离婚后，父母双方都作为孩子的共同监护人。

examples.en: The court recognized the aunt as a co-custodian alongside the child’s father.
examples.zh: 法院认可孩子的姑妈与孩子的父亲共同担任监护人。

extraExplanation: “co-”是常见前缀，表示“共同、一起”（如 co-worker 同事，co-founder 共同创办人）。因此 co-custodian 字面意思就是“共同的保管/监护者”。
该词多见于机构管理或法律文件中；日常口语里，人们更常说 “we share custody” 或直接说 “joint custody（共同监护）”。

summary.en: A co-debtor is someone who shares legal responsibility for the same debt with another person.
summary.zh: co-debtor 指与他人共同对同一债务承担法律偿还责任的人。

definition.en: A person who shares responsibility with another person for paying back a debt; someone who owes the same debt together with you.
definition.zh: 与他人共同承担还款责任的人；与你一起对同一笔债务负有偿还义务的人。

examples.en: If you miss a payment, the co-debtor may have to pay the full amount.
examples.zh: 如果你错过还款，共同债务人可能需要支付全部金额。

examples.en: The bank asked his spouse to sign as a co-debtor on the loan.
examples.zh: 银行要求他的配偶在贷款上作为共同债务人签字。

examples.en: Before agreeing to be a co-debtor, read the contract carefully.
examples.zh: 在同意成为共同债务人之前，要仔细阅读合同。

extraExplanation: 这是一个法律/金融用语，常见于贷款、担保、分期付款等情境。成为 co-debtor 往往意味着你对债务承担“连带责任”（可能需要在对方不还时替对方还），不只是“帮忙签名”。不同国家和合同条款对责任范围的规定可能不同，签署前最好咨询专业人士或仔细确认条款。

summary.en: A co-defendant is someone who is a defendant in the same case as another defendant.
summary.zh: co-defendant 指在同一案件中与他人一起被起诉的“共同被告”。

definition.en: A person who is charged in a court case together with another defendant (in the same case).
definition.zh: 在同一案件中与另一名被告一起被起诉/被告的人；共同被告。

examples.en: The prosecutor said the co-defendant helped plan the robbery.
examples.zh: 检察官说共同被告参与策划了这起抢劫。

examples.en: She agreed to testify against her co-defendant in exchange for a lighter sentence.
examples.zh: 她同意出庭指证共同被告，以换取较轻的刑罚。

extraExplanation: 这是法律语境里的常用词，常见于新闻报道、法庭记录和律师沟通中。co- 表示“共同、一起”（如 co-worker 同事），defendant 是“被告”。
共同被告不一定承担相同责任：同案中的不同被告可能被指控不同罪名，或在事实认定与量刑上有所区别。
在美国英语中也常写作 co-defendant（带连字符）；有时会看到 codefendant（不加连字符），但前者更常见。

summary.en: Co-defendants are people who are defendants together in the same legal case.
summary.zh: co-defendants 指在同一案件中一起被起诉或被指控的“共同被告”。

definition.en: A person who is charged in the same court case (lawsuit or criminal case) together with one or more other defendants.
definition.zh: 在同一案件（民事或刑事）中与其他被告一起被起诉或被指控的人（共同被告）。

examples.en: The judge allowed the co-defendants to sit together during the hearing.
examples.zh: 法官允许共同被告在庭审期间坐在一起。

examples.en: One of the co-defendants accepted a plea deal and agreed to testify.
examples.zh: 其中一名共同被告接受了认罪协议，并同意出庭作证。

examples.en: The lawyer argued that the co-defendants played different roles in the incident.
examples.zh: 律师主张共同被告在事件中扮演的角色不同。

extraExplanation: “co-”表示“共同、一起”。因此 co-defendant 字面意思是“共同的被告”。在法律语境里，co-defendants 可能会有不同的利益与辩护策略：有时会联合辩护，有时也可能互相指责（英文常说“point the finger at each other”）。
在刑事案件中，若某位共同被告与检方达成认罪协商并出庭作证，英语里常见说法有 “plea deal / plea bargain” 和 “testify against a co-defendant”（指控/作证指向共同被告）。

summary.en: Co-deify means to deify two figures together, or (figuratively) to praise two things as if they were beyond criticism.
summary.zh: Co-deify 指把两个对象一起神化、同等奉为神明；也可比喻把两者一起过度吹捧到近乎不可批评。

definition.en: to treat someone or something as a god together with another person or thing; to worship as equally divine
definition.zh: 把某人或某物与另一位（或另一物）一起神化；共同当作神来崇拜（视为同等神圣）

examples.en: In some legends, people co-deify a hero and a local spirit, honoring both at the same shrine.
examples.zh: 在一些传说中，人们会把英雄和地方神灵一起神化，在同一座神龛里同时供奉。

examples.en: The poet’s fans sometimes co-deify him with the movement itself, treating both as sacred.
examples.zh: 这位诗人的粉丝有时会把他和那场运动一起神化，把两者都当成神圣的存在。

definition.en: (figurative) to praise two people or things so extremely that they seem perfect or beyond criticism
definition.zh: （比喻）把两个人或事物一起吹捧到近乎“完美无缺”、不容置疑的程度

examples.en: Online communities can co-deify a celebrity and their brand, ignoring real problems.
examples.zh: 网络社群可能会把明星和其品牌一起神化，从而忽视真实的问题。

examples.en: It’s easy to co-deify talent and success, but both can come from luck and help.
examples.zh: 人们很容易把才华和成功一起神化，但它们也可能来自运气与他人的帮助。

extraExplanation: “co-”表示“共同、一起”，加在动词前强调“与……一起做某事”；“deify”意为“神化、奉为神明”。因此“co-deify”字面就是“共同神化”。
该词较少见，多用于讨论宗教神话、文化崇拜或对名人/观念的夸张崇拜（比喻用法）。正式写作中也可用更常见的表达，如“deify both A and B / idolize both A and B”。

summary.en: A co-deposit is a deposit paid or made jointly by two or more people; it can also mean to deposit jointly.
summary.zh: co-deposit 指两人或多人共同缴纳的押金/订金（或共同存款），也可作动词表示共同存入。

definition.en: A deposit made by two or more people together, or a deposit paid jointly (for example, by roommates or business partners).
definition.zh: 由两人或多人共同缴纳的押金/订金；联合支付的存款或保证金。

examples.en: The landlord asked for a co-deposit from both roommates before handing over the keys.
examples.zh: 房东要求两位室友共同缴纳押金后才交钥匙。

examples.en: We made a co-deposit to reserve the venue for our event.
examples.zh: 我们共同付了订金来预订活动场地。

definition.en: To deposit money jointly with another person or group.
definition.zh: 与他人共同存入（钱）；联合缴存。

examples.en: They co-deposited $1,000 into a shared savings account.
examples.zh: 他们共同向一个联名储蓄账户存入了1000美元。

extraExplanation: “co-”表示“共同、联合”。“co-deposit”不是非常常见的日常词，更常见的表达有：joint deposit（联合押金/共同存款）、split the deposit（分摊押金）、pay the deposit together（一起付订金/押金）。
含义会随语境变化：在租房场景多指押金（security deposit）；在订票/预订场景多指订金（deposit/down payment）；在银行场景则更接近共同存款。

summary.en: “Co-deposited” means two or more substances were deposited together in the same process, often in scientific or industrial contexts.
summary.zh: “co-deposited”指两种或以上物质在同一工艺中一起沉积，常用于科研或工业语境。

definition.en: (of materials, chemicals, or particles) deposited together at the same time onto the same surface or into the same layer.
definition.zh: （指材料、化学物质或颗粒）在同一时间共同沉积到同一表面或同一层中。

examples.en: Gold and palladium were co-deposited to form a thin alloy film.
examples.zh: 金和钯被共同沉积，形成了一层很薄的合金膜。

examples.en: The co-deposited coating showed better wear resistance than either metal alone.
examples.zh: 这种共同沉积的涂层比单独使用任一种金属更耐磨。

definition.en: Past tense / past participle of co-deposit: to deposit two or more substances together in one process.
definition.zh: co-deposit 的过去式/过去分词：在一次工艺中把两种或以上物质一起沉积。

examples.en: During electroplating, nickel was co-deposited with phosphorus.
examples.zh: 在电镀过程中，镍与磷被一起沉积。

examples.en: The researchers co-deposited the molecules onto glass to control the surface properties.
examples.zh: 研究人员把这些分子共同沉积到玻璃上，以控制表面性质。

extraExplanation: “co-”表示“共同、一起”。“co-deposited”常见于材料科学/半导体/电化学语境，如薄膜沉积（PVD/CVD）或电沉积（电镀）中，强调“同时沉积、形成混合层/合金/复合涂层”。
日常英语里较少用；多见于论文、实验报告和工艺说明。

summary.en: Co-deposition means depositing two or more materials simultaneously onto the same surface, often to make an alloy or composite film/coating.
summary.zh: Co-deposition 指将两种或多种材料同时沉积在同一表面上，常用于制备合金或复合薄膜/涂层。

definition.en: the process of depositing two or more substances at the same time onto a surface (for example, forming a mixed or layered coating/film)
definition.zh: （材料或化学中）将两种或多种物质同时沉积到同一表面上的过程（例如形成混合或分层的涂层/薄膜）

examples.en: Co-deposition is used to make alloy thin films with controlled composition.
examples.zh: 共沉积可用于制备成分可控的合金薄膜。

examples.en: During electroplating, copper and nickel can be co-deposited to improve corrosion resistance.
examples.zh: 在电镀过程中，铜和镍可以共沉积以提高耐腐蚀性。

examples.en: The team adjusted the gas flow rate to stabilize co-deposition in the vacuum chamber.
examples.zh: 团队通过调节气体流量来稳定真空腔内的共沉积过程。

extraExplanation: “co-”表示“共同、一起”。“deposition”在科技语境里常指“沉积/沉淀/沉积成膜”，所以 co-deposition 强调“同时沉积”。在薄膜制程（如 PVD、CVD、溅射、蒸发）和电化学沉积中很常见，用来得到合金、掺杂材料或复合涂层。
有时也写作 codeposition（不加连字符）。不同领域里“沉积”的具体机制可能不同，但核心含义都是“多种组分在同一过程中一起被沉积到基底/电极上”。

summary.en: Co-derived means “derived together from the same source or origin.”
summary.zh: co-derived 指“共同源自同一来源/起源（同源）”。

definition.en: Derived together from the same source, ancestor, or original material (often used in biology, chemistry, and linguistics).
definition.zh: 共同源自同一来源、祖先或原始材料（常用于生物学、化学、语言学等领域）。

examples.en: These two proteins are co-derived from a single ancestral gene.
examples.zh: 这两种蛋白质共同源自同一个祖先基因。

examples.en: In historical linguistics, the words are considered co-derived from the same root.
examples.zh: 在历史语言学中，这些词被认为共同源自同一个词根。

definition.en: Formed by combining two or more inputs that originate from the same underlying source or process.
definition.zh: 由来自同一基础来源或过程的两个或多个输入共同形成。

examples.en: The final product is a co-derived mixture of compounds produced in the same reaction pathway.
examples.zh: 最终产物是由同一反应途径产生的化合物共同形成的混合物。

examples.en: Their conclusions were co-derived from the same dataset and methodology.
examples.zh: 他们的结论是从同一数据集和方法中共同推导出来的。

extraExplanation: “co-”表示“共同、一起”，而“derived”来自 derive（获得/推导/源自）。因此 co-derived 强调“同源”或“共同推导”。
该词多见于学术写作（如 biology/chemistry/linguistics）。日常英语里更常说 from the same source（来自同一来源）或 derived from the same origin（源自同一起源）。
连字符常用于修饰名词时（co-derived traits），放在谓语位置时也可能写作 co derived/co-derived；是否加连字符取决于出版/期刊风格。

summary.en: A co-descendant is someone who shares the same ancestor with another person.
summary.zh: co-descendant 指与他人出自同一祖先的后裔。

definition.en: a person who shares the same ancestor with another person; someone descended from the same forebear
definition.zh: 同源后裔；与他人出自同一祖先的人

examples.en: DNA matches can help you identify a co-descendant of your great-grandparents.
examples.zh: DNA 匹配结果可以帮助你找到与你曾祖父母同出一脉的后裔。

examples.en: The archive lists several co-descendants of the original landowner.
examples.zh: 档案中列出了该土地最初所有者的几位同源后裔。

extraExplanation: “co-”表示“共同、一起”，“descendant”表示“后代”。“co-descendant”常见于家谱研究（genealogy）、历史研究或法律语境中，用来强调“和某人一样同属某个祖先的后裔”。
日常英语里更常说“we’re related,” “we share an ancestor,” 或 “we’re descendants of the same person”。写作时也有人不用连字符写作“codescendant”，但“co-descendant”更清晰。

summary.en: Co-design means creating a product, service, or plan together with others—especially the people who will use it.
summary.zh: Co-design 指与他人一起（尤其与未来使用者）共同参与并完成产品、服务或方案的设计。

definition.en: To design something together with other people (such as users, clients, or community members), sharing ideas and decisions during the design process.
definition.zh: 与他人（如使用者、客户或社区成员）共同参与设计，在设计过程中共同提出想法并一起做决定。

examples.en: We co-designed the app with students to make it easier to use.
examples.zh: 我们与学生共同设计这款应用，让它更好用。

examples.en: The city co-designed the new park with local residents.
examples.zh: 市政府与当地居民共同设计新公园。

examples.en: Co-design helps teams build solutions that fit real needs.
examples.zh: 共同设计能帮助团队做出更符合真实需求的方案。

definition.en: A process or approach where a product, service, or plan is designed collaboratively by multiple stakeholders, especially including the people who will use it.
definition.zh: 一种设计流程／方法：由多方利害关系人共同协作完成设计，尤其强调让未来的使用者参与其中。

examples.en: Co-design is central to modern service design.
examples.zh: 共同设计是现代服务设计的核心方法之一。

examples.en: They used co-design to improve the hospital’s patient experience.
examples.zh: 他们用共同设计来改善医院的病人体验。

extraExplanation: “co-”表示“共同、一起”，常见于cooperate（合作）、coauthor（合著）等词。
写法上可见co-design、co design、codesign；在产品/服务设计领域，带连字符的co-design很常见，用来强调“共同参与”的过程。
co-design常用于设计思维（design thinking）、服务设计（service design）、公共政策与社区项目等语境，强调不是“替别人设计”，而是“和别人一起设计”。

summary.en: Co-designing means designing something together with others as partners in the process.
summary.zh: co-designing 指与他人作为伙伴一起参与并完成设计的过程。

definition.en: working together with other people (such as users, clients, or teammates) to design something jointly; collaborative designing
definition.zh: 与他人（如用户、客户或团队成员）一起共同进行设计；协作式设计

examples.en: We are co-designing the app with teachers and students to make it easier to use.
examples.zh: 我们正与老师和学生共同设计这款应用，让它更容易使用。

examples.en: The team spent two weeks co-designing a new packaging concept with the brand partner.
examples.zh: 团队花了两周时间与品牌合作方共同设计新的包装概念。

examples.en: Co-designing solutions often leads to fewer misunderstandings later.
examples.zh: 共同设计解决方案往往能减少后续的误解。

extraExplanation: “co-”前缀表示“共同、一起”（如 co-worker 同事，co-founder 联合创始人）。因此 co-design 的核心含义是“共同参与设计”，常见于产品设计、服务设计与“参与式设计（participatory design）/设计思维”等语境。
拼写上既常见连字符形式 co-designing，也常见不加连字符的 codesigning（较少见）。在正式写作中用 co-designing 更清晰。

summary.en: Co-determination is employee participation in company decision-making, especially through representation on the board.
summary.zh: co-determination 指員工參與公司決策的制度，尤其是透過董事會中的員工代表。

definition.en: a system in which employees (often through unions or elected representatives) share in company decision-making, especially by having representatives on a company’s board of directors
definition.zh: 共同決策／共同決定：員工（常透過工會或選舉代表）參與企業決策的制度，尤指在公司董事會中擁有員工代表席位

examples.en: Germany is well known for co-determination, where workers can have seats on company boards.
examples.zh: 德國以共同決策制度聞名，員工可以在公司董事會中擁有席位。

examples.en: The union demanded stronger co-determination rights on layoffs and workplace safety.
examples.zh: 工會要求在裁員與職場安全議題上有更強的共同決策權。

examples.en: Co-determination is often discussed as a way to balance profits with workers’ interests.
examples.zh: 共同決策常被視為平衡獲利與勞工利益的一種方式。

extraExplanation: 這個詞最常見於歐洲（特別是德國）的勞資關係與公司治理語境，對應德語 **Mitbestimmung**。在某些制度下，員工代表可在監事會／董事會中占一定比例（例如大型企業可能接近一半席次），目標是讓勞工在重大決策（投資、併購、裁員、工作條件等）上有制度化的發聲管道。
英文也常寫作 **codetermination**（不加連字號），兩者意思相同；連字號形式較強調「共同」的概念。

summary.en: Co-determine means to decide or shape something together with others, and in business/law it can mean sharing formal decision-making power (often including employees).
summary.zh: co-determine 指“与他人共同决定/共同影响某事”；在商业或法律语境中，也可指“共享正式决策权”（常包括员工参与）。

definition.en: to decide, plan, or shape something together with another person or group
definition.zh: 与他人或某个群体共同决定、共同规划或共同影响（某事）

examples.en: Parents and teachers should co-determine the school’s safety rules.
examples.zh: 家长和老师应该共同决定学校的安全规则。

examples.en: The final schedule was co-determined by the team and the client.
examples.zh: 最终的时间表由团队和客户共同确定。

definition.en: (business/law) to share formal decision-making power in a company, especially through employee representation
definition.zh: （商业/法律）共同决策；指在公司治理中分享正式决策权，尤其通过员工代表参与决策

examples.en: In some countries, workers can co-determine major company decisions through board representation.
examples.zh: 在一些国家，员工可以通过董事会代表参与共同决定公司的重大事项。

examples.en: The law strengthened employees’ right to co-determine workplace policies.
examples.zh: 该法律加强了员工对工作场所政策的共同决定权。

extraExplanation: “co-”表示“共同、一起”。“co-determine”常用连字符写作 co-determine，尤其在正式写作中；也可能写作 codetermine。
在公司治理语境里，它常与名词“co-determination（共同决定/共同决策）”相关，尤其让人联想到德国的“Mitbestimmung（共同决定制度）”：员工通过工会或员工代表参与董事会/监事会决策。

summary.en: Co-determined means “jointly decided or influenced by more than one person or factor.”
summary.zh: co-determined 指“由两方或多方共同决定或共同影响”。

definition.en: Decided, shaped, or controlled jointly by two or more people, factors, or processes (not by just one).
definition.zh: 由两方或多方共同决定、共同塑造或共同影响（而不是单方面决定）。

examples.en: The final schedule was co-determined by the teachers and the students.
examples.zh: 最终的时间表由老师和学生共同决定。

examples.en: In many careers, success is co-determined by skill and opportunity.
examples.zh: 在许多职业中，成功是由能力与机会共同决定的。

examples.en: The project’s outcome was co-determined by funding and community support.
examples.zh: 项目的结果由资金和社区支持共同决定。

definition.en: Past form of “co-determine”: to decide or influence something together with others.
definition.zh: “co-determine”的过去式/过去分词：与他人一起决定或影响某事。

examples.en: The policy was co-determined during weeks of negotiation.
examples.zh: 这项政策是在数周谈判中共同确定的。

examples.en: They co-determined the rules before the game began.
examples.zh: 比赛开始前，他们共同制定了规则。

extraExplanation: “co-”表示“共同、一起”。“co-determined”常见于学术或正式写作（如经济学、社会科学、政策讨论），强调结果不是单一因素造成，而是多个主体或因素共同作用的结果。
拼写上可见 co-determined（带连字符）或 codetermined（不带连字符）；带连字符在正式文本中更常见，也更清晰。

summary.en: Co-detonation means two or more explosive charges detonating at the same time, intentionally or because one triggers another.
summary.zh: co-detonation 指两处或多处装药同时爆炸，可能是计划的同步起爆，也可能是一个爆炸带动另一个。

definition.en: the detonation (explosion) of two or more explosive charges at the same time, either by design or because one blast triggers another nearby
definition.zh: 两处或多处炸药（装药）同时爆炸；可以是人为设计的同步起爆，也可能是一个爆炸引发附近装药一起爆炸

examples.en: Engineers planned the co-detonation to maximize the force in a single moment.
examples.zh: 工程师计划同步起爆，以在同一瞬间把力量最大化。

examples.en: Poor spacing between charges can increase the risk of co-detonation.
examples.zh: 装药间距不合理会增加同时爆炸的风险。

extraExplanation: “co-”表示“共同、一起”，因此 co-detonation 字面意思就是“共同爆炸/同时起爆”。在爆破工程（采矿、拆除）里它常指“按计划的同步起爆”；在安全语境中也可能指“因冲击波、碎片或热量导致相邻装药被带爆”，这时有时会和 sympathetic detonation（感应/殉爆）一起讨论，但 sympathetic detonation 更强调“被带爆”的原因与机制。

summary.en: Co-develop means to develop something jointly with others.
summary.zh: co-develop 指与他人共同开发某事物。

definition.en: to develop something together with another person, team, or organization (sharing ideas, work, and responsibility)
definition.zh: 与他人、团队或机构共同开发（共同投入想法、工作与责任）

examples.en: The two companies co-develop a new battery for electric cars.
examples.zh: 这两家公司共同开发一款用于电动车的新电池。

examples.en: We’re co-developing the app with a university research lab.
examples.zh: 我们正与一所大学的研究实验室共同开发这款应用。

examples.en: The author co-developed the story with a screenwriter.
examples.zh: 这位作者与一位编剧共同创作并发展了这个故事。

extraExplanation: “co-”表示“共同、合作”，常用于商业、科技与产品领域，如 co-develop a product / technology / curriculum。
拼写上常见连字符形式 co-develop；也有人写作 codevelop（较少见）。作动词时，过去式/过去分词通常写作 co-developed。

summary.en: “Co-developed” means developed together by two or more people or organizations.
summary.zh: “Co-developed”表示由两方或多方共同开发／共同研制。

definition.en: made or created together by two or more people, groups, or companies
definition.zh: 由两方或多方共同开发／共同研制的

examples.en: This app was co-developed by a university and a startup.
examples.zh: 这款应用是由一所大学和一家初创公司共同开发的。

examples.en: The new vaccine was co-developed with an international research team.
examples.zh: 这款新疫苗是与一个国际研究团队共同研制的。

examples.en: They released a co-developed product for the Asian market.
examples.zh: 他们推出了一款面向亚洲市场的共同开发产品。

definition.en: past tense / past participle of “co-develop”: to develop something together with another person or organization
definition.zh: “co-develop”的过去式／过去分词：与他人或其他机构共同开发（某物）

examples.en: We co-developed the feature with our partners.
examples.zh: 我们与合作伙伴共同开发了这个功能。

examples.en: The two teams co-developed a training program for new employees.
examples.zh: 两个团队共同开发了一套面向新员工的培训项目。

extraExplanation: “co-”表示“共同、联合”。写作上常见形式有 co-developed（常用于作定语，如 a co-developed product）或 co developed（有时不加连字符），在商业、科技、医药研发语境里尤为常见。
它强调“共同参与开发过程”，比 simply “made together”更偏向“研发/设计/迭代”的感觉。

summary.en: A person who develops something together with others; a joint developer.
summary.zh: 与他人一起开发某物的人；共同开发者。

definition.en: A person who develops something (especially software or a product) together with one or more other people; a joint developer.
definition.zh: 与他人一起开发某物（尤指软件或产品）的人；共同开发者。

examples.en: She was the co-developer of the app and wrote most of the back-end code.
examples.zh: 她是这款应用的共同开发者，并编写了大部分后端代码。

examples.en: We thanked our co-developers in the project credits.
examples.zh: 我们在项目致谢名单中感谢了共同开发者。

extraExplanation: “co-”表示“共同、一起”。“co-developer”常见于软件、科研或产品开发语境，强调多人协作与共同贡献。
书写上常见带连字符（co-developer），也有人写作不带连字符（codeveloper）或拆开写（co developer）；正式写作中带连字符更清晰。

summary.en: “Co-develops” means “develops something together with others,” often in business, tech, or research.
summary.zh: “co-develops”指“与他人共同开发/共同研制”，常用于商业、科技或科研语境。

definition.en: to develop something together with another person, team, or organization (share ideas, work, and responsibility)
definition.zh: 与他人、团队或机构共同开发（共同出主意、合作完成并分担责任）

examples.en: The startup co-develops a new battery with a university lab.
examples.zh: 这家初创公司与大学实验室共同开发一种新电池。

examples.en: She co-develops lesson plans with other teachers.
examples.zh: 她与其他老师共同制定（开发）课程计划。

definition.en: to work together to develop a product, plan, or system (often used in business and research)
definition.zh: 合作进行开发或研制（常用于商业与科研语境）

examples.en: Our two teams co-develop to move faster and reduce risk.
examples.zh: 我们两个团队合作开发，以更快推进并降低风险。

examples.en: The companies co-develop in Asia and manufacture in Europe.
examples.zh: 这些公司在亚洲合作开发，在欧洲生产。

extraExplanation: “co-”表示“共同、一起”。在美式英语里，co-develop常写作带连字符的“co-develop”，也常见不带连字符的“codevelop”。两种写法意思相同，正式写作中保持前后一致即可。
“co-develops”是动词第三人称单数现在时：He/She/It co-develops…；对应的其他形式有co-developed（过去式/过去分词）、co-developing（现在分词）。

summary.en: Co-dictatorship means a dictatorship shared by two rulers (often used critically).
summary.zh: co-dictatorship 指由两位统治者共同掌权的独裁体制（常带批评意味）。

definition.en: A system of government where two people share absolute or near-absolute political power (they rule together as dictators).
definition.zh: 一种由两个人共同分享绝对或近乎绝对政治权力的统治形式（两人共同以独裁者身份执政）。

examples.en: After the coup, the country was run as a co-dictatorship led by two generals.
examples.zh: 政变之后，这个国家由两位将军领导的“双人独裁”统治。

examples.en: Some analysts warned that the new power-sharing deal could turn into a co-dictatorship.
examples.zh: 一些分析人士警告说，这项新的权力分享协议可能演变成“双人独裁”。

definition.en: More generally, any situation where two leaders tightly control an organization and allow little or no opposition.
definition.zh: 更广义地说，指两位领导者严密控制某个组织、几乎不允许反对声音的局面。

examples.en: Employees said the company felt like a co-dictatorship under the two founders.
examples.zh: 员工说，这家公司在两位创始人手下像是“双人独裁”。

examples.en: The party’s co-dictatorship left younger members with no real influence.
examples.zh: 该党内的“双人独裁”让年轻成员没有真正的影响力。

extraExplanation: “co-”表示“共同、一起”，如 coauthor（合著者）、cofounder（联合创始人）。因此 co-dictatorship 字面意思是“共同的独裁统治”。
该词在新闻评论或政治分析中更常见，通常带有强烈批评意味，强调权力高度集中、缺乏制衡。写作中可用更中性的表达如 “dual rule / joint rule” 来降低情绪色彩。

summary.en: Co-dining means eating together—shared or communal meals, often organized as a social activity.
summary.zh: Co-dining 指共同用餐：与他人一起吃饭的共享/社区式用餐活动，常带社交性质。

definition.en: the act of eating a meal together with other people; shared dining (often organized or communal).
definition.zh: 与他人一起用餐；共同用餐（常指有组织的、社区式的共享用餐）。

examples.en: The community center hosts co-dining every Friday to help neighbors connect.
examples.zh: 社区中心每周五举办共同用餐活动，帮助邻里交流。

examples.en: Co-dining can make moving to a new city feel less lonely.
examples.zh: 共同用餐能让搬到新城市的人不那么孤单。

definition.en: describing an arrangement or event where people dine together (often as part of a shared-living or social program).
definition.zh: 形容共同用餐的安排或活动（常见于合住社区、社交项目等语境）。

examples.en: They offer a co-dining program for residents in the co-living building.
examples.zh: 这栋合住公寓为住户提供共同用餐项目。

extraExplanation: “co-”表示“共同、一起”（如 co-worker 同事，co-parent 共同育儿者）。因此 co-dining 字面意思就是“一起吃饭”。
这个词在日常英语里不算非常常见，更常见的说法是 “communal dining”（社区式用餐）、“shared meals”（共享餐食）、“dining together”（一起吃饭）。在宣传或项目介绍（如 co-living、社区活动、社交App）中更容易看到 “co-dining”。
写法上有时也会看到不加连字符的 “codining”，但 “co-dining” 更清晰，也更符合英文构词习惯。

summary.en: Co-direct means to direct something jointly with another person or people.
summary.zh: co-direct 指与他人共同执导或共同负责指导某事。

definition.en: to direct a film, play, project, or team together with one or more other people (sharing the directing responsibilities)
definition.zh: 与他人共同执导（电影/戏剧等）或共同负责指导某个项目（共同承担导演/指导职责）

examples.en: She will co-direct the documentary with an experienced filmmaker.
examples.zh: 她将与一位经验丰富的电影人共同执导这部纪录片。

examples.en: They co-directed the play, dividing the work: one handled actors, the other handled staging.
examples.zh: 他们共同执导这部戏，把工作分开：一位负责演员指导，另一位负责舞台调度。

examples.en: The episode was co-directed by two first-time directors.
examples.zh: 这一集由两位首次执导的导演共同执导。

extraExplanation: “co-”是前缀，表示“共同、一起”。因此 co-direct 的核心含义就是“与别人一起做导演/指导”。
写法上常见两种：带连字符 co-direct（动词）以及不带连字符 codirect（较少见）。在影视字幕/海报上更常看到过去分词形式：co-directed by…（由……联合执导）。
名词更常用 co-director（联合导演/共同负责人），而不是把 co-direct 当作名词使用。

summary.en: “Co-directed” means something was directed together by more than one person.
summary.zh: “co-directed”表示“由多人共同执导／共同指导”。

definition.en: Directed jointly by two or more people (often used for films, shows, research projects, or organizations).
definition.zh: 由两人或多人共同执导／共同指导（常用于电影、节目、研究项目或机构）。

examples.en: The film was co-directed by two first-time directors.
examples.zh: 这部电影由两位首次执导的导演共同执导。

examples.en: She co-directed the documentary with her longtime collaborator.
examples.zh: 她与长期合作伙伴共同执导了这部纪录片。

definition.en: Past tense / past participle of “co-direct”: to direct something together with someone else.
definition.zh: “co-direct”的过去式／过去分词：与他人共同执导／共同指导某事。

examples.en: They co-directed several episodes last season.
examples.zh: 上个季度他们共同执导了好几集。

examples.en: He has co-directed award-winning projects across different genres.
examples.zh: 他共同执导过多种类型的获奖项目。

extraExplanation: “co-”表示“共同、一起”。“co-directed”常作为形容词出现在片尾字幕、简历或新闻稿中：co-directed by… / a co-directed film。
拼写上既可用连字符“co-directed”，也可能看到不加连字符的“codirected”（较少见）。正式写作里用连字符更清晰。
在学术或机构语境中也常见近义表达：co-led（共同带领）、co-supervised（共同指导）、co-chaired（共同主持）。

summary.en: Co-directional means “in the same direction,” used in everyday contexts and in technical fields like genetics.
summary.zh: Co-directional 指“同一方向的/同向的”，可用于日常描述，也常见于遗传学等技术语境。

definition.en: Moving, pointing, or acting in the same direction as something else.
definition.zh: 与另一事物朝同一方向运动、指向或起作用的；同向的。

examples.en: The two currents are co-directional, so the boat moves faster.
examples.zh: 两股水流是同向的，所以船走得更快。

examples.en: Co-directional signs on the highway help drivers follow the same route.
examples.zh: 高速公路上的同向指示牌帮助司机沿着同一路线行驶。

definition.en: (Technical, biology/genetics) Oriented in the same direction along a DNA or RNA strand (for example, two genes transcribed in the same direction).
definition.zh: （技术/生物遗传）沿 DNA 或 RNA 链朝同一方向排列（例如两个基因的转录方向相同）。

examples.en: These two genes are co-directional, so their transcription proceeds the same way along the chromosome.
examples.zh: 这两个基因是同向的，因此它们在染色体上的转录沿同一方向进行。

examples.en: Researchers compared co-directional and head-on gene pairs to study replication stress.
examples.zh: 研究人员比较了同向与迎头（相向）基因对，以研究复制压力。

extraExplanation: 构词提示：co- 表示“共同/一起”，directional 来自 direction（方向）。因此 co-directional 字面意思就是“同一方向的”。常见近义表达有 in the same direction、parallel（平行的，语境不同）。
写法上也常见 co-directional / codirectional 两种拼写；在正式写作里任选一种并保持全文一致即可。

summary.en: A co-director is someone who shares directing responsibilities with another director.
summary.zh: co-director 指与他人共同承担导演或主管职责的人。

definition.en: a person who shares the job of directing a project, organization, or artistic work with one or more other directors
definition.zh: 与他人共同承担“导演/主管/负责人”职责的人；共同导演（或共同主管）

examples.en: She is the co-director of the new research center.
examples.zh: 她是新研究中心的共同主任。

examples.en: The film had two co-directors who split the work: one handled actors and the other handled visuals.
examples.zh: 这部电影有两位共同导演分工合作：一位负责演员表演，另一位负责画面视觉。

examples.en: As co-director, he helps set the program’s goals and manages the team.
examples.zh: 作为共同负责人，他协助制定项目目标并管理团队。

extraExplanation: “co-”表示“共同、合作”。因此 co-director 强调“共享职责与权力”，常见于电影/戏剧（共同导演）、大学与研究机构（共同主任）、非营利组织与项目管理（共同负责人）。
拼写上常见 co-director（带连字符）和 codirector（不带连字符）；在正式写作里，带连字符更常见也更清晰。

summary.en: Co-directors are people who share the role of director together.
summary.zh: co-directors 指共同担任并分担“主任/主管/导演”职责的多人。

definition.en: Two or more people who share the job and authority of being a director (for example, in a company, department, film, or organization).
definition.zh: 共同担任“主任/主管/导演”等职位、分担职责与权力的两人或多人。

examples.en: The co-directors agreed to split responsibilities: one handled fundraising, and the other managed daily operations.
examples.zh: 两位联合主任同意分工：一位负责筹款，另一位管理日常运营。

examples.en: The film was made by co-directors who brought different styles to the project.
examples.zh: 这部电影由两位联合导演合作完成，他们为项目带来了不同的风格。

extraExplanation: “co-”表示“共同/联合”。单数是 co-director，复数是 co-directors。
写作中常见连字符 co-director/co-directors，尤其在正式文本里；有时也会写作 codirector，但较少见。

summary.en: Co-distillation is distilling two or more substances together, often so one helps separate or carry the other.
summary.zh: 共蒸馏是把两种或多种物质一起蒸馏，常借助其中一种来带出或分离另一种。

definition.en: a distillation process in which two (or more) substances are distilled together, often so one helps carry or separate the other (for example, to remove an impurity or to collect a volatile compound).
definition.zh: （化学）共蒸馏：将两种或多种物质一起进行蒸馏的过程，常用来借助其中一种物质带出、分离或收集另一种物质（例如去除杂质或收集挥发性成分）。

examples.en: The lab used co-distillation to remove trace solvents from the product.
examples.zh: 实验室用共蒸馏来去除产品中微量的溶剂残留。

examples.en: During co-distillation, water can help carry a volatile oil into the distillate.
examples.zh: 在共蒸馏中，水可以帮助将挥发性精油带入馏出液。

definition.en: (figurative, less common) the blending or mixing of ideas, styles, or influences into one combined result.
definition.zh: （比喻，用得较少）把不同观念、风格或影响“混合融合”为一种综合结果。

examples.en: The novel feels like a co-distillation of folklore and modern realism.
examples.zh: 这部小说像是把民间传说与现代现实主义共蒸馏在一起的作品。

extraExplanation: “co-”表示“共同、一起”。“co-distillation”常见于化学与化工语境，写法多带连字符（co-distillation），也可能写作不带连字符的 codistillation。
在有机化学里常与“steam distillation（蒸汽蒸馏）”“azeotropic distillation（共沸蒸馏）”等概念相关：通过一起蒸馏来改变挥发行为，从而更容易分离或除去某种成分。

summary.en: Co-distributed means “distributed together,” and in statistics it can mean “having the same distribution.”
summary.zh: co-distributed 表示“共同分发/共同分布”；在统计中也可指“同分布”。

definition.en: distributed together with something else; shared or spread out jointly (often used in business, publishing, or software).
definition.zh: 与另一事物一起分发/发行/传播的；共同分布的（常见于商业、出版或软件领域）。

examples.en: The app is co-distributed with the device, so users get both in the same package.
examples.zh: 这个应用与设备一起共同分发，所以用户在同一套包装里就能拿到两者。

examples.en: The film was co-distributed by two companies to reach a wider audience.
examples.zh: 这部电影由两家公司联合发行，以覆盖更广的观众。

definition.en: (Statistics/Math) having the same probability distribution; identically distributed (often said of random variables).
definition.zh: （统计/数学）具有相同的概率分布；同分布的（常用于描述随机变量）。

examples.en: Assume the errors are independent and co-distributed across observations.
examples.zh: 假设误差在各观测之间相互独立且同分布。

examples.en: Two samples may be co-distributed even if they come from different locations.
examples.zh: 两组样本即使来自不同地点，也可能同分布。

extraExplanation: “co-”表示“共同、一起”。“co-distributed”多用连字符，尤其在作定语时（a co-distributed product）。作表语时也常见不加连字符的写法（The product is co distributed/co-distributed）。
在统计语境里，有时人们更常说“identically distributed（同分布）”；如果还强调独立性，会写成“i.i.d.（independent and identically distributed，独立同分布）”。
注意不要与“distributed”在计算机领域的“分布式（distributed system）”混淆：co-distributed强调“共同分发/共同分布”，不一定指“分布式架构”。

summary.en: Co-domestication is the idea that two species shape each other over time through a close, often mutually beneficial relationship (commonly discussed with humans and animals).
summary.zh: 共同驯化指两种物种在长期密切、常常互利的关系中相互塑造与改变（常用于讨论人类与动物的关系）。

definition.en: the process in which two species influence each other’s domestication over time, often through a long-term relationship with mutual benefits (for example, humans and dogs shaping each other’s behaviors and traits).
definition.zh: 共同驯化：两种物种在长期关系中相互影响、共同改变的过程，常见于彼此互利的互动（例如人类与犬类在行为与特征上相互塑造）。

examples.en: Some researchers describe the human–dog relationship as a form of co-domestication.
examples.zh: 一些研究者把人类与狗的关系描述为一种共同驯化。

examples.en: Co-domestication suggests that humans were changed too, not only the animals we kept.
examples.zh: 共同驯化意味着被改变的不只是我们饲养的动物，人类本身也可能发生了变化。

definition.en: more broadly, any situation where two living things (including plants, animals, or microbes) adapt to each other through close association, especially under human influence.
definition.zh: （更广义）共同驯化也可指任何两种生物（包括植物、动物或微生物）在紧密共生/共处中相互适应的情况，尤其是在人的影响下发生。

examples.en: In agriculture, people discuss co-domestication between crops and the microbes that help them grow.
examples.zh: 在农业研究中，人们会讨论作物与帮助其生长的微生物之间的共同驯化。

extraExplanation: “co-”表示“共同、相互”，domestication 是“驯化”。这个词常见于进化生物学、人类学与生态学语境，用来强调“双方都在被塑造”，而不只是人类单方面改变某个物种。
它与“coevolution（共同进化）”相关但不完全相同：共同进化强调基因与适应的相互驱动；共同驯化通常更突出在人类环境、选择压力与日常互动下形成的长期变化。

summary.en: Co-dominant means two forms (especially alleles in genetics) are both expressed, or more generally that two sides share dominance.
summary.zh: co-dominant 指（尤其在遗传学中）两种形式同时表达、互不掩盖；也可泛指双方共同主导。

definition.en: (Genetics) Describing two different alleles that are both fully expressed in a heterozygote, so neither one masks the other.
definition.zh: （遗传学）指一对不同的等位基因在杂合子中都能完全表达，彼此不互相掩盖。

examples.en: In the ABO blood system, A and B are co-dominant alleles.
examples.zh: 在ABO血型系统中，A和B是共显性等位基因。

examples.en: Because the alleles are co-dominant, the child shows traits from both parents.
examples.zh: 因为这对等位基因是共显性的，孩子会同时表现出来自父母双方的特征。

definition.en: (More general) Sharing dominance, power, or influence with another person or group; neither side is clearly in control.
definition.zh: （更广义）与他人或团体共同占主导/共同掌控；双方都不是唯一主导者。

examples.en: The company has two co-dominant leaders who make major decisions together.
examples.zh: 这家公司有两位共同主导的领导者，一起做重大决策。

examples.en: In the coalition, two parties became co-dominant and shaped the agenda.
examples.zh: 在联合政府中，两大党共同主导并影响议程。

extraExplanation: “co-”表示“共同、一起”。“co-dominant”在生物课里最常见，常与“allele（等位基因）”“trait（性状）”“heterozygous（杂合的）”一起出现。
不要和“incomplete dominance（不完全显性）”混淆：不完全显性通常表现为“中间型”（如红花×白花→粉花）；而共显性通常是“两种性状同时清楚出现”（如AB型血）。
拼写上也常见不加连字符的形式：codominant（尤其在学术写作里）。

summary.en: To co-dominate means to share dominance or top influence with someone or something else.
summary.zh: co-dominate 指与他人/他方共享主导地位、共同占据最强影响力。

definition.en: to dominate something together with another person, group, or force; to share control or influence at the top level
definition.zh: 与他人/他方共同占据主导地位；共同支配、共同掌控（某领域/局势）

examples.en: The two companies co-dominate the market for budget airlines.
examples.zh: 这两家公司共同主导廉价航空市场。

examples.en: In recent years, those two teams have co-dominated the league.
examples.zh: 近几年，这两支球队几乎共同统治了联赛。

examples.en: The region is co-dominated by farming and tourism.
examples.zh: 这个地区由农业和旅游业共同主导。

extraExplanation: “co-”表示“共同、一起”，所以 co-dominate 强调“不是一个人/一方独占”，而是“两个或多个主体同时处于主导地位”。常见于商业、体育、政治分析写作。
拼写上常见带连字符 co-dominate，也有人写作 codominate；含义基本相同，但带连字符更直观、也更常见于正式写作。

summary.en: “Co-drove” means “drove together/shared driving,” or (in rally racing) “served as the co-driver (navigator).”
summary.zh: “co-drove”表示“共同驾驶/轮流开车”，在拉力赛语境中也可指“担任领航员（副驾驶导航员）”。

definition.en: Simple past tense of co-drive: to drive together with someone, or to share driving duties on a trip.
definition.zh: co-drive（共同驾驶/轮流开车）的过去式：与他人一起开车，或在旅途中分担驾驶任务。

examples.en: We co-drove from Chicago to Denver and switched every two hours.
examples.zh: 我们从芝加哥到丹佛一路轮流开车，每两小时换一次。

examples.en: I was tired, so my friend and I co-drove the last part of the trip.
examples.zh: 我累了，所以我和朋友在旅程的最后一段轮流开车。

examples.en: They co-drove the moving truck to make the long drive safer.
examples.zh: 他们轮流开搬家卡车，让长途驾驶更安全。

definition.en: In motorsports/rally contexts, acted as a co-driver (the navigator who reads pace notes) during a race.
definition.zh: （赛车/拉力赛语境）担任领航员（co-driver），在比赛中负责导航、读路书/报节奏点。

examples.en: She co-drove for a rally team all season, calling out the pace notes.
examples.zh: 她整个赛季都为一支拉力车队担任领航员，负责报路书节奏点。

examples.en: He co-drove at the regional rally and helped the driver avoid a wrong turn.
examples.zh: 他在地区拉力赛中担任领航员，帮助车手避免走错路。

extraExplanation: “co-”有“共同、联合”的意思，所以 co-drive 强调“共同参与驾驶”。日常语境里更常见的说法是“share the driving / take turns driving”。
在拉力赛里 co-driver 通常不是“也在开车的人”，而是坐在副驾驶负责导航、计时、读路书（pace notes）的人；因此 co-drove 在该语境下常指“当领航员”。

summary.en: “Co-earthquake” is a rare term meaning an earthquake (or earthquake-related effect) that happens together with another quake.
summary.zh: “co-earthquake”较少见，指与另一场地震同时或紧密相关发生的地震（或与之同步的地震相关现象）。

definition.en: an earthquake that occurs together with another earthquake (for example, in the same sequence or closely linked in time/area); a paired or accompanying earthquake
definition.zh: 与另一场地震同时发生或紧密相关的地震（例如同一序列中相伴发生的地震）；伴随地震

examples.en: Scientists studied the mainshock and its co-earthquake to understand how stress moved along the fault.
examples.zh: 科学家研究主震及其伴随地震，以了解应力如何沿断层转移。

examples.en: A smaller co-earthquake happened minutes after the first quake, shaking nearby towns again.
examples.zh: 第一场地震发生后几分钟，又出现了一次较小的伴随地震，使附近城镇再次晃动。

definition.en: occurring together with an earthquake; related to an accompanying earthquake event
definition.zh: 与地震同时发生的；与伴随地震事件相关的

examples.en: The report described co-earthquake ground changes near the river.
examples.zh: 报告描述了河边与地震同步发生的地表变化。

extraExplanation: “co-”是前缀，表示“共同、同时”。“co-earthquake”并不是日常英语里的常用词，更常见的专业表达有“co-seismic”（同震的、与地震同时发生的）或直接说“a companion earthquake / a related earthquake / an aftershock（余震）”。如果你想表达“主震后的余震”，用“aftershock”通常更自然。

summary.en: “Co-ed” most commonly means a mixed-gender school (adj.), and it can also mean a female student, especially in older usage (n.).
summary.zh: “co-ed”最常指“男女同校的”（形容词）；也可指“女学生”，但这种名词用法较偏旧。

definition.en: A female student at a school or college (especially one that was once only for men).
definition.zh: （尤指曾经只收男生的学校里的）女学生。

examples.en: In the 1950s, only a few co-eds were admitted to the university.
examples.zh: 在20世纪50年代，只有少数女学生被大学录取。

examples.en: He wrote letters home describing life with the new co-eds on campus.
examples.zh: 他写信回家，描述校园里新来的女学生带来的变化。

definition.en: Having both male and female students; mixed-gender.
definition.zh: 男女同校的；混合性别的。

examples.en: They decided to send their child to a co-ed school.
examples.zh: 他们决定把孩子送到一所男女同校的学校。

examples.en: The college became co-ed in 1972.
examples.zh: 这所学院在1972年开始男女同校。

extraExplanation: “co-ed”来自“coeducational（男女同校的）”的缩写。名词用法在美式英语里常指“女学生”，带有一定年代感；现代语境更常用“female student / student”以避免性别刻板印象。
写法上常见连字符 co-ed，也可见不加连字符的 coed。发音通常与“co-”+“ed”相连。

summary.en: Co-editing means editing something together with another person (or a team).
summary.zh: co-editing 指与他人（或团队）一起共同编辑某个作品。

definition.en: the act or process of editing something together with one or more other people (sharing responsibility for revisions and decisions)
definition.zh: 与一人或多人共同进行编辑的行为或过程（共同承担修改与决策责任）

examples.en: Co-editing a research paper helps catch mistakes and improve clarity.
examples.zh: 共同编辑一篇研究论文有助于发现错误并提升表达清晰度。

examples.en: They divided the chapters, then met weekly for co-editing and final decisions.
examples.zh: 他们分配各章内容，然后每周会面共同编辑并做最后决定。

definition.en: working with someone else to edit; to edit something jointly
definition.zh: 与他人一起编辑；共同对某内容进行编辑

examples.en: I’m co-editing the newsletter with two classmates this semester.
examples.zh: 这学期我和两位同学共同编辑班级通讯。

examples.en: The author is co-editing the anthology with a well-known critic.
examples.zh: 这位作者正与一位知名评论家共同编辑这本文集。

extraExplanation: “co-”表示“共同、一起”。“co-editing”常见于学术出版、期刊编辑、选集（anthology）或团队内容制作中，强调多人共同把关与协作。
写法上可见“co-editing / coediting / co-editing”。带连字符（co-editing）更清楚地提示这是“共同编辑”。

summary.en: A co-editor shares editing responsibility with one or more other editors.
summary.zh: co-editor 指与一位或多位编辑共同分担编辑工作与责任的人。

definition.en: a person who works together with another editor (or other editors) to prepare, revise, and publish written material
definition.zh: 共同编辑；与他人一起负责审稿、修改并出版文字内容的人

examples.en: She is the co-editor of the school newspaper.
examples.zh: 她是校报的共同编辑。

examples.en: He and his colleague served as co-editors of the journal for five years.
examples.zh: 他和同事担任这本期刊的共同编辑长达五年。

extraExplanation: “co-”是常见前缀，表示“共同、一起”（例如 coauthor 共同作者、cofounder 共同创办人）。
在出版与学术领域里，co-editor 常指与另一位编辑共享责任的人；有时会细分为 managing editor（执行编辑）、associate editor（副编辑）等不同职位。

summary.en: Co-editors are editors who share the editing responsibilities together.
summary.zh: co-editors 指共同承担编辑职责的编辑（复数）。

definition.en: People who share the role of editor and work together to manage, revise, and prepare content for publication.
definition.zh: 共同担任编辑工作的人；一起负责内容的管理、修改与发布的编辑们。

examples.en: The co-editors reviewed every chapter to keep the tone consistent.
examples.zh: 共同编辑审阅了每一章，以保持语气一致。

examples.en: She and her colleague are co-editors of the school newspaper.
examples.zh: 她和同事是校报的共同编辑。

examples.en: Please send your revised draft to both co-editors.
examples.zh: 请把你修改后的稿件发给两位共同编辑。

extraExplanation: “co-”表示“共同、一起”（如 co-founder 共同创办人、co-author 合著者）。写作中常见形式有 co-editor（单数）/ co-editors（复数），也有人写作 coeditor（更偏美式、不带连字符）。正式出版物中通常会在“About/Editorial Board（编委会）”里标注 co-editors。

summary.en: Co-editorship means a shared editor position or the period of serving as a co-editor.
summary.zh: Co-editorship 指“联合编辑”的职务或任期，即与他人共同担任编辑并分担职责。

definition.en: the role or position of being an editor together with one or more other editors (shared responsibility)
definition.zh: 共同编辑的职务；联合编辑身份（与他人共同承担编辑工作）

examples.en: She accepted the co-editorship of the journal and shared decisions with two senior editors.
examples.zh: 她接受了该期刊的联合编辑职务，并与两位资深编辑共同做决定。

examples.en: During his co-editorship, the magazine expanded its coverage of science and culture.
examples.zh: 在他担任联合编辑期间，这本杂志扩大了对科学与文化的报道。

extraExplanation: “co-”表示“共同、联合”。“co-editorship”常见于学术期刊、杂志或书籍项目中，强调多位编辑共同分工（如审稿、选题、统筹出版标准）。也可写作“coeditorship”。

summary.en: Co-efficacy is shared confidence that a team can succeed together.
summary.zh: co-efficacy 指团队或搭档“相信能一起成功”的共同信心（共同效能感）。

definition.en: A shared belief between two or more people that they can work together effectively and succeed at a task.
definition.zh: （两人或多人之间的）共同效能感：相信大家能有效协作并完成任务、取得成功的信念。

examples.en: In our study group, co-efficacy grew as we practiced explaining the material to each other.
examples.zh: 在我们的学习小组里，随着我们练习互相讲解内容，共同效能感增强了。

examples.en: Good communication builds co-efficacy because everyone knows what to do and trusts the team.
examples.zh: 良好的沟通能建立共同效能感，因为每个人都清楚该做什么，也信任团队。

extraExplanation: “co-”表示“共同、一起”。“co-efficacy”常见于心理学、教育学、组织行为等语境，用来强调“协作中的信心”，接近但不完全等同于“collective efficacy（集体效能感）”：前者常用于小团队/搭档关系，后者常用于更大群体或社区层面。
词形上它属于学术/研究写作里更常见的复合名词；日常英语中，人们更常说“team confidence / confidence in the team（对团队的信心）”来表达类似意思。

summary.en: A co-elder is a fellow elder—someone who shares the same elder role or rank, often in a religious setting.
summary.zh: co-elder 指“同工长老/同为长老的人”，强调与他人同等的长老身份或职分，常见于宗教语境。

definition.en: a fellow elder; someone who has the same role or rank of “elder” as another person (often in a church or religious organization).
definition.zh: 同为“长老”的人；与他人拥有同等“长老”身份或职位的人（常见于教会或宗教组织中）。

examples.en: As a co-elder, he helps lead the congregation and mentor younger members.
examples.zh: 作为同工长老，他协助带领会众并指导较年轻的成员。

examples.en: She consulted her co-elders before making the final decision.
examples.zh: 她在作出最终决定前先征询了其他同工长老的意见。

extraExplanation: “co-”表示“共同、同等”，如 co-worker（同事）、co-founder（联合创始人）。因此 co-elder 强调“同一层级/同一职分的长老”。
该词多出现在宗教语境（如某些教会的长老制度）或特定群体内部的称呼；在日常英语中不算常见。
书写上常见连字符 co-elder；也可能看到不加连字符的 coelder（较少）。

summary.en: Co-elute means two substances elute at the same time in chromatography, causing overlapping peaks.
summary.zh: co-elute 指在色谱中两种物质同时洗脱，导致峰重叠。

definition.en: (In chromatography) to come out of the column at the same time as another compound, so they overlap and are hard to separate or identify.
definition.zh: （色谱中）与另一种化合物同时从色谱柱流出，导致峰重叠、难以分离或鉴定。

examples.en: Two impurities co-elute with the target compound, making purification difficult.
examples.zh: 两种杂质与目标化合物共洗脱，使纯化变得困难。

examples.en: If the internal standard co-elutes with the analyte, the quantification may be inaccurate.
examples.zh: 如果内标与待测物共洗脱，定量结果可能不准确。

examples.en: We changed the gradient to prevent those peaks from co-eluting.
examples.zh: 我们调整了梯度条件，以避免这些峰共洗脱。

definition.en: (Less common, transitive) to cause two substances to elute together in the same fraction.
definition.zh: （较少见，及物）使两种物质在同一馏分/同一时间一起洗脱出来。

examples.en: The method co-eluted a small amount of lipid with the protein fraction.
examples.zh: 该方法使少量脂质与蛋白质馏分一起共洗脱出来。

extraExplanation: “co-”表示“共同、一起”；“elute”在分析化学里指“洗脱”（用流动相把样品从色谱固定相中带出）。在HPLC、GC、LC-MS等实验里，“co-elute”常用来描述两个峰时间太接近而重叠，这会影响定性（是否是同一种物质）和定量（峰面积是否准确）。常见解决思路包括更换色谱柱、改变流动相组成/梯度、调节温度或流速、或用质谱/二级质谱帮助区分。

summary.en: Co-embedded describes things that are embedded together in the same place or (in AI) in the same representation space.
summary.zh: co-embedded 表示“共同嵌入的”：一起嵌在同一处；在 AI 中也指共同嵌入到同一表示空间。

definition.en: embedded together in the same place or system; placed within something as a group.
definition.zh: 共同嵌入的；一起嵌在同一位置或同一系统中的；成组地嵌入某物内部的。

examples.en: The museum found co-embedded shells and stones in the rock layer.
examples.zh: 博物馆在岩层中发现了共同嵌入的贝壳和石头。

examples.en: In the device, the sensor and the chip are co-embedded to save space.
examples.zh: 在这台设备里，传感器和芯片被共同嵌入以节省空间。

definition.en: (Computing/AI) integrated into the same representation or model so that related items are learned or stored together.
definition.zh: （计算机/AI）共同嵌入到同一表示或模型中，使相关项目被一起学习或存储。

examples.en: Words and images can be co-embedded into one vector space for search.
examples.zh: 单词和图像可以共同嵌入到同一个向量空间中，用于检索。

examples.en: The model uses co-embedded features to match users with content.
examples.zh: 该模型使用共同嵌入的特征来匹配用户与内容。

extraExplanation: “co-”表示“共同、一起”。“embedded”常指“嵌入（到内部）”。因此 co-embedded 多用于学术/技术语境，强调“两个或多个东西一起被嵌入同一处/同一系统”。日常英语里更常说 “embedded together” 或 “embedded side by side”。
在 AI 语境中，co-embedded 常和 “embedding（嵌入/向量表示）” 连用，指把不同类型的数据（如文本与图片）映射到同一表示空间，方便比较与检索。

summary.en: Co-embodied describes an experience or meaning that is created and felt through bodies together, especially in interaction.
summary.zh: Co-embodied 指体验或意义在互动中通过彼此的身体共同生成与感受（常见于学术/艺术语境）。

definition.en: (In academic or artistic writing) physically present or experienced through bodies together; sharing embodiment in the same space or interaction.
definition.zh: （多用于学术或艺术写作）共同以身体参与或被体验的；在同一空间/互动中共享“具身性”的。

examples.en: In partner dance, meaning is co-embodied through touch, timing, and shared balance.
examples.zh: 在双人舞中，意义通过触碰、节奏和共享的平衡被共同具身化。

examples.en: The therapist and client build a co-embodied sense of safety through posture and breathing.
examples.zh: 治疗师与来访者通过姿势与呼吸共同建立一种“具身”的安全感。

examples.en: In some VR studies, presence is described as co-embodied when users feel their actions and another person’s reactions as one linked bodily experience.
examples.zh: 在一些虚拟现实研究中，当用户把自己的动作与他人的反应体验为一个相互连接的身体经验时，会把这种临场感称为“共同具身”。

extraExplanation: “co-embodied”常见于认知科学、现象学、舞蹈/表演研究、心理治疗与人机交互等语境，用来强调：体验不是只发生在“一个人脑中”，而是在两人或多人之间，通过身体动作、姿态、呼吸、触觉、空间距离等共同生成。
它不是日常口语中非常常见的词，更像是用来精确表达“共同的具身互动/共同身体经验”的学术用语。

summary.en: A co-emcee is a person who shares hosting/MC duties with someone else, or the act of co-hosting as an emcee.
summary.zh: co-emcee 指与他人共同担任司仪/主持人的人，也可作动词表示“共同主持”。

definition.en: a person who shares the role of emcee (master of ceremonies) with another person at an event
definition.zh: （在活动中）与他人共同担任司仪/主持人的人；联合主持人

examples.en: Tonight’s awards show has two co-emcees.
examples.zh: 今晚的颁奖典礼有两位联合主持人。

examples.en: She served as co-emcee for the charity gala.
examples.zh: 她担任了慈善晚宴的联合主持人。

examples.en: My co-emcee will introduce the guests, and I’ll handle the games.
examples.zh: 我的联合主持人会介绍嘉宾，我来负责互动游戏。

definition.en: to act as an emcee together with someone else
definition.zh: 与他人共同主持（活动）

examples.en: They will co-emcee the conference opening ceremony.
examples.zh: 他们将共同主持大会开幕式。

examples.en: Would you co-emcee with me at the school talent show?
examples.zh: 你愿意和我一起主持学校才艺秀吗？

extraExplanation: “emcee”是把字母“MC”读出来（M.C.），而MC来自“master of ceremonies”（典礼/活动主持人）。因此“co-emcee”就是“共同担任MC的人/共同主持”。书写上也常见 co-host（更通用）、co-MC（更口语/活动场景）等。

summary.en: A co-emperor is a person who shares imperial rule and the title of emperor with another emperor at the same time.
summary.zh: co-emperor 指与另一位皇帝在同一时期共享“皇帝”头衔与统治权的共治者。

definition.en: A ruler who shares the title and authority of emperor with another emperor at the same time (often in the same empire).
definition.zh: “共治皇帝；共帝”：与另一位皇帝在同一时期共同拥有“皇帝”头衔并共享统治权的人（常见于同一帝国）。

examples.en: In some periods of the Roman Empire, a co-emperor governed alongside another emperor.
examples.zh: 在罗马帝国的某些时期，会出现一位共治皇帝与另一位皇帝共同执政。

examples.en: The general was named co-emperor to help stabilize the succession.
examples.zh: 这位将军被立为共治皇帝，以帮助稳定王位继承。

examples.en: As co-emperor, he controlled the army while his partner focused on administration.
examples.zh: 作为共治皇帝，他掌控军队，而他的共治者则主要处理政务。

extraExplanation: “co-”前缀表示“共同、一起”（如 co-founder 共同创办人、coauthor 合著者）。因此 co-emperor 字面意思就是“共同的皇帝”。
历史语境中，类似“共治”的安排常用于分担治理压力或解决继承与权力过渡问题；罗马帝国晚期的“四帝共治”等制度常被提到作为相关背景。

summary.en: “Co-employ” means to employ someone jointly with another employer, often in staffing/HR contexts.
summary.zh: “Co-employ”指与另一家单位共同雇用同一名员工，常见于劳务派遣/人力资源语境。

definition.en: to employ (a person) jointly with another employer; to share employment responsibilities for the same worker
definition.zh: （两家或多家单位）共同雇用（某人）；共同承担对同一名员工的雇佣责任

examples.en: The staffing agency and the client company co-employ the temporary worker.
examples.zh: 劳务派遣公司和用工企业共同雇用这名临时工。

examples.en: Some contracts say the agency may co-employ workers for payroll and benefits purposes.
examples.zh: 有些合同规定，为了发薪与福利等事项，派遣机构可能与用工方共同雇用员工。

definition.en: to use or apply together in the same task or plan (rare)
definition.zh: （较少见）把……共同使用；在同一任务或计划中合并运用

examples.en: The project co-employed data analysis and field interviews.
examples.zh: 这个项目把数据分析和实地访谈结合使用。

extraExplanation: “co-employ”在日常英语里不算常见，更常见的是名词/形容词形式“co-employment”（共同雇佣）或“co-employed”。它多出现在人力资源、劳务派遣（staffing）和外包（outsourcing）的语境中，强调两方对同一员工在用工管理、合规、税务或福利方面的责任可能会“共同承担”。

summary.en: Co-employed describes people employed together, or someone jointly employed by two employers (formal/HR usage).
summary.zh: co-employed 指“共同受雇的/同在一处受雇的”，也可指“由两家雇主联合聘用的”（较正式、人事语境）。

definition.en: (In the same organization) employed together with someone else; sharing an employer or workplace.
definition.zh: （在同一机构中）与他人共同受雇的；同在一处工作、同一雇主名下的。

examples.en: The co-employed researchers share the same lab but work on different projects.
examples.zh: 这些共同受雇的研究人员在同一个实验室，但做不同的项目。

examples.en: Co-employed staff often follow the same workplace rules and schedule.
examples.zh: 共同受雇的员工通常遵守同样的工作规定和作息安排。

definition.en: (Past participle) employed jointly by two organizations or employers (often in a shared role).
definition.zh: （过去分词用法）被两家机构/雇主联合聘用的（常见于共享岗位）。

examples.en: She is co-employed by the university and the hospital as a clinical instructor.
examples.zh: 她由大学和医院联合聘用，担任临床指导老师。

examples.en: The engineer was co-employed through a partnership program.
examples.zh: 这位工程师通过合作项目被联合聘用。

extraExplanation: “co-”表示“共同、一起”（如 co-worker 同事，co-author 合著者）。因此 co-employed 多用于正式或人力资源/合同语境，强调“同一雇主下的共同受雇”，或“由两方联合聘用”。
日常口语里更常说 working together, employed at the same company, or co-workers。

summary.en: “Co-employing” means jointly employing someone with another employer and sharing employer duties.
summary.zh: “co-employing”指与另一雇主共同雇用员工并分担雇主责任。

definition.en: (present participle of co-employ) employing someone jointly with another employer or organization; sharing employer responsibilities.
definition.zh: （co-employ 的现在分词）与另一家雇主或机构共同雇用某人；共同承担雇主责任。

examples.en: The staffing agency is co-employing the workers with the client company.
examples.zh: 这家人力派遣机构正在与客户公司共同雇用这些工人。

examples.en: Co-employing a team can simplify payroll but requires clear agreements about supervision.
examples.zh: 共同雇用一个团队可以简化发薪，但需要明确的管理与监督协议。

examples.en: In some HR models, the PEO is co-employing employees for benefits and tax filing.
examples.zh: 在一些人力资源模式中，PEO 会为员工福利与税务申报而与企业共同雇用员工。

extraExplanation: “co-employing”常见于人力资源与用工合规语境，尤其是“PEO（专业雇主组织）/劳务派遣/外包”相关讨论。它强调“两个实体同时与员工存在雇佣层面的责任分担”，例如：一方处理薪资、税务、福利；另一方负责日常工作安排与绩效管理。
与普通的“hiring/contracting”不同，“co-employing”往往暗示更复杂的法律与合规关系（如工伤、劳动法义务、解雇责任等），所以合同条款与责任边界需要写得非常清楚。

summary.en: Co-enact means to enact or re-enact something together with others, often in role-play or performance.
summary.zh: co-enact 指與他人一起演出／重演某個情節或事件，常見於角色扮演或表演情境。

definition.en:
to enact (a scene, role, or event) together with another person or group; to re-enact collaboratively.
Examples: (EN) The students co-enacted a courtroom scene for class. / (ZH) 學生們一起合演了一段法庭情境。
(EN) The two actors co-enacted the argument to explore different emotions. / (ZH) 兩位演員一起重演那段爭吵來探索不同情緒。
definition.zh:
（與他人）共同扮演／共同演出（某段情節、角色或事件）；協作式地重演。
例：(EN) The students co-enacted a courtroom scene for class. / (ZH) 學生們一起合演了一段法庭情境。
(EN) The two actors co-enacted the argument to explore different emotions. / (ZH) 兩位演員一起重演那段爭吵來探索不同情緒。

examples.en: The students co-enacted a courtroom scene for class.
examples.zh: 學生們一起合演了一段法庭情境。

examples.en: The two actors co-enacted the argument to explore different emotions.
examples.zh: 兩位演員一起重演那段爭吵來探索不同情緒。

definition.en:
to enact together (with someone), emphasizing joint participation.
Examples: (EN) Parents can co-enact stories with young children to build language skills. / (ZH) 家長可以和幼兒一起演故事來培養語言能力。
definition.zh:
與（某人）一起演出／一起扮演，強調共同參與。
例：(EN) Parents can co-enact stories with young children to build language skills. / (ZH) 家長可以和幼兒一起演故事來培養語言能力。

examples.en: Parents can co-enact stories with young children to build language skills.
examples.zh: 家長可以和幼兒一起演故事來培養語言能力。

extraExplanation: 「co-」表示「共同、一起」。因此 co-enact 的重點不只是 enact（演出／實施），而是「一起完成」的合作感。
這個字較少見，常出現在教育訓練（role-play 角色扮演）、戲劇排練、治療或溝通訓練等情境；日常更常用 act out / role-play / reenact（搭配 together）。
拼寫上常見 co-enact（加連字號）以避免連在一起變成看起來像 *coenact*；也有人寫作 coenact，但較不常見。

summary.en: Co-enroll means to enroll in two programs or institutions at the same time (often in education).
summary.zh: co-enroll 指同时在两个项目或机构中注册（常用于教育语境，如双重注册）。

definition.en: to enroll (a student) in two programs, schools, or courses at the same time; to register together with another institution or program
definition.zh: （使）共同注册；（使学生）同时在两个项目/学校/课程中注册（双重注册）

examples.en: Some high school students can co-enroll in community college classes.
examples.zh: 一些高中生可以同时注册社区学院的课程。

examples.en: The university lets you co-enroll in a certificate program while finishing your degree.
examples.zh: 这所大学允许你在完成学位的同时共同注册一个证书项目。

definition.en: a shared enrollment arrangement (usually in education) where a person is registered in two programs or institutions at the same time
definition.zh: 共同注册；双重注册（通常指教育中同时在两个项目/机构注册的安排）

examples.en: Co-enroll may require approval from both schools.
examples.zh: 共同注册可能需要两所学校都批准。

extraExplanation: 在美国教育语境中，co-enroll 常与 dual enrollment（双重注册）相关：例如高中生同时修读社区学院或大学课程，学分可能同时计入高中与大学。具体政策因州、学区、学校而异。
拼写上常见 co-enroll（美式）与 co-enrol（英式）；动词第三人称单数为 co-enrolls，过去式/过去分词为 co-enrolled。

summary.en: Co-enrolling means enrolling in two programs, schools, or courses at the same time.
summary.zh: co-enrolling 指同时注册两个项目、学校或课程。

definition.en: (Education/administration) enrolling a student in two programs, schools, or courses at the same time (often for shared credit or services).
definition.zh: （教育/行政）同时把学生注册到两个项目、学校或课程中（常用于共享学分或服务）。

examples.en: The district allows co-enrolling so students can take college classes while finishing high school.
examples.zh: 该学区允许同时注册，让学生在完成高中学业的同时修大学课程。

examples.en: She is co-enrolling in an online course and a local workshop this semester.
examples.zh: 这学期她同时注册了一门网课和一个本地工作坊。

examples.en: Ask the registrar about co-enrolling if you need classes at two campuses.
examples.zh: 如果你需要在两个校区上课，可以向教务处咨询同时注册。

definition.en: (Less common) joining two plans or services at the same time (for example, program benefits or insurance coverage).
definition.zh: （较少见）同时加入两个计划或服务（例如福利项目或保险覆盖）。

examples.en: Some programs prevent co-enrolling in overlapping benefits.
examples.zh: 有些项目不允许同时加入内容重叠的福利计划。

examples.en: Check the rules before co-enrolling in two health plans.
examples.zh: 在同时加入两份医疗计划前先查看规定。

extraExplanation:
“co-”是表示“共同、一起”的前缀（如 co-worker 同事）。因此 co-enroll 字面意思是“共同/同时注册”。
在美国教育语境里，它常接近“dual enrollment（双重注册/双学籍）”或“concurrent enrollment（并行注册）”，但具体用法取决于学校政策：有时强调“同一时间在两个机构修课”，有时强调“同时拥有两边的学籍/记录”。

summary.en: “Co-enthrone” means to enthrone people together as joint rulers.
summary.zh: “Co-enthrone”表示让两人或多人共同登基、成为共同统治者。

definition.en: to place two or more people on a throne together; to make them joint rulers
definition.zh: 让两人或多人共同登基；立为共同君主/共治者

examples.en: After the old king died, the nobles decided to co-enthrone his two children to avoid a civil war.
examples.zh: 老国王去世后，贵族们决定让他的两个孩子共同登基，以避免内战。

examples.en: In the novel, the council co-enthrones a young queen and her uncle as co-rulers.
examples.zh: 在小说里，议会让一位年轻女王与她的叔叔共同登基、共同执政。

extraExplanation: 这个词比较少见，多出现在历史写作、奇幻文学或学术讨论中；日常英语里更常说："crown them jointly"（共同加冕）或 "make them co-rulers"（让他们共同执政）。
拼写上常见带连字符 co-enthrone，强调“共同（co-）+登基（enthrone）”。在英国等君主制语境里更容易出现。

summary.en: “Co-established” means jointly established or founded by more than one person or group.
summary.zh: “co-established”指由两人或多方共同建立/创立的。

definition.en: (Of an organization, project, rule, etc.) established together with one or more other people or groups; jointly founded or created.
definition.zh: （组织、项目、制度等）由两人或多方共同建立的；共同创立的。

examples.en: The charity was co-established by two doctors in 2015.
examples.zh: 这个慈善机构由两位医生于2015年共同创立。

examples.en: They co-established a scholarship program with a local university.
examples.zh: 他们与当地一所大学共同设立了奖学金项目。

examples.en: A co-established partnership usually has shared responsibilities and decision-making.
examples.zh: 共同建立的合作关系通常意味着共同承担责任并共同决策。

definition.en: To establish something together with another person or group; to jointly found or create.
definition.zh: 与他人或其他机构一起建立（某事物）；共同创立。

examples.en: She co-established the startup with her former classmate.
examples.zh: 她与前同学共同创立了这家初创公司。

examples.en: Several nonprofits co-established a network to share resources.
examples.zh: 多个非营利组织共同建立了一个共享资源的网络。

extraExplanation: “co-”是常见前缀，表示“共同、联合”。因此 co-established 强调“不是一个人单独建立”，而是多方一起创立/设立。
拼写上既可写作 co-established（较常见）也可写作 coestablished（较少见）；正式写作中多保留连字符以便阅读。

summary.en: “Co-establishes” means “establishes something jointly with others.”
summary.zh: “co-establishes”表示“与他人共同建立/设立/创办”。

definition.en: (Third-person singular of co-establish) to create, found, or set up something together with one or more other people or organizations; to establish jointly.
definition.zh: （co-establish 的第三人称单数）与他人或其他机构共同创建、设立、创办；共同建立。

examples.en: She co-establishes the startup with two classmates.
examples.zh: 她和两位同学共同创办这家初创公司。

examples.en: The university co-establishes a research center with a local hospital.
examples.zh: 这所大学与当地医院共同设立一个研究中心。

examples.en: He co-establishes clear rules with the team at the beginning of the project.
examples.zh: 他在项目开始时与团队共同制定明确的规则。

extraExplanation: “co-”这个前缀表示“共同、一起”。因此 co-establish 强调不是一个人单独建立，而是与他人/其他机构合作建立。
写法上既可用连字符 co-establish，也常见不加连字符的 coestablish；不同机构/写作规范会有偏好。
词形提示：原形 co-establish；第三人称单数 co-establishes；过去式/过去分词 co-established；现在分词 co-establishing。

summary.en: Co-establishing means setting up something jointly with others.
summary.zh: co-establishing 指与他人共同建立或共同创立某事。

definition.en: Establishing (creating or setting up) something together with one or more other people or organizations.
definition.zh: 与他人或其他机构共同建立、共同创立（某事物）。

examples.en: They are co-establishing a new research center with a local university.
examples.zh: 他们正在与当地大学共同建立一个新的研究中心。

examples.en: Co-establishing clear rules at the beginning can prevent misunderstandings later.
examples.zh: 一开始共同制定清晰的规则，可以避免之后的误解。

examples.en: The two companies focused on co-establishing a shared supply chain.
examples.zh: 两家公司专注于共同建立一条共享的供应链。

extraExplanation: “co-”表示“共同、联合”。“co-establish”在商业、组织合作、项目共建等语境里很常见。
写法上常见“co-establishing”（带连字符）与“coestablishing”（不带连字符）；带连字符更清晰、也更常见于正式写作。
近义表达可用：“jointly establishing / setting up together / founding together”。其中“founding”更偏“创立（组织/公司）”。

summary.en: Co-estimated means “estimated together,” especially for parameters in a statistical or economic model.
summary.zh: Co-estimated 指“共同估计/联合估计”，常用于统计或经济模型中指参数一起被估计出来。

definition.en: estimated together with other values or parameters (often in statistics, econometrics, or modeling).
definition.zh: （常用于统计、计量经济学或建模中）与其他数值/参数一起共同估计出来的。

examples.en: In this model, the treatment effect is co-estimated with the baseline trend.
examples.zh: 在这个模型里，处理效应与基线趋势是共同估计的。

examples.en: We report co-estimated parameters for price and income because they influence each other.
examples.zh: 我们报告价格和收入的共同估计参数，因为它们会相互影响。

definition.en: (past form) estimated something jointly with other unknowns or with another method/team.
definition.zh: （过去式/过去分词）与其他未知量一起联合估计；或与他人/另一种方法共同估计。

examples.en: The researchers co-estimated the missing values using both survey and administrative data.
examples.zh: 研究人员用调查数据和行政数据共同估计了缺失值。

examples.en: We co-estimated the model with another lab to compare results.
examples.zh: 我们与另一个实验室共同估计该模型，以比较结果。

extraExplanation: “co-”表示“共同、一起”。在学术写作中，co-estimated 常见于回归/结构模型语境，强调多个参数是同时在同一个估计过程中得到的（例如“参数相互依赖、需要同时拟合”），而不是先估一个再估另一个。
写作提示：如果你描述的是“与别人一起估计（合作）”，也可以用 jointly estimated / estimated jointly；但在计量与统计语境里，co-estimated 更强调“参数联合估计”的技术含义。

summary.en: Co-eternality means existing eternally together, especially describing equal eternal existence in theology.
summary.zh: co-eternality 指“共同永恒/同等永恒地存在”，多用于神学中描述同等永恒的存在。

definition.en: the state of existing eternally together; being equally eternal in time and existence (often used in theology).
definition.zh: 共同永恒；同等永恒地存在（常用于神学语境）。

examples.en: Some Christian writers discuss the co-eternality of the Father and the Son.
examples.zh: 一些基督教作者会讨论圣父与圣子的共同永恒。

examples.en: The creed affirms co-eternality within the Trinity.
examples.zh: 该信经肯定三位一体内部的共同永恒。

extraExplanation: 该词较少用于日常英语，主要出现在基督教神学与宗教哲学写作中，强调“在永恒性上并列/同等”，不同于“came after（后来出现）”或“was created（被创造）”。
构词上由 co-（共同、一起）+ eternity（永恒）+ -ality（……的状态/性质）组成。

summary.en: Co-evolutionary describes two things (often species) that evolve together because they affect each other.
summary.zh: co-evolutionary 指两个事物（常指物种）因相互影响而一起进化、共同变化。

definition.en: Developing or changing together over time, especially when two species (or systems) influence each other’s evolution.
definition.zh: 共同演化的；协同进化的（尤指两种生物或系统在长期相互影响下共同发生进化变化）。

examples.en: Many flowers and the insects that pollinate them have co-evolutionary relationships.
examples.zh: 许多花朵与为其授粉的昆虫之间存在共同演化关系。

examples.en: The study explored co-evolutionary changes between a virus and its host.
examples.zh: 这项研究探讨了病毒与宿主之间的共同演化变化。

extraExplanation: “co-”表示“共同、一起”。“co-evolutionary”常用于生物学与生态学写作，也可扩展到更广义的“相互影响、共同发展”，如技术与社会制度的共同演化（co-evolutionary dynamics）。
常见相关词：co-evolution（n. 共同演化/协同进化）、coevolve（v. 共同进化）、mutualism（n. 互利共生，常与共同演化有关）。

summary.en: Co-evolve means to evolve together in a mutually influencing way, especially used in biology and also in linked social/technology change.
summary.zh: co-evolve 指“共同进化/协同演化”，强调双方相互影响、互相塑造地一起变化（常用于生物学，也可用于科技与社会等领域）。

definition.en: To evolve together, especially when two species or systems influence each other’s development over time.
definition.zh: 共同进化；协同演化（尤指两个物种或系统在长期相互影响下共同发展变化）。

examples.en: Flowers and their pollinators often co-evolve over millions of years.
examples.zh: 花与传粉者常常在数百万年间共同进化。

examples.en: As the virus changes, our medical responses also co-evolve.
examples.zh: 随着病毒变化，我们的医疗应对也会随之协同演化。

definition.en: To develop together in a linked way (not only in biology), so that changes in one part shape changes in the other.
definition.zh: （不只用于生物学）联动发展；共同演进（一个部分的变化会塑造另一个部分的变化）。

examples.en: Technology and culture co-evolve: new tools change habits, and habits shape new tools.
examples.zh: 科技与文化会共同演进：新工具改变习惯，而习惯又塑造新工具。

examples.en: The team’s workflow and communication style co-evolved as the company grew.
examples.zh: 随着公司成长，团队的工作流程和沟通方式也联动发展。

extraExplanation: “co-”表示“共同、一起”，所以 co-evolve 字面意思是“一起进化”。常见于生物学（如捕食者与猎物、寄生虫与宿主、植物与传粉者），也常被借用到社会科学与科技领域，强调“相互影响、互相塑造”的动态关系。
写作中常见搭配：co-evolve with（与……共同演化）、co-evolution（名词：共同进化/协同演化）、co-evolutionary（形容词）。
与“evolve together”相比，“co-evolve”更强调双方存在互动与选择压力（你变我也变），而不仅仅是“同时发展”。

summary.en: Co-evolving means changing and developing together through mutual influence.
summary.zh: co-evolving 指在相互影响下共同变化、协同发展的。

definition.en: (biology, society, technology) evolving together through mutual influence; each side changes in response to the other.
definition.zh: （生物、社会、技术等）共同演化/协同进化的；彼此影响、相互适应而一起变化的。

examples.en: Humans and many microbes are co-evolving, shaping each other over time.
examples.zh: 人类和许多微生物在共同演化，随着时间彼此塑造。

examples.en: In the digital age, privacy rules and new apps are co-evolving.
examples.zh: 在数字时代，隐私规则和新应用正在共同演化。

definition.en: present participle of co-evolve: to evolve together with another species, system, or group, each affecting the other’s development.
definition.zh: co-evolve 的现在分词：与另一物种、系统或群体一起演化；双方的发展相互影响。

examples.en: The two species are co-evolving in the same habitat.
examples.zh: 这两个物种在同一栖息地中共同演化。

examples.en: Our tools are co-evolving with the way we work.
examples.zh: 我们的工具正在与我们的工作方式共同演化。

extraExplanation: “co-”表示“共同、相互”。“co-evolving / coevolving”两种拼法都常见；作形容词时常出现在学术或科普语境，如“co-evolving species（共同演化的物种）”。
该词常与“coevolution（共同演化）”相关，最典型的例子是“花与传粉昆虫”之间的相互适应：花的形态影响昆虫取食方式，昆虫的行为又反过来影响花的繁殖策略。

summary.en: A co-executor is someone who shares the legal responsibility of carrying out a will with another executor.
summary.zh: co-executor 指与他人共同承担法律责任、一起执行遗嘱并处理遗产的人。

definition.en: A person appointed (together with someone else) to carry out the instructions in a will and manage the deceased person’s estate.
definition.zh: （与他人共同被指定的）遗嘱共同执行人；共同负责按遗嘱处理遗产的人。

examples.en: My aunt and my uncle were named co-executors of my grandfather’s will.
examples.zh: 我阿姨和我叔叔被指定为我祖父遗嘱的共同执行人。

examples.en: As co-executor, she helped pay debts and distribute assets to the heirs.
examples.zh: 作为共同执行人，她协助偿还债务并把资产分配给继承人。

examples.en: The two co-executors must agree before selling the house.
examples.zh: 两位共同执行人在出售房子前必须达成一致。

extraExplanation: “co-”表示“共同、一起”。因此 co-executor 通常意味着有两位或以上执行人共同承担遗嘱执行职责。
在不同法域（州/国家），共同执行人的权限、是否需要共同签字、以及与遗产法院（probate court）相关的程序可能不同。具体问题常需要咨询律师或查看当地规定。
相关近义表达：joint executor（英式用法较常见）；相关概念：executor（遗嘱执行人）、executrix（传统上指女性执行人，现代多用 executor 作为性别中性用语）。

summary.en: Co-executors are two or more people who jointly carry out the duties of an executor of a will.
summary.zh: co-executors 指两人或多人共同担任遗嘱执行人，一起处理并执行遗嘱相关事务。

definition.en: People who share the legal responsibility of carrying out a deceased person’s will (also called “co-executors”).
definition.zh: 共同遗嘱执行人：两人或多人共同承担法律责任，负责按照遗嘱处理逝者的遗产事务。

examples.en: Maria and her brother were named co-executors of their mother’s will.
examples.zh: 玛丽亚和她的哥哥被指定为母亲遗嘱的共同执行人。

examples.en: The co-executors must work together to pay debts and distribute the estate.
examples.zh: 共同执行人必须协作偿还债务并分配遗产。

examples.en: If the co-executors disagree, the court may need to step in.
examples.zh: 如果共同执行人意见不一致，法院可能需要介入。

extraExplanation: “co-”表示“共同、一起”。“executor”在此是法律术语，指遗嘱执行人（负责清点资产、缴税/还债、把遗产分给受益人等）。
在很多法域中，共同执行人可能需要“共同签字/共同决定”才能处理某些事项；若配合困难，有时会申请由法院指定第三方或允许其中一人单独执行。
常见相关词：estate（遗产/遗产总额）、beneficiary（受益人）、probate（遗嘱认证与遗产处理程序）、administrator（无遗嘱或未指定执行人时的遗产管理人）。

summary.en: “Co-expanded” means “expanded together at the same time,” usually in technical contexts.
summary.zh: “Co-expanded”表示“共同膨胀/同时展开”，多用于技术语境。

definition.en: Expanded together with something else at the same time or in the same process (often used in engineering/materials, e.g., parts or layers that expand in the same direction or operation).
definition.zh: 与另一物同时或在同一工艺中一起膨胀/展开的（常用于工程与材料语境，如部件或层在同一方向/同一步骤中扩张）。

examples.en: The laminate uses a co-expanded foam layer to improve insulation.
examples.zh: 这种复合材料使用与其他层一起膨胀成型的泡沫层来提高保温性能。

examples.en: Co-expanded tubing can reduce gaps because the layers expand together.
examples.zh: 共膨胀的管材可以减少缝隙，因为各层是一起膨胀的。

definition.en: In electronics/packaging: opened or unfolded together (less common), implying two parts are expanded/unfolded as a pair.
definition.zh: 在电子/包装语境中：一起打开或展开的（较少见），强调两部分成对展开。

examples.en: The diagram shows co-expanded panels for easier assembly.
examples.zh: 图示展示了可共同展开的面板，便于组装。

extraExplanation: “co-”表示“共同、一起”，如 co-worker（同事）、co-author（合著者）。因此 co-expanded 直译就是“共同膨胀/一起展开”。
该词多见于技术写作与产品说明（materials, composites, tubing, packaging 等），日常口语里更常说 “expanded together” 或 “expanded simultaneously”。

summary.en: Co-extended means two things cover exactly the same range or set (often used in logic/philosophy).
summary.zh: co-extended 指两个事物的范围/外延完全一致（常用于逻辑与哲学语境）。

definition.en: (Of two things) having the same range, scope, or boundaries; covering exactly the same set or area.
definition.zh: （两者）外延相同、范围一致；覆盖的集合/区域完全相同。

examples.en: In this course, “prime number” and “number with exactly two positive divisors” are co-extended terms.
examples.zh: 在这门课里，“素数”和“恰好有两个正因数的数”这两个术语是外延相同的。

examples.en: The two categories are co-extended: every item in A is in B, and every item in B is in A.
examples.zh: 这两个类别外延相同：A 中的每一项都在 B 中，B 中的每一项也都在 A 中。

definition.en: (In philosophy/logic) having the same extension even if the meanings or concepts differ; coextensive in membership.
definition.zh: （哲学/逻辑）外延一致但内涵（概念意义）可能不同；成员集合相同。

examples.en: Some philosophers argue that two concepts can be co-extended but not synonymous.
examples.zh: 一些哲学家认为，两个概念可以外延相同，但并不一定同义。

examples.en: “Creature with a heart” and “creature with kidneys” are often used as an example of co-extended predicates.
examples.zh: “有心脏的生物”和“有肾的生物”常被用作外延相同的谓词例子。

extraExplanation: “co-”表示“共同/相同”，extended来自“extension（外延/范围）”。因此 co-extended 强调“范围完全重合”。
在逻辑里，extension 指一个词/谓词实际适用的对象集合；intension（内涵）指其概念内容。两个词可以“外延相同”但“内涵不同”，所以不一定能互换。
常见近义词：coextensive、coterminous（多指边界相同）。写作中更常用 coextensive；co-extended 多见于学术语境。

summary.en: Co-fatherhood is shared fathering—two or more men jointly raising and caring for a child.
summary.zh: Co-fatherhood 指共同父职：两位或多位男性共同承担父亲角色并一起养育孩子。

definition.en: the shared practice and responsibility of being a father, especially when two (or more) men jointly raise a child (for example, in a two-dad family, co-parenting arrangement, or blended family)
definition.zh: 共同父职；共同承担父亲角色与养育责任（尤指两位或多位男性一起抚养孩子，如双爸爸家庭、共同育儿安排或重组家庭）
